Life is short. Instead of quibbling over petty issues, make it a point to touch lives & hearts whenever you get the opportunity. Give, forgive & apologise. If you find difficulty doing it, make a commitment & start on this day of Eid. Channel your energy to things that matter.

Almighty. Accept our good deeds & acts of sacrifice. Wipe away our sins & forgive our shortcomings on this Day of Sacrifice. Grant us patience as we face a different world due to the pandemic. Only You know what lies ahead. Keep our hearts light as we entrust our affairs to You!

Wishing you a Blessed Eid-ul Adha. Eid of the Sacrifice of Prophet Abraham pbuh. Spare a thought for the less fortunate as you celebrate with loved ones! 
#EidMubarak #SelamatHariRayaHaji
#EidMubarak https://t.co/XV1beSv6vy

The Almighty knows things which you and I don’t. He pays attention. He’s aware who is talking about you behind your back, who is trying to bring you down. Why worry? You stand to gain a lot of good deeds on Judgement Day from those who have discredited you. Keep doing your best!

Almighty. Make this blessed day of #Arafah, a day of renewal of our faith in our heart & actions, a day of repentance & day to get closer to You. Forgive our sins, those which we commit knowingly & the ones we commit out of ignorance. May we never lose hope in Your Mercy! Aameen!

Almighty. As pilgrims gather in #Arafah on this Great Day of #Hajj, we pray that You grant them ease & accept their acts of worship. Keep them safe in their journey and protect each and every pilgrim on this very special #Hajj. Aameen.

Do something pleasing to the Almighty today! Give up something for His sake. Experience the true meaning of sacrifice. Do it sincerely with full submission. It will strengthen our faith. May we achieve the benefits of these days.May He accept the sincere efforts of those on Hajj.

Have you ever stopped to think that the news you’re spreading about someone might not be true? Slander is dangerous. Don’t engage in such acts. Remember, if you hear something false or dubious about someone, defend him. The Almighty will defend you in this world & the next.

Start by fixing yourself. To do that you need to acknowledge the problem, tackle it head on & resolve the issues within yourself. Aim to be a better version of you & work on it. Shift the focus to yourself. The Almighty will guide you step by step.

We may not have control over everything that happens in our lives but we do get to choose how we respond to things. Worry is a choice. Happy is a choice. It’s all about your attitude and how you wish to view the world. The choice is yours!

You can’t run away from your problems. That’s right. You can’t. The Almighty has sent it to you for a purpose. You need to accept it, get to the root of it & solve it. He’s there to guide you if you seek Him. He’s waiting to see how you respond. He wants to elevate your status!

Take time for self-reflection and introspection. Do it for self-development. But the truth is we’re too busy & when we’re not, we’d rather be analysing people’s lives based on what we see on social media. Remember, we don’t learn from experience but from reflecting on them!

Everything that happens in your life is preparing you for the next stage. Nothing happens by chance. Everything has been carefully crafted by the Master Planner. Your Creator. It won’t be a bed of roses but if you trust Him, He will guide you to move forward, one step at a time!

Every time you think you’ve  reached a dead end, remember that when you see a wall, the Almighty sees a way; an opportunity. Your faith should keep you going. It tells you that no matter what lies ahead, the Almighty is there to clear the path for you. You have to trust Him!

Are you this person? A mature one with a special heart who says that no matter how much someone hurts me, I'll still pray for him. It’s not easy. Most of us will actually do the reverse; start cursing & swearing the person when this happens. But such people do exist. Respect!

Use your mouths for good or bad. The choice is yours. Our words can help if used wisely or they can hurt. Choose to speak kind words that motivate & give hope & encouragement. Speak words of praise & keep the Almighty in focus always. Just don’t use your words to complain & harm!

No matter what you’re going through, always remember that the Almighty is in full control. He reminds you and shows you His Prowess by putting you in situations which you can’t control. So bear good patience and accept His Decree knowing that everything will come to pass!

Be wary of this trap. It happens to those who want to please everyone around them. They become people-pleasers and do it with such fervour, often jeopardizing their link with the Almighty. Don’t! It’s not worth it. Know your priorities. Protect yourself at all costs!

Don’t be mean to people. You really don’t want to hurt them in such a way that they complain to the Almighty, raise their hands to the Lord of the heavens and seek help from Him. That’s why it’s important to quickly seek forgiveness once you’ve wronged someone. Don’t delay it!

Today we lost a gem!
Here is a tribute to the late Uncle Muhammad Osman from Fomiss Shell in Evans Park - Ormonde, Johannesburg, South Africa.

https://t.co/ubKWrx7Zin

It doesn't matter how many sins you've committed. What matters is you’re remorseful and want to be guided. Seek the Almighty with sincere, heartfelt repentance. Don't let the sins of yesterday dictate your future. Clear your slate with Him today!
#mostblesseddays

Reminder: A compilation of my quotes entitled Motivational Moments 1 & 2 have both been available free of charge on my website for a few months now. Please make sure you have downloaded them.  Check my website https://t.co/AoQf1iTtyv

Are you content with life? Being content is different form being happy. Happiness doesn’t last; it comes & goes, it’s mainly from the outside. Contentment comes from a deeper place. You’re at peace with what the Almighty has bestowed on you, no matter what your circumstances!

Almighty. We pray for peace in our hearts. Although we’re not able to carry out the Hajj this year because of the pandemic, we ask You to protect the chosen ones who are on their pilgrimage this year. We ask you to facilitate their journey & keep them safe. Aameen!

Almighty. We ask You to renew our hearts with strength and purpose on this day. Forgive our past sins and help us get closer to You. We know You have our backs and have brought us this far. Guide us always for we can't make it by ourselves!

Guard your thoughts at all costs. Don’t let anyone mess with your mind. You become what you constantly think about. If you think you can’t, you probably won’t make it. If you think you’re a failure, you’ll end miserable; feeling sorry for yourself. You won’t get much out of life!

@M_abusufian7 Motivational Moments 1 & 2 have both been available free of charge online for a few months now. Please make sure you have downloaded both books.  Check my website https://t.co/iWdT6reHDZ

Don’t fret no matter what you’re going through. Nothing lasts in this temporary world. Hardship will turn to ease. Your prayers may be delayed but they’re never rejected. The best people often had difficult beginnings. But with patience & good attitude, they have the best ending!

Never tire of doing good, even small acts. We often hear people say that no one notices any of the good they do! But the Almighty does. He’s All-Knowing! So press on & do as much as you can, knowing the ten best days are upon us. Good deeds are magnified & the rewards multiplied!

Don’t waste the #mostblesseddays. Ten days is not a long time so be sure to fill your days with as much good as possible. The Almighty gives us these periods of spiritual boosts throughout the year. So purify your intent, make a plan & you’re on the way to accomplish much!

Times are tough. Yes. We’re all going though this. Things are not going the way we had intended. But trust that the Almighty is in full control. So what should you do? Restart, refocus, realllign, readjust your plans. Do it as often as you need to. Press on. Just don’t quit!

You might think the battle is too big for you. You’re overwhelmed by the cares & stresses of life but remember, it’s nothing to the Lord of the Worlds. Nothing is impossible for Him. Hand it over to Him & see how things unfold. He will take care of all that we cannot! Have faith!

One of our biggest flaws is pretending to be blind to our own shortcomings but we’re the first to jump down someone's throat when they make a mistake. Let’s change that. Learn to be more self-critical instead of always pointing fingers at others. Always start with yourself!

The choices you make are yours. You don’t need to explain yourself to anyone. But a lot of us feel this need to explain ourselves. Perhaps we want to be liked by everyone. Or to fit in with them. Whatever it is, stick to your decisions. If you think you’re wrong, correct them!

If you have problems sleeping at night or suffer from insomnia, use that time to get close to the Almighty in one of the most blessed of prayers. Don’t waste time on social media or gaming. You need to recognize that your sleeplessness is a gift from Him. Not everyone gets it!

One of our biggest flaws is pretending to be blind to our own shortcomings but we’re the first to jump down someone's throat when they make a mistake. Let’s change that. Learn to be more self-critical instead of always pointing fingers at others. Always start with yourself!

Do you find yourself getting more impatient? The truth is social media makes us impatient. It rushes us to want what others have, to be the person you see on your timeline, to live someone else’s life. Learn to be content with what you have. Appreciate the person that you are.

When facing a trial, remember that the Almighty’s constantly trying to refine us out of His Love & Mercy so that we can attain the highest ranks in Paradise. So quit asking “why me” when a calamity strikes. Face it with a good attitude so you don’t end up frustrated & bitter!

Whatever happens in life, keep going. Quitting is NOT an option because quitting is permanent. Setbacks and disappointments are not. They should serve to challenge and motivate you to strive even harder. The rewards are sweeter. Once you give up, that’s the end of the story!

Are you carrying emotional baggage from your past? Remember, it can destroy you if you allow it. The state of your mind is important. If you fill it with hurt, anger, pain, revenge and regrets, it doesn’t augur  well for your future. Shift your focus. Make a fresh start today.

We can all learn to listen more. It sounds simple but listening is a skill, an art & a discipline. Pay attention to what people say. Listen to the words. It’s coming from the heart. The mouth will reveal what the heart feels. Listening can save you from a whole lot of trouble!

What goes around comes around & sometimes the lesson is much harder than what you had expected. You reap what you sow tells you that whatever you do in life surely gets counted. Yes they do. So remember this; no matter how much life gets unfair sometimes, it cannot be unjust.

Almighty. Only You know the hardships & pain we’re going through. We hand over our worries to You as we’ve done before. If not for You, we wouldn’t be here right now. We ask You to bless those who’ve lost their way. Lead them back to Your Path. We’re thankful for Your Mercy!

Almighty. More than six months on and the pandemic is still with us. Many are prone to fear, anxiety and even despair. We pray for healing for those who are ill. Protect those who are most at risk. Give comfort to those who’ve lost loved ones. We place our total trust in You.

Stop jumping to conclusions. Things aren’t always what they seem. Don’t be too quick to form an impression. You perceive people who don’t mean to hurt you as having evil intent. This could affect your mental health in the long term. So do yourself a favour. Think good thoughts!

Beware toxic people. They come in many forms. When they can no longer control you, they will devise plans and manipulate how others see you. You’ll feel victimised but try and stay above the fray. Keep your cool. The truth will eventually out. The Almighty will see to it anyway!

Learn to detach yourself. From things, events and basically anything that robs you of your peace of mind. Most things worldly fit into this category. Remember, you don’t need to understand why everything happened the way it did. Let it go and let the Almighty take over!

You’re facing test after test and you’re at a breaking point. Hold on. Remember, a test can sometimes replace a worse misfortune or it could be a form of protection from something. Take your tests in your stride, knowing the Almighty wants only good for you!

The closer you try to get to the Almighty, the harder Satan will work to steer you away. His mission is to create confusion, fear; anxiety & panic over things you can't control. It’s all part of his plan. You need to be aware. Don’t let your guard down; not even for a second!

We’re all experts in people’s lives. Social media has made us such! We claim to know everything about others based on what they post online & what we hear. What we don’t know, we fabricate. We embellish. We forget we’ll have to account for everything on Judgement Day! Beware!

Beware of cancel culture. It happens when a celebrity or public figure is said to have done or uttered something offensive. A public backlash, often fueled by social media follows. Then the calls to cancel the person; to end their career.  Don’t be rash & act without evidence!

You’re getting anxious & having doubts, wondering if the Almighty hears your supplications. You forget that He knows what’s in your heart. He knows what you want even before you asked Him. Yet, He listens to every word, every plea that you utter. So keep asking. He’s All-Hearing!

When you find yourself in a certain situation which you never expected, don’t ask why. Accept it as part of the Almighty’s Plan. Keep your focus. Keep going. The Almighty knows what’s best for you even if you find it unpalatable. Looking back, you’ll be grateful it happened!

Spread this far and wide. Someone else’s success doesn’t equate your failure! Let’s break this ugly cycle and remember that the Almighty rewards each and everyone of us differently. Start being genuinely happy for others. Learn to cheer them on. Your turn will come!

Friends come and go, some leave footprints in your life while others leave unspeakable scars. Remember, a friend who tries to please everyone is a friend to none. They’ll keep mum when you’re wrongfully accused & most definitely not be on your side when the time comes! Beware!

Stop hating your body. Start  living life. Don’t believe what you see on social media that’s been doctored, filtered, photoshopped. What you consider flaws are celebrated by others. Your body’s a gift from the Almighty. He’s made you in the best form. So take good care of it!

Replace fear with faith. Worry with worship. Panic with peace. Always remember that the Almighty is totally in control. Surrender your insecurities, your nagging doubts and innermost fears to Him. He will set them right for you and your heart will find tranquility once again.

You’ll be content if you make this your life motto. If you’re below others, push them up. If they are by your side, guide them along. If you’re above them, reach out & give them a leg up. It’s not easy. It requires a sincere heart. You’ll attract so much goodness into your life!

Why do we always have to focus on what’s wrong, what’s bad, what’s lacking? Can we for a change, focus on the beauty that exists in the world even during these challenging times? Perhaps that’s why the Almighty made us all stay home to reflect on the blessings we have!

Understand the Almighty’s Plan. If you’ve done your best & things still don’t work out, move on. Know that He has something better for you. You may not be able to see it at that point in time, but that’s when you need firm faith. Better things and better days are ahead. Trust!

It’s natural to fear the unknown. As humans, we don’t have the answers to everything, but we must trust that the Almighty has planned our next step. Always remember that He who has brought us this far, will see us through every difficulty that comes our way!

Do you determine your worth by the size of your bank balance? Nothing material will bring you what you’re looking for. If you want a life of abundance, start with gratitude. Always be thankful. Find it in your heart to be happy for others. You’ll attract a lot more blessings!

Almighty. Calm our troubled hearts and let peace and tranquility reign once again. There’s so much noise and confusion around us that it’s easy to be distracted and lose focus. Many useless things demand our attention. Guide us. Keep us firm in faith; always close to You! Aameen!

Do your best to always use the best words when speaking to others & not to resort to insults, name-calling & harshness. This is even more important in the age of the internet! Today, many don’t give a second thought to what they say & write! Remember you’ll be held accountable!

Don’t let sadness consume you. What's this life but a mixture of sad & happy moments. Nothing lasts. That’s how it is. No matter what the Almighty places in your path, keep putting one foot in front of the other, even when it hurts. Trust that He only wants what’s good for you!

Trials are a gift from the Almighty. The hardship you’re experiencing might just be what earns His Pleasure. It might just be your ticket to Paradise. He’s watching to see if it softens your hardened heart; if it makes you admit He is the source of everything. He is in control.

The truth is we’re being favoured daily. The Almighty bestows His many blessings on us in various forms but often we don’t see them. The closed doors He’s protecting us from, opening new doors & opportunities, the new people He brings forth or removes from our lives. Thank Him!

Don’t beat yourself over something that happened in the past. Repent, seek forgiveness, move on. We all sin; we all make mistakes. But the best are those who learn from their shortcomings, focus on becoming a better version of themselves, leaving no time for futile activities!

When the Almighty takes something away from you, do you wallow in self-pity, thinking negative thoughts or do you have firm belief that He will replace it with something better? If you understood His Plan, you’ll be ever hopeful what’s to come will be better than what’s gone!

How do we react when we’re really upset; when it feels like our world has exploded? Acknowledge the feeling but don’t let it get out of control. Ignoring your feelings won’t make them go away, it just prolongs the healing process. Confide in the Almighty who controls everything!

Be mindful of the people you allow into your inner circle. Make sure you’re familiar with every one of them. Make sure the people in your boat are rowing in the same direction as you are. Remember, it’s better to be alone than to be with those who’ll jeopardise your Hereafter!

Whatever you’re going through, know that nothing is too big for the Lord of the Worlds. There’s no promise He can’t fulfill, no prayer He can’t answer, no obstacle He can’t remove, no heart He can’t mend, no illness He can’t heal & the list goes on! Stay encouraged; stay focused!

Growth is usually uncomfortable. It’s human nature to resist it because it takes you out of your comfort zone to a different version of yourself. So don’t be so hard on yourself. Cut yourself some slack, say a prayer. You’ll get there sooner or later if you set your mind to it!

Trust the Almighty to remove certain people from your life because they no longer serve a purpose. Accept it and allow Him to bring in new people into your life for the next stage of your growth. It may seem daunting but He knows what He’s doing. It’s your leap of faith!

Don’t waste your time confiding in others e when you have a problem. It’s been shown most don’t care. The rest wished you had it worse & only a small number feel sorry! Turn to the Almighty who is always there for you. He’s the Best Listener. What more do you need!

Focus on where you’re headed. Where you’ve been is the past. Don’t waste your energy reliving those times. There’s a reason the Almighty has brought you to where you are right now. Remember, sometimes those with the worst past have created the best future! Don’t lose hope!

The Almighty will bring you what you need. Don’t doubt that. Turn to Him. Cry. Beg. Ask for guidance, understanding, relief, forgiveness etc. Never underestimate the power of repeating your supplications with beautiful patience. Keep asking with full hope & you shall receive!

When you appreciate yourself, it becomes easier to appreciate others. When you lack self-acceptance, that’s when you have enemies. How else can you accept other people’s uniqueness if you can’t honour yours. Be true to yourself. Your journey is yours alone. Don’t imitate others!

You are what you focus on. What thoughts do you entertain in your head? What you allow to grow there will be your centre of focus. If you think positive thoughts, you’ll attract positivity into your life. That’s how it works. Don’t let negativity creep in! Do it consciously!

@TeamKhabib Brother Khabib. Our deepest sympathies & condolences to you and your family upon the passing away of your father & coach. May Allah Almighty grant him forgiveness & paradise! Aameen
إنا لله وإنا إليه راجعون. اللهم اغفر له وارحمه وسكنه في الجنة

Never underestimate the impact you have on those around you. The smile you gave, the helping hand you extended, the words of encouragement, that pat on the back etc. You don’t need a reason to be kind. Don’t wait. Just do it. Be guided by your heart, you’ll know when it’s right

Almighty. You are our refuge & strength. We place our trust in You especially during these tumultuous times. There’s so much violence, terror & political upheaval. We turn to You for  courage & hope. We need peace badly. Peace in the world & peace in the hearts of people. Aameen!

Everything has a beginning & an end. So why do we constantly stress over the state that we are in? There’s light at the end of the tunnel. The storm won’t last. The heart will love again. You’ll be amazed at what will come your way! Just ask the Almighty! The Eternal.

Even during your darkest days, don’t neglect the Almighty. You may think your situation is so complicated, there’s no solution; but the truth is the Almighty’s watching you. He wants to see how much you truly need Him. He will respond even to a silent prayer of a heart in need!

Don’t let your heartache consume you. Even when your pain felt like it would never go away. Just raise hands & cry out to the Almighty. Begging. Never doubt that He will respond. He will answer you immediately or when you least expect it. But remember, none of the pain will last!

Feeling lost and hopeless, bobbing on a boat in the middle of the sea. No sight of land. Feeling anxious not knowing what tomorrow holds. Feeling stuck when every move you make brings you to a dead end! Know that the help of the Almighty is near. Very near. Patience. Trust.

When a person turns away from the Almighty, another ten or more turn towards Him. The loss is never His but ours! Don't let yourself be replaced by others. Don't let your name be registered on the wrong side. It's not too late for a comeback. Turn towards Him & remain steadfast.

If you've gained a million likes by posting something disliked by the Almighty then you've lost! Leave a legacy you’ll be proud of on the Day you meet your Maker! Be responsible. Avoid anything immoral or sinful. If you can’t be responsible, then it's time to uninstall some apps.

Do yourself a favour. If you’re doing something to show off, don’t do it. It’s futile really. You might bask in momentary glory and people will admite you etc but honestly, it means nothing to the Almighty! It’s His validation that you need. That’s the only thing that matters!

Never doubt that the Almighty knows how tired your heart & soul are. So cry if you must. Weep your heart out if you must.  Take time out if you must. And when all is said and done, get up and walk again with courage. Stand firm knowing that He is always with you. Keep going!

Let’s face it. You will meet people who have the ability to bring out the worst in you. They may provoke you to say things you regret or pressure you to do things you wouldn't normally do. So stay true to your values and refuse to let others have a negative influence over you!

Surely we have enough of our own faults, leaving no time to look at others. And never judge people by their past. Why? Because people learn from their mistakes. People change. People move on. So don’t be stuck in your mindest & label people based on what you used to know of them!

Take constructive criticism in your stride. Often, in the heat of the moment, we tend to become defensive or even angry. Don’t! When there’s value in what’s being said, listen, identify your weakness & use it to your advantage. How else will you be able to improve yourself?

We all have our difficult days. But don’t use that as an excuse to treat your loved ones badly. It’s easy to take your feelings out on those closest to you, but that doesn’t mean they deserve it. Ask them for advice on how to deal with issues that are making you so irritated!

Some people will hate you because of what you’ve achieved in life. They want what you have but make no effort to do anything about it. They resort to spreading rumours & gossip about you. This is a test from the Almighty. Don’t retaliate. Let the good you do speak for itself!

The challenges you face in life can make you a stronger person. It also cultivates patience, a trait that is so loved by the Almighty. How you deal with challenges says a lot about you. Learn from them; apply them to your life or keep whining about it wishing it never happened!

You’ll never walk alone because the Almighty is always with you. Don’t you forget that. Always have hope in the face of discouragement, faith when all seems lost. Keep your peace in times of anxiety. Never let your feelings get the better of you when you fall or feel abandoned!

Very short clip. Just 4 minutes. 
Lessons from the Liverpool Victory - Mufti Menk 

https://t.co/g7wyCxsGY0

Don’t look for quick fix solutions. Short cuts will get you nowhere at least in your personal development. Moreover, quick fixes often backfire. The road to improving ourselves is one that’s long, continuous & persistent. It requires time, commitment, self discipline & hard work.

Are you among those who’ll spend most of your time fixing other people’s problems but your life’s a mess? Remember, charity begins at home. The best way to help others is to help yourself first. Invest your time in being a better version of yourself; everything else will follow.

Stop sweating the small stuff. Always remember how short this life is. All it takes is a split second for things to change. Learn to be grateful. Focus on His blessings no matter how small it is. The happiest people don’t have everything but they make the most of what they have.

Don’t be surprised if people try to detour you from your path when you’re doing well and headed in the right direction. It’s a normal human trait. Recognize it. Know their game and be on full alert. Stand your ground politely but firmly. Do what you must and don’t be distracted.

Almighty. Grant us the strength & the courage to carry on. A lot’s going on around us & it’s easy to become despondent. Our energy & motivation are constantly being tested. Don’t let the pressures of life push us down. Help us not to quit but to keep going at a steady pace!
@Cornerstore26 Much love habeebee. You just gave me an opportunity to add value to the discussion. You said nothing wrong. Have a lovely evening!

@Cornerstore26 😂Relax! When prayers are answered 30 years later & the excitement is so much that the pain of previous losses is forgotten, surely the lesson learnt glares us in the face! Never give up! Never! I didn't even take sides. Beautiful religious tweet. Your turn to pray if I may add!
Never give up! Never! #30YearsLater #Liverpool #PremierLeague

If your heart is not in the right place, you’ll never feel at ease. Purify your intenion in everything that you do. In this age of social media it’s easy to show off, get carried away & thrive on exaggerated needs for acceptance & validation. Protect your heart at all times.

The Almighty is the Controller of Hearts. He can change things in the blink of an eye. Don’t forget! He can heal what has been hurting for years in a flash. He can forgive as He wills. Nothing is beyond the Lord of the Worlds. Have faith that things will work out in the end.

Pay heed to whatever comes out of your mouth. Every word you utter matters. It really does. You may not think so but trust me when I say that the power of words is immense. It can make you or break you. It has the ability to change someone’s life! Choose your words carefully!

Man is always comparing. We often feel the other person is in a much better state than we are. Instead of accepting & appreciating what we have, we always find a way to look at what others have. Be wary. In trying to achieve something better, one may end up losing what one has!

Don’t worry about how people act. That’s on them not you. Always choose kindness, that’s under your control. Spread it far and wide, whichever way you can, even if it means giving a smile or a word of encouragement. Never underestimate how contagious being kind can be!

Learn to see the best in people. Believe the best about them too. No matter how much you disagree, try to find common ground. Spread peace. Quit fighting and bickering. Build bridges. Don’t hate. Don’t look down on anyone. Life’s too short to be doing otherwise.

Quit stressing yourself unnecessarily. If you’ve done your best, then leave it to the Almighty. If something’s out of your hands, it deserves freedom from your mind too!  Overthinking is not going to change it. Let Him work it out for you. Be prepared for the best outcome!

Big changes can be made in small steps. If you want the change to last, then you need more than a "just do it" mentality. It needs to be slowly cultivated till it becomes part of you. Then pray hard & ask the Almighty to guide you. If anyone can help, it's the One who made you!

Be wary of greed. And it’s not just about money. You can be greedy for material possessions, fame, compliments etc. Whatever it is, greed is a spiritual disease of the heart and is always destructive. So work on your heart to drive greed out. Learn to share, give generously!

The Almighty’s not only the source of love but the only One truly worthy of love! People will always let us down. Impermissible relationships will end in heartbreak. That’s why when we give them our hearts completely, we end up suffering heartbreak after heartbreak! Take heed!

Do you live your life to please others? If so, you’ll never know peace because nothing you do will be good enough. If you make decisions based on what others will think of you, it’s time for a rethink! Where does the Almighty figure in your life? Reflect! Live your life for Him

Life is really not that complicated. You reap what you sow. You get what you give. Whatever you’re criticising in others, exists in you. If you’ll only recognise it. So treat life well. What goes around comes around. Make sure you give goodness, kindness & all things positive!

Remember, Satan works the hardest when you’re about to make a breakthrough. You need to hold on to your faith, stay the course & draw yourself even closer to the Almighty. Resist the temptation, ignore the whispers; keep fighting. Build a barrier by seeking refuge in your Maker!

Go out of your way to become a humble person. Yes! Cultivate humility. Do it with a passion. Life will test you with anything & everything. It’s easy to be humble when being tested & trying to cope. But staying humble when the Almighty’s blessed you reveals your true self!

Almighty. We pray for those suffering in the world today. May the poor & vulnerable have sufficient access to their basic needs. May those who have lost homes & loved ones be treated with mercy & compassion. Replace their panic with peace & despair with hope! Aameen.

Whenever we find something that irritates us about others, it’s time to look inward, scrutinise ourselves. The tendency is to look outward. Resist the temptation. Remember, your reaction is about you. Your bias, your judgement, your prejudice. You’ll end up hurting yourself.

Nothing lasts. The same goes for people who come into your life to show you a thing or two. Remember, no one crosses your path unless it’s planned by the Almighty. It doesn’t happen by accident. So cherish the moments you have with them because not everyone will stay forever.

Learn to listen to your own voice; your own heart; your own soul. Focus on that regardless of what others might tell you. Why? Because there’s too much noise around us, loud decibels accosting us daily. Sadly, people tend to listen to all that noise instead of themselves!

Don’t be jealous when you see someone having more than you. Remember, the Almighty blesses us differently. Don’t compare. Instead show gratitude so He can bless you with even more. Never forget that He has given you so much already; honestly, you’ll never be able to count them!

Do you feel angry or resentful when being corrected or shown the truth? If you do, then you have a problem with pride! Be wary because even a atom’s weight of it can bar you from Paradise! So work on your heart. Purify it. Humble yourself to people. Get rid of self-importance!

Some people feel a little lost when they don’t get enough attention from others. So they make fun of people, belittle them and say nasty things about them in order to get the attention they so badly desire. Try to counsel them if you can. Say a prayer for them. They need it!

Remember, the Almighty does not expect us to have all the answers. He knows, as humans, our knowledge is limited. But that’s no excuse for not seeking knowledge. He expects us to learn; have unwavering faith in Him; knowing that He’s always there & that He rewards those who try!

Do you often feel confused & unsettled? Perhaps your heart feels like something’s amiss? Learn to cultivate inner peace by drawing yourself closer to the Almighty. Trust Him completely. He will guide you through it all. He will show you where you need to go to feel whole again!

Don’t be foolish and expose every blessing the Almighty has given you to everyone and think that they’ll be happy for you. The truth is some will but many won’t. The evil eye is real. Learn to keep things private and not to share too much with those who could possibly harm you.

If you’re always looking for ways to expose others, you have a problem that needs fixing. Remember, the Almighty said if you expose others, He’ll surely expose you, even if you’re hiding in the tiniest corner of the room. If you have good intentions, do it privately not publicly!

Whatever you’re facing right now, whatever you’re dealing with won’t last. Nothing does. So get a perspective on life. Things will get better. That’s the Almighty’s promise. Tomorrow brings new hope. Daybreak will happen. Get hold of yourself and keep moving. You’ll get there!

You’re allowed to disagree with others, state your opinion respectfully but NEVER get physical or violent. This quality makes us distinct from animals! Be civilised, listen to what others are saying but avoid knee-jerk reactions. It would save you from a whole lot of regret!

Some people feel better about themselves by making others feel worse. Such people have low self-esteem; they seek to boost it by taking pot shots at others. Be careful of this group because their ego needs to be constantly fed. They’re always on the look out for more victims!

Be careful of slander. It can wear a hundred masks. You could be passing slanderous information unknowingly. You may have given a negative perception of another person; or you could spice up bad news to tarnish someone’s image. Don’t do it! Don’t devalue someone’s reputation!

Stay away from insults and profanity. Exercise restraint and tolerance. It’s not easy to respond to evil with good. But we must try our best. Even when we have the power to take revenge, choose not to.  Why? Because the  Almighty is gentle & loves gentleness in all matters!

Don’t let negative thoughts take root in your mind. Weed it out quickly once you notice it. Often we think of ‘what ifs’ and negative scenarios and we worry ourselves for no apparent reason. That’s exactly what Satan wants. Learn to have faith and trust the Almighty instead.

Focus your attention on yourself & look not for fault in others. Focus on how to be better than you used to be & not better than others. Every time you focus your attention outward, every time you choose to compare yourself with others, you will lose sight of who you really are.

Almighty. We ask You to keep us safe as the world adjusts to a new norm. Grant us courage & perseverance to face the days ahead. May faith, hope & love never leave us. Guide our hearts to comfort one aother even as we keep apart. Thank You for Your Light amidst our darkness!

A good way to fight hypocrisy in others is to fight it within yourself. Always set a good example. Let your integrity be your moral compass. Always stand up for what is right. Don't be quick to condemn others. It’s a dangerous hypocrisy trap when it turns out that you were wrong.

We’ve all been through spiritual lows; disappointments, failures, temptations etc. What’s important is to trust that ultimately all that suffering won’t last; it will end in victory. Keep asking the Almighty for help even at the lowest points and to hold on to our faith firmly!

Sometimes it takes humiliation to teach us the value of humility. The truth is no matter how smart, successful, good-looking you are, nobody likes a boastful person. Nobody likes arrogance or cockiness. So make a conscious effort to stay humble always. Selflessness is humility!

When you remain calm in adversity and have strong faith, the Almighty will set things right in your life. He’ll give you back what was taken away from you. He’ll restore the goodness  others tried to rob from you. He’ll grant ease and open doors that you couldn’t open!

You’ve to admit that this year’s so far been a year where we questioned everything we believed to be “normal”.  Perhaps this is what the Almighty wants us to learn; to fully submit to His Decree. All our best laid plans have gone out of the window, a reminder of who’s in charge!

When someone says something humiliating to you, don’t take it personally.  No matter what you’ve done wrong, you don’t deserve to be humiliated. Take responsibility for your mistakes but it doesn’t mean that you’re an unworthy person who should be denigrated by someone else!

Be less quick to react to abusive people. Don't let them provoke you. That’s exactly what they want. For you to lose control and get angry. Don’t play their game. Keep your calm. Seek the Almighty’s help. Often, they are powerless when you're less reactive.

Clean up your acts, not just with the Almighty but with people as well. Don’t let anyone have a single legitimate complaint against you that will negate the good you’ve done. Protect your good deeds. If you hurt someone, ask for forgiveness. Don’t delay it till the Hereafter!

Choose your words carefully. Prefer kind, gentle & measured words over harsh speech always. Whatever you say can travel the world at lightning speed & you’ll live to regret it. Miscommunication is also common, especially in this age of texting. May we always use good words!

There’s no need to shout out to the world how successful you are & what a charmed life you lead. People should only know what you allow them to know. Keep most of it private. Let them make their own assumptions. You can’t stop them anyway. Do you think that’s a good way to live?

What is Halaal? Ever wondered? 
Here is a simple animation explaining it.

https://t.co/7LBslupRmk

There’s always good in everyone. Strive to see that in others. No matter how small the act. Accept it when they make a mistake. We’re all human and not immune to wrongdoing. Correct them if you can, patiently with a kind heart. Don’t give up on people. Say a prayer for them!

We’ve all made poor choices in life at some stage. Don’t beat yourself up. Instead of wasting more time & energy with regrets, guilt, shame & agony over what's done, use those resources to bring on change so that poor choices remain in the past & serve as lessons learnt!

It’s so easy to lose your cool! Train yourself to remain calm even in difficult situations. Stand your ground firmly but politely. Let them curse & swear. Choose to rise above cheap, verbal abuse that’s widespread today. They’ll realize their mistake & how offensive they were!

The best way to improve your life is to do it one day at a time. It’s very tempting to cram many things all at once but don’t! You’re more likely to succeed with baby steps & a huge dose of prayer & supplication. Without the Almighty, nothing happens. So make that change today!

The minute you think you’re more superior than the person next to you because of your skin colour, that’s the beginning of your downfall. The Almighty looks at your heart! Get rid of any deep-seated feeling in you of one upmanship & superiority. Seek refuge in Him. Save yourself!

When you reach a stage where you can remain calm when calamity strikes, you’ve reached spiritual maturity. When you're not negatively affected by the drama around you, it shows you have complete faith in the Almighty and you know that nothing lasts!

A sin is a sin. Even when you try to put a positive spin on a sin, it’s still a sin. As long as you’re disobeying the Almighty, it’s a sin. But the beauty is with sincere repentance all that can be erased or even converted to good deeds if the Almighty wills.  Turn back to Him!

Choose kindness always. Put ourselves in someone else’s shoes instead of trying to figure out how they feel based on our limited viewpoint. How difficult is it to empathize with others when we don’t know their circumstances? It costs nothing. Just a big heart and an open mind!

Sometimes your trials and tribulations last longer than expected. Don’t lose heart. Ask the Almighty for strength and perseverance to keep going. Giving up is never an option. We need a strong finish. Never forget that! Bear patience. A breakthrough is on the way!

Almighty. As we continue to face these uncertain times, keep us firmly rooted to our faith. Guide us to be mindful of what we allow to take root in our consciousness. Keep us positive, away from toxic thoughts & people, knowing that You’re in complete control of all situations.

Gratitude is key. If you have a home, thank the Almighty. If you have a family, thank the Almighty. If you have both, it’s indeed a huge blessing. Think of the millions who have been displaced & have nothing to call their own. Let’s cut out ingratitude from our lives!

When others take a step back and give up on doing what’s good, don’t let that be a negative pull for you to follow suit. That  shouldn’t be a catalyst for you to rethink your situation to give up as well. Instead, focus on your goal and try to strengthen it. You’ll get there!

Take a step back and look at the big picture. Looking at the nitty gritty often clouds your judgement and can even confuse you. Sure detail is important but if you lose sight of the big picture, you’ll lose sight of your final destination. And that’s what counts eventually!

Guard your tongue. How often have we spoken unnecessarily just for the sake of hearing ourselves? Many feel the need to fill the void of silence with mindless dribble which often leads to more trouble. Remain silent if you don’t have anything nice to say. You won’t regret it!

The Almighty does not promise the absence of struggle in this life. That’s why He created us. To test us. So be humble, bear good patience and do the best you can in all things. He will elevate your status. Keep negative thoughts at bay. You’ll get through this!

When the Almighty has blessed you with something, accept the blessing; be grateful. The One who gave you everything can take it away in an instant. In the blink of an eye, it could be gone! Remember, there’s nothing special about you except your deeds & the state of your heart.

Be kind to yourself. You’ve come this far and with the Almighty’s help you’ll get through these challenging and confusing times. Don’t give in to overthinking, focus on the tasks ahead. Guide your mind to that which is positive and beneficial. Trust that tomorrow will be better!

Focus on what you have, no matter how little & you’ll be happy. Focus on what’s missing in your life & what the neighbours have & you’ll be sad. It all depends on where your focus lies in life. If it’s the Almighty’s blessings then you’ll be content! Else, you’ll be miserable!

If you have a problem with someone’s skin colour, you have a problem with the Creator. He created us in a multitude of colours so we can appreciate diversity & live in harmony. Don’t let anyone tell you who is more superior. Treat people fairly. The Almighty is watching.

Drop expectations. You’ll be happier with fewer disappointments. Learn to expect nothing. If you think people will stop whatever they’re doing to attend to you, you’re wrong. Don’t wait with bated breath. Instead, turn to the Almighty! He won’t disappoint!

Satan does not want you to repent at all. But if he cannot do that, his next best plan is to delay your repentance. He tries to tell you that it will be easier later on so sin all you want now! That’s a lie. The longer things go on, the harder it becomes to repent. Do it today!

Let go of disappointments. Let go of things that didn’t work out. Let go of negative thoughts that drag you down. Let go of “nothing good ever happens in my life” feeling. Choose to focus on the good & positive each day. The Almighty will turn everything to your advantage!!

No skin color is superior over the other. All shades of colours are beautiful. Remember, the Almighty doesn’t tolerate arrogance and racism. It’s a sin. A huge sin! He is only concerned with the state of your heart and your level of piety. Keep your focus on the right things.

Do we reject someone only because of his skin colour? Answer that honestly. The truth is nobody is born a racist. You have to be taught. Are we dealing with racism, bigotry & prejudice in our own lives, so that we can be examples to our children & those under our charge? Reflect!

The winners are those who are happy with the way the Almighty has made them. You don't have to follow what others are doing to be considered good looking or acceptable. You ARE good looking. You ARE original. You are YOU! So just be YOU! Not someone else!

Put an end to racism & violence. Stop labeling people. We're all part of the Almighty's creation. How difficult is it to be kind and to promote peace? It costs nothing. Let’s make a concerted effort to spread this message far and wide. Start by being a living example of it!

Break free from old mindsets and traditions; especially those that hold us back from doing what the Almighty has prescribed for us. Sometimes we do things just because they’ve been passed down from our forefathers. Reasses your situation and why you do what you’ve been doing!

When you regret your sins, feel sad for having committed them and feel pain when you remember them, these are signs of faith and sincere repentance. However, after repenting, Satan will cause you to doubt the Almighty’s Mercy. Don’t despair. Don’t fall for his trick! Move on!

Almighty. Keep our hope alive in these turbulent times. We are nothing without You. Without You, we can’t carry on & face  the obstacles ahead. Give us the strength & will to confront  life’s challenges. Nothing will happen without Your Will. Only You can help us move forward!

Blesssed are those who go through so much, yet they put up a brave front & make it seem like everything is okay. They take their troubles to the Almighty, not to people or social media. They’re a rare breed in this day & age where most things get an airing on social platforms!

Patience is key! No matter what circumstances you find yourself in, be patient. Your neighbour  may be blessed with what he’s been praying for but you must remain patient. Perhaps the Almighty wants you to call out to Him just a little more. He will reward the doers of good!

Let’s face it. There’s so much uncertainty in our lives today given the global pandemic that it’s easy to feel helpless. But no matter what you’re going through, be certain that the Almighty is watching over you. He has plans for you. He will see you through everything.

Never take your blessings for granted. The Almighty will see to that. So always be grateful, no matter how small the blessing. He never sends a calamity except that ease follows thereafter. Keep connecting with Him; you’ll see how much ease and inner peace you get in your life.

Time to hear from you.

This Ramadan was

Don’t let your grief consume you to such an extent that you forget who’s in control. Try to step away from your broken state, even if just for a moment. You’ll see things clearer; realise that you own nothing at all. Everything’s on loan from the Almighty. This world’s temporary!

Be wary of the internet. Don't let it turn you into a cynical person. It can crush your optimism and give you a low self-esteem. Whatever you do, don’t let it define your worth. Rise above it and resist the temptation to compare what’s going on with someone else’s life!

Such is life. One minute you’re up, the next you’re down. Today you’re counting your loss, tomorrow the Almighty will reward you with huge gains. Never despair whatever happens in life. He will remove people & things from us but He will also replace them with what we truly need!

All the prayers you’ve been making, the dreams you’ve been wanting so badly, trust the Almighty because He has got it under control. He is going to ensure that things fall into place. He is going to make things happen that you could never have done on your own. Have firm faith!

May the Almighty fill our hearts with compassion on this beautiful day of #Eid . Spread the joy to all around you and don’t forget to reach out to those in need. #EidMubarak to all of you. Have a beautiful time with your loved ones.

Make it a point to touch lives & hearts whenever you get the opportunity this #Eid. Give, forgive & apologise. If you find difficulty doing it, make a commitment & start on this day of #Eid. Focus on things that matter. Cut out distractions & aim to please the Almighty!
Eid Message of love, whether you're celebrating today or tomorrow! #EidMubarak #EidUlFitr #muftimenk https://t.co/B3BPh4v0Vc
The moon was sighted in Mozambique so we will be having Eid Sunday 24th May 2020 in Zimbabwe too Alhamdulillah. #EidMubarak #EidUlFitr from Mufti Menk, Omar and Hana! ♥️ https://t.co/T3uAQoUKKn

Your struggle is an act of worship. The Almighty loves the humble who is not arrogant, who is broken and surrenders himself completely to His Lord. So there’s wisdom in your trials and tribulations. Don’t scoff at them. Learn from them and use them to draw yourself closer to Him.

People may not always hear what you say but they will  definitely observe if you’re practising what you’re preaching. Always lead by example. You don’t have to be in a position of authority or power to do that. Live a life of goodness and the message will spread far and wide!

The #PakistanPlaneCrash earlier has saddened me. My heartfelt condolences to the families of those who returned to their Maker during this Blessed Month of Ramadan. May the Almighty grant them the loftiest ranks of Paradise & calm their loved ones with beautiful patience. Aameen

If you let Ramadan pass by without seeking & being granted His Forgiveness, you have truly missed out. When then will you be forgiven, if not in this month? So don't let ignorance & negligence overtake you. Seek His Forgiveness to get closer to Him. Do it in these last hours!
@snyxay Eid is on Sunday in most countries of the world! Alhamdulillah

Almighty. We thank You for giving us this blessed month amid very different conditions. Every crisis in life is an opportunity to get closer to You in complete trust. You have shown immense blessings & how patience is key to our suffering. Protect us, grant us ease & forgiveness!

Charity Increases sustenance and protects wealth. It’s not too late to give generously before the blessed month leaves us. One way to increase our rewards immeasurably is to give because no matter how small it is, it’s something that will protect us in the Hereafter!

Always stay humble. No matter how successful you are, don’t let your ego take over the controls driving you towards social status instead of progress. Always keep learning & improving; aware that there’s so much more to know. After all, everybody knows something that you don’t!

Arrogance and pride can be found in the hearts of many but these are traits which the Almighty has warned us to stay away from. Don’t be deceived into believing that arrogance is wisdom. Far from it! Remember, it is not all about you. Always consider those around you as well!

Keep going even when you find it difficult to worship. Keep going when you find your tongue is unable to utter much. Keep going when you feel it’s a bad day & you want to give up. Keep going when you feel your patience running out. Keep going because He knows your struggle!

Satan has ONE goal. To take you to Hellfire. If you love this world, his job is easier. If you're close to the Almighty, he'll tempt you! If you're struggling to get back on track, he will do his utmost. Seek the Almighty’s help. He will guide you. Don’t let people mock you.

Be consistent in your acts of worship. Small, daily doses are better than one huge chunk and then nothing at all. The Almighty loves those deeds that are done consistently. Remember, baby steps and build it up progressively. That way you’re more likely to have staying power.

Give generously especially in this month. But don’t waste your good deeds. A man who gives & hides it so that his right hand doesn’t know what his left is doing, basically cares more about helping others than what people will think of him. So learn to give discreetly!

If you’ve been enjoying the extra worship in this blessed month, it’s time to ponder & recalibrate your life. It’s time to get closer to the Almighty. Make a commitment to continue what you’ve been doing after this month is over. Commit to put in extra effort & time for Him!

Don’t complicate life. It’s actually very straightforward. What you give, you get back eventually. What you sow, you reap. Spread goodness and kindness, it willl come back to you in many forms. The Almighty loves the doers of good. What are you waiting for? Start today!

Most great changes are preceded by chaos. So if you feel like your life is a mess right now, take heart. Keep believing it will fall into place soon. Keep going knowing that the Best of Planners will unfold the course you should be taking. You’ll be pleased you didn’t give up!

No matter what’s going on, always uphold decent character &  conduct. Let them criticise, let them pick on petty issues, let them say nasty things. Be good, be kind-hearted even if they are not. Remember there’s Judgement Day! They’ll pay their dues on The Day of Recompense.

Our greatest disappointment comes when our expectations of who we want people to be don’t match the reality of who they really are. It’s easy to say don’t have expectations, but as humans we do. So be realistic in your expectations. Learn to depend on the Almighty alone!

Always remember that the Almighty is able to bring you through the unknown, the unseen, and the unexpected. These are situations which our normal minds cannot fathom. But leave it to Him. It’s part of His Plan. All you have to do is to trust Him without an iota of doubt!

Remember, you don’t need people’s endorsement to be happy. If they have issues with you, it’s not about you, it’s about their insecurities. Just be sure you haven’t hurt anyone. You don’t have to prove anything to anyone. Let it go & seek your approval only from the Almighty.

It happens to us all. The guilt of not using our time better. But the Almighty is most Merciful. He sends us reminder after reminder. He’s the most patient. He never gives up on us. So why do we give up on ourselves? Don’t! Persevere just a little more to get back on track!

When you see others doing well & having a seemingly good life, it’s easy to get discouraged & think that your life isn’t going to change. Everyone has struggles in life, Everyone has disappointments, but if you think good thoughts of the Almighty, He will bless you immensely.

Almighty. On this blessed day, help us to realise our #Ramadan goal in getting closer to You. Soften the hearts of those who’ve yet to feel the sweetness of this month; don’t let them give in to despair. Give them the strength to keep trying. We ask for Your Mercy & Forgiveness

Keep knocking on His Door. Keep asking not just for the ordinary but the extraordinary. For anything & everything. Even for whatever your mind tells you is impossible. He’s the Lord  of the Worlds. He’s the Owner of Miracles. If He says, BE; It shall be!

If you want to change, start by setting small goals from now. Change doesn't usually happen overnight. You may not be able to do everything the Almighty has prescribed instantly. Strive & show Him you’re sincere, He will pave a way for you! Make this #Ramadan a game changer!

If your #Ramadan hasn’t been what you envisioned, don’t lose hope. As long as you’ve been trying your best, the Almighty knows & will reward you. You may be on a spiritual high or you may be spiritually broken, whichever the case, don’t stop asking Him. Don’t stop repenting.

Don’t ignore the little warnings you get from your spiritual heart. Make it a priority to deal with emotions like anger, bitterness, resentment & bad attitudes. Don’t let such feelings fester. Seek the Almighty’s help to restore peace and calmness so you can feel whole again!

Rumours are dangerous; they travel extremely fast. You could have entertained a rumour & not even knew; or worse you started it. Some people start a rumour simply because they have nothing to say. You may think it’s harmless. It’s not, flee from it. Have nothing to do with it!

We live in a judgmental society. People will form their own conclusions of you based on a tweet or a Facebook status. They judge you on your appearance or even your accent. Just because you’re different from them, they look down on you. Stand your ground firmly but politely.

Patience is indeed a virtue. We’re taught its value & how the Almighty rewards those who embody this quality. But at times as humans, we tend to get emotional over something & we run out of patience. Don’t feel bad. Keep the Almighty in focus. He will find a way out for you!

Targeting women and newborn at a maternity hospital is a new low. It is heart-wrenching and wrong on all counts. My heart is shattered. What a senseless, brutal, barbaric act in the blessed month of #Ramadan. May the Almighty deal with the perpetrators of the #KabulAttack.

You may think you’re a pious person & that you’re close to the Almighty. But if your character is flawed, you curse & swear, your heart is filled with envy & hatred, you gossip & backbite,  you’re argumentative & highly intolerant, then this can’t be further from the truth!

Don't do anything to compromise the sanctity of these last nights in #Ramadan. Don't argue, swear, backbite or gossip. Focus solely on the Almighty. Do more good deeds, give generously and make an intent that every little bit you do is for Him and Him alone!

Giving what you love is the highest form of giving. We can give whatever we want but try to reach this level of giving. You’ll feel a huge sense of gratification envelop you. It also shows the state of your heart. It’s not too late to do this. Try it in these last blessed nights!

To worry means we do not trust the Almighty. The key to overcoming our discontentment and lack of faith is to get to know Him better & get closer to Him. Has He not provided for you even when you never asked? Think about it. That should grow your confidence and trust in Him!

It all boils down to your heart. The Almighty will weigh your deeds and not count them on Judgement Day. He looks at your intent and how much heart was in it when the deed was done. Quality over quantity above all. So purify your heart; do it solely for Him and not to show off!

Don’t be among those who only experience hunger & thirst from the fast and attain nothing. These are people who destroy the rewards of their fast by engaging in gossip, backbiting, cursing, lying, etc. Remember that the Almighty is not in need of the fast of such a person!

Your physical appearance doesn't determine your worth.  We need to look at what’s inside: traits like kindness, generosity & character.  Next time you hear others mocking the way someone looks, don't encourage it. Don't feel the need to add your own comments. Put an end to it!

Don’t wait for things to fall into place before you start worshipping the Almighty. Do it now & He will make things right for you. He promises peace during chaos. Joy when things seem uncertain. Hope when circumstances seem hopeless. Call on Him. He’s your Provider & Sustainer!

If you’re among those who’ve lost your job in this pandemic, don’t despair. It can be heart-wrenching experience but remember the Almighty knows what we don’t. Perhaps He’s redirecting your life towards something better. Bear patience. You’ll be grateful for the next phase!

Words are powerful. What you say can be held against you, perhaps not now but certainly in the Court of the Almighty. So repent & seek forgiveness from Him & the one you’ve wronged. Choose your words wisely before speaking. It’s good to stay quiet if you don’t have much to say!

Almighty. Shower us with Your infinite mercy, relieve our fears & anxieties & grant us a peaceful mind & a heart full of hope. We ask for patience and wisdom to make the correct decisions in life. Guide us during this difficult journey towards healing and recovery. Aameen.

Whatever you ask for, if it’s meant for you, you’ll get. No matter how long the wait. The Almighty will see to it. So always ask with conviction & a pure heart. Leave the timing to Him. Don’t rush Him. Don’t give Him ultimatums. Our job is to live a life that’s pleasing to Him.

You need to get this right. Being a leader is more than just wanting to lead. Good leaders empower others to be great. They’re honest with people. They don’t pretend to know it all. They seek ideas and feedback from people. Because that’s the way you grow & become better!

Forbearance is a quality that the Almighty holds in high regard. Whether it manifests as patience, endurance, gentleness, tolerance, or moderation, forbearance is woven into all this and more. Train yourself to cultivate this habit and make it a part of your daily life! Try it!

It’s not always easy to walk the path to your destination. But you must and you will. No matter how difficult it gets, no matter what the challenges along the way, steel yourself. Giving up is not an option. Satan is waiting on the sidelines to see you fall. Don’t let him win!

Be comfortable walking in your own shoes at your own pace. Don’t compare yourself to others. It’s the trap of Satan to always make you yearn for what you don’t have but your neighbour does. Your journey is yours alone. Keep your focus. Keep going and you’ll get there!

Forgive generously. This is the month of forgiveness. Let it go. Don’t keep it inside & let it fester. It’s not healthy. Besides all that negative emotion is taking up too much space. Allow yourself to fil that space with love, compassion and peace. You’ll feel much better!

Do you have any genuine friends? Those who are not driven by money, status, and ego? To be honest, it gets harder to find such people in this day and age. They exist but are few and far between. So if you know one, you’re truly blessed. Respect them. Keep them close.

Don’t be afraid to shed tears. Cry all you want to the Almighty. Cry your heart out if you must. It’s a quality of the righteous. Tears are prayers too. They travel to Him when we are so overcome with emotion that we can’t find the right words to say. He’s the best listener.

Even the greatest of deeds can be of no benefit if the hearts are sick; if the hearts are corrupt; if the hearts are laced with envy, pride, jealousy, hatred etc. So pay close attention to the state of your heart because everything you do flows from it!

Each time you undertake something, it could fail, it could crumble. That’s the reality. But when you trust that the Almighty always has your best interest, things take on a different turn. He will steer & guide you towards what’s best. Never doubt that. He’s your Best Planner!

We don’t want anything or anyone to distract us from our worship in this blessed month. We need good people to encourage us to get the most out of it. May the Almighty bless all of us with righteous company & people who will benefit us in both this world and the hereafter.

Times are hard without a doubt. Many are ill, have lost their jobs etc. But always believe that things will get better. Remember, everything in this world is temporary. So the sadness, anxiety & overthinking will pass. Bear patience for a while longer. Eternal bliss awaits us!

Every cloud has a silver lining. This pandemic has united us. We’re all in the same boat. Use this time to be productive, encourage and motivate one another. Instead of just hoping things will return to normal, start thinking of how we can adjust to a new world, post pandemic!

It’s easy to form your own conclusion based on what you see. Don’t. Resist that temptation. Why? Because you will never know the true situation if you’ve not walked in someone’s shoes. Remember, the ignorant sees only with his eyes. Learn to see
with your heart and mind!

Are you more likely to focus on problems or solutions? Yes, major hurdles are depressing & they’re often unavoidable. But your attitude directly influences your ability to solve them. The Almighty has given us the mental capacity to assess our situation. Stay on top of it all!

Almighty. Keep us firm in faith as we go through a very different #Ramadan. We’re realising the blessings  attached to this & we’re grateful for everything You’ve sent our way. Keep us always hopeful as we pray for healing the world over not just physically but in our hearts!

Make it a habit to always speak the truth. That way you don’t have to worry about which version of the story you were telling others. Just one version & that’s the truth. Never live in fear of anything or anyone except the One who made you. He’s the only One you’re answerable to.

The truth is many of us are unhappy because we are so preoccupied with what others think of us. Seriously, this has to stop. Happiness comes from your link with your Maker; it comes from within. A calm heart and peaceful mind can only be truly achieved when you have this link!

Don’t always look for the easy path & short term gratification. Remember, life’s a test. It requires a lot of hard work & long term perspective. It’s not easy. It’s not for the faint hearted. Just as Paradise is not easy. Prepare well today so you won’t have to regret tomorrow!

Stay away from obscene speech, ignorant acts, argument and insults not just because you’re fasting but because they incur the Almighty’s wrath. Such actions are often intended to offend, intimidate or otherwise cause emotional or psychological  trauma. Clean up your acts!

Despite all the negativity around us, there are thousands making the best of situations that are far from ideal. These people never complain, don’t make excuses & continue to persevere. Nothing deters them. They put their heads down & carry on. Take a leaf form their book.

Don’t short-change yourself. Don’t always think you can’t do it. Whenever the Almighty puts something in your heart, go for it! If you have unwavering faith in Him, you will have the strength to face whatever comes your way. Believe in yourself and believe that He has your back!

Never for a moment think that your possessions are the sum of your life. They are not! You’re not defined by your status. Remember, everything is a gift from the Almighty. He’s watching how you utilise ever single gift. So do what’s right!

Some find it so hard to say no because they are scared of being judged. They're scared of what others will think of them once they change their attitude & stop saying yes to everything. The truth is people will form an opinion of you no matter what you do! So decline politely.

We all have many sides to us. We have one side we show to the world. Then there’s the side no one ever sees, that’s the most important one. Yes! Who are we really when no one is seeing? That’s the side the Almighty looks at. It sets our moral compass and defines our character.

Don't let this world dictate to you what beauty is. Your figure & complexion or skin tone don’t mean anything if you have a bad heart. Beauty is not what people see when they look at you; beauty is what they discover when they find out what is inside of you.

Train yourself to think about your blessings instead of your hardship. Have faith that none of this will last so don’t live in never-ending defeat. Challenge yourself to stop talking about the problem & start talking about the solution. Have a positive mindset & you’re a winner!

Don’t let bitterness and resentment take root in your heart. They’re poison which will harm your soul eventually. Let go of the hurt or hate that comes with it. If you’ve been wronged, turn to the Almighty and let Him heal you. You’ll feel whole again with a much lighter heart!

We often talk just so that we won’t have this void of silence; thinking that silence is something to be ashamed of; something to be avoided. But it’s not. There’s nothing wrong with silence. In fact, if you have nothing worthwhile to say, it’s best that you remain silent!

Take care of your spiritual growth. You can’t give from an empty vessel. Make a goal each day to draw yourself closer to the Almighty. Always have hope. Hope in His Mercy. Hope in His Paradise. Hope that He is waiting to forgive. Ask Him, plead with Him. Cry out to Him!

Believe in yourself. Trust that the Almighty has equipped you with what you need to succeed. You have what it takes. You have a light within you that you can use to shine bright and elevate other people as well as reach personal success.⁣ Work hard and He will pave the way!

Don't waste your good deeds by engaging in gossip, slander etc. You'll end up a bankrupt having to pay off all those you've wronged.  Stay away from ill-feelings, jealousy & hatred this month. Your heart will be better prepared to stay away from such feelings beyond #Ramadan!

Let’s work on our hearts this #Ramadan. Soften it & purify it. Renew our link with the Almighty & celebrate revelation of the greatest message from our Lord. For a month that's bountiful with deeds, start repenting sincerely. Commit to change for the better & discard bad habits!

This #Ramadan, make a firm commitment to use words to build people up. Stop using foul language, bad speech & don’t curse & swear. Words are powerful. They leave a lasting impact. So let nothing else but good come out of your mouth. The effects will resonate far and wide.

Almighty. Let us enter this blessed month with a humble heart. Amid trying times, we beg you to open spiritual doorways for us and answer our prayers. Keep us steadfast, heal us and make us whole again. May we also use this time for renewal and to gain closeness to You. Aameen.

Quit worrying especially over things you can’t control. If you want peace of mind, hand things over to the Almighty after you’ve done your best. You’ve played your part so now let Him take over. Remember, whatever you let into your mind has the potential to manifest in your life.

As the blessed month descends on us, be aware of those who will try to cause discord among people. Stay away from both actions and words that may cause regret in this month of Mercy. Get involved in only that which is good and beneficial. Stay away from conflict and drama.

Whatever you’re going through, you need to start healing. Because if you don’t, you’ll end up venting your frustrations on other people and that’s bad. Keep your heart light, always believing they that the Almighty wants the best for you and He will always facilitate a way out!

Learn to get on with your life. Don’t worry about what other people are doing; it’s none of your business. Let people do what they have to do. You must set up your own boundaries & respect other people’s markers as well when it comes to such things. It’s a much needed skill.

There’s so much uncertainty in the world now that it’s easy to feel hopeless. Don’t waste another moment wishing things were different. Where you are right now is where the Almighty wants you to be. Trust Him. Believe in Him. Whether it’s a blessing or a lesson, thank Him!

Don’t keep harping on negative things and whatever’s wrong in your life. Remember, you’ve been in situations where you thought you’d never make it but you did. You’re more resilient than you think you are. You survived it! Trust the Almighty to see you through the journey.

Learn to depend on the Almighty for everything. He wants to help you, heal you, empower you, comfort you; the list is endless. Make Him the source of everything that you need instead of depending on people who will often let you down. Have good thoughts of Him & trust Him always!

Don’t despair if the world looks like an unfamiliar place right now. Keep pushing forward. Our faith keeps us going. Amidst the turmoil & turbulence, we know the Almighty’s in full control. He’s promised that no trial sent our way is a waste. Learn from it. Become better people!

Do you get anxious waiting for something? Do you feel fear and excitement at the same time? At times, we just can’t help feeling that way. But bearing patience with a good attitude is not so common anymore, in a world where everything happens instantly. Learn to wait patiently!

In life, we all struggle with many issues but in particular, some struggle more with anger. Anger acts as a poison to the body, both physically & spiritually. It can mess up your whole being. You need to protect your heart from it by constantly seeking the Almighty’s help.

Hope is the cornerstone of our faith. Always have hope in the Almighty’s Mercy. Don’t let anyone tell you otherwise. Holding on to hope is your greatest strength. Use it to anchor you in times of crisis. The situation could always be worse. But he who has hope has everything!

Be a good role model for your child; especially now as you’re spending more time at home in their presence. Instil the right habits from an early age. Our actions speak louder than our words. Children don’t judge you. They take note of what you do. So do what you want them to do!

No one will know what you’re truly experiencing. Your situation and the depths of pain. No one can possibly know or understand except for the Almighty himself. He knows your pain. He is always there, reaching out to pull you out of the pit of despair. Reach out to Him!

Trust the Almighty in all that you do. Don’t try to figure out everything on your own. You won’t be able to anyway. You’ll end up frustrated. Watch how your plans unfold and pay attention to the things He’s showing you. He will keep you on track.  Don’t assume  you know it all!

My Lockdown Gift for YOU!

Download Motivational Moments I and II - eBooks.

FREE from my website - NEW LINK

https://t.co/tuFPLtUJYy

Please share with others.

#love #hope #reachingout #WeAreInThisTogether

We are each on our own journey. Keep your eyes focused on the road ahead. Run your own race. Don’t get distracted by looking at what someone else is doing. And don’t worry about what anyone thinks. It’s irrelevant! You’re answerable to the Almighty. Get your priorities right!

Almighty. It’s been a difficult period for all. You’ve seen how vulnerable we are, You’ve seen our weakness. But in all this, we lay our complete trust in You. Bring healing to those who are ill. Protect those who are most at risk. Comfort those who have lost a loved one.

Do you feel confused and lost? Do you feel unsure what to do next? Do you feel helpless? Do you feel broken and beaten? Do you feel like a failure? Almighty! I need you more than ever now. I can’t do it on my own. Remove the obstacles from my heart so I can get closer to You!

Anger & jealousy are common human traits. But they are displeasing & self-destructing if they get out of control. You’ll only be hurting yourself before others when you get angry or jealous. You’ll end up unhappy & dissatisfied. Let go of such feelings. Learn to forgive & heal!

Be kind to people in word and deed. We tend to overlook this important trait. It’s also one of the means of removing worry, distress and anxiety. When you show kindness solely for the sake of the Almighty, He will bless you in ways you never imagined & open doors for you!

The best way to respond to this pandemic is to maintain a sense of calm & hope. It can be difficult with the influx of daily news that causes anxiety. But we must, for our own sanity. Listen to what the experts tell you, not those who fear monger. Above all, trust the Almighty.

Differ by all means; differ strongly if need be. But never insult or belittle those who disagree with you. Learn to voice your opinion respectfully, in the most beautiful way. Listen attentively; even if we disagree, do so respectfully. We must show that we care for each other!

Do you have the tendency to pick on the smallest thing that you think is amiss and make it look like the biggest mistake? Refrain from being so harsh. Only the Almighty knows what’s inside people’s hearts. Look at others with the eyes of mercy and He will do the same with you!

Do you know those who love name dropping? Those who don’t care who you are or where you’re from. They just want to know who you know, what you do and how you can help them. Be careful of such superficial people. They won’t hesitate to use you to suit their whims & fancies!

If you are fearful today for whatever reason, remember the Almighty’s promise that ease will come after hardship. His Word is filled with integrity. He will fulfil His Promise. We need to have firm faith. It’s easy to be distracted by the noise around. Learn to shut them out!

You can’t expect to change if you keep making excuses for anything that goes wrong with you. Take accountability for your actions & take responsibility for your decisions. Don’t play the blame game. Try to learn from your mistakes, which in turn will help you be a better person.
