My heartfelt condolences to the people of Oman on the passing of their beloved #SultanQaboos bin Saeed. May the Almighty grant him the highest Paradise.

My congratulations & prayer also go out to the newly appointed #SultanHaitham bin Tariq. May #Oman continue to prosper.

The Almighty knows you better than you know yourself. He knows everything about you to the minutest detail. Every dream in your heart, He is aware of. Whatever He gives you is for your own good. Whatever He withholds from your is also for your own good. So do not be sad!

Nothing in your life is a mistake. Everything has been carefully planned by the Almighty to the minutest detail. Your job is to always do your best. Even when you think nothing is going on, He’s busy behind the scenes. He will open doors which you could never open by yourself!

When you’re trusted, take it seriously. Trust is fragile. Because it’s often given freely, it’s also easily taken for granted. Once you’ve been betrayed, it can be very hard, if not impossible, to earn it back. The scars may be so deep & are forever embedded in a person’s mind!

Some get a big thrill from boasting about their achievements or showing off their possessions. They believe that they’re better than others. They may even end up bossing people around. That’s wrong. Remember, whatever you have, someone will have more! That’s life! Stay humble!

We don’t respond well to being put down & pride gives people that feeling with its “I’m better than you” implications. Humility has the opposite effect. If you put others above yourself, they’ll feel good whenever they’re around you. That will surely have a positive impact!

Take the spite out of your heart. Purify it. Your heart is a small organ. When you fill it with hatred for someone, you’re preventing it from being filled with the love of the Almighty. Always ask Him to protect us from hearts that are consumed by hatred, envy, pride, jealousy!

Almighty, in a world that never stops talking, let us learn to appreciate silence. Grant us the ability to listen to the unspoken words many are uttering but no one is listening because everyone’s busy talking. Grant ease to those who are battling their trials quietly! Aameen!

Make it a point to encourage someone today. Urge them to hang in there, to persist towards their goal. Keep reminding them, show your concern and interest in their well-being, say a prayer for them. People are empowered by the words, “I’m so proud of what you are doing.”

Some people spend their whole life waiting. Waiting for the right time to repent from sins, to worship the Almighty, to turn over a new leaf, to do good etc. This is the trap of Satan. No one is promised tomorrow. Don’t waste your life procrastinating. Do your best today!

Everyone makes mistakes. There are no exceptions. The person we’re dealing with may be new to what they are doing, not feeling well, or coping with personal issues & are doing their best to carry on. Giving them the chance to make it right could be the small respite they need!

Are you guilty of harsh speech, not showing mercy to others, ugly character, poor conduct, judgemental and always complaining? If you have any of these traits, it’s time to clean up your act. Work consciously to eradicate such behaviour and feel the goodness you will attract!

Every day we hear people lament that they don’t have enough time. Actually, the real problem is we waste so much of it that we lose track of time! Take stock of how you spend your time. Don’t make excuses. Start doing what matters most. You’ll be amazed at what you can achieve!

Be aware of what you’re spreading. Today, people thrive on fake news, half truths & gossip. Society tends to applaud such things & punish people for being genuine and authentic. Don’t be part of this culture. Verify your sources;  read & re-read before you hit that button!

Stop playing the blame game. Some just blame others for all their problems. They’re never responsible, accountable or want to take ownership of their problems. It’s always someone else’s fault. This is a dangerous way to live. Change your mindset if you want to fix your life.

Today we’re more argumentative than we’ve ever been & one of the main reasons for this is social media. We’ve seen in posts where tempers flare, harsh words are used. A virtual shouting match with people we’ve never even met! Don’t get involved. Stay away from arguments!

We used to say don't believe till you see it with your own eyes. Today, it’s no longer true. Even if you see it with your own eyes & it looks or sounds so REAL, there’s huge possibility it's a #deepfake video; that’s photoshopped, edited or totally fabricated. Be very cautious!

There are people around you who need what you have. Use whatever the Almighty has bestowed you with to help others as much as you can. It need not be material. Time, energy, words of motivation, a listening ear, a helping hand can go a long way towards brightening someone’s day!

Shake off what didn’t work and don’t live in yesterday’s mindset. Work hard to achieve what you want. Nothing comes easy. The Almighty has given you much, so make use of the faculties you have and don’t be afraid to get your hands dirty. Hard work never killed anyone!

Pleasure and pain. Happiness & sadness. Sunshine and rain. Good days & bad days. This is life. The journey that we’re all on right now. Remember, if you trust the Almighty, there are no sad endings. You’ll reach your destination beautifully. He will see to that!

Don’t underestimate the little things you do for others. No matter how small the act, it will come back to you eventually. The appreciation and thank you may be delayed for ages but that’s ok because your reward is truly with the Almighty. So do things out of love not obligation!

Cultivate a good heart. It takes discipline. It’s hard work. It won’t happen overnight. This is your secret to success in this world & the next. Always have  good intentions & learn to be happy for others. Good will come your way and the Almighty will open more doors for you.

Almighty. Forgive us for all the times when we were facing problems & were so quick to become discouraged or depressed; thinking there was no way out.  We forget how You’ve never let us down. No matter what comes our way, we’ll put our trust in You. We know You’ll see us through!

Your past is a mirror to your present. Learn from it and aim to not make the same mistakes again. A new chapter awaits you each day when you wake. Aim to be a better person today than you were yesterday. Don’t overlook even small acts of goodness. They do make a difference!

Thank the Almighty that He does not judge us by what we achieve. He looks at the effort we put in always. All He wants is that we do it sincerely, with heart & soul to please Him. If our intention is wrong, no matter how much success we achieve, it means nothing to Him!

It’s easy to think the worst of something. In fact, it comes naturally to many. To think the best requires faith. Especially when things look bleak. That’s the Almighty testing you to see how you’ll respond. Do you crumble and throw in the towel or do you press on and trust Him?

We live in an instant society. What you want, you get almost immediately. Instant gratification is key. We are wired that way. But real life’s not like that. Our tests require patience. Success doesn’t happen overnight. Appreciate the journey. The beauty is in the struggle.

If you want positive change, get out of your comfort zone and start today. Just talking about it isn’t going to make a difference. Change can be daunting; in fact, anything to do with the unknown has that effect. Give it your best shot. Trust the Almighty in your journey!

Choose goals that are realistic which can be done on a regular basis. Remember, the Almighty loves acts that are consistent. So start small; work on it instead of trying to do it all at once & then quickly losing steam.

People are such that if good touches you, it distresses them; but if harm strikes you, they rejoice at it. Such is life in this day & age. That’s why you need to be discerning when sharing aspects of your life! Choose carefully. Not everyone deserves to know everything about you!

"Everyone's doing it. You're young, have some fun" - the familiar whisperings of Satan. Protect yourself from his tricks. Don’t go down that road. Don’t give in. Stay firm. Keep a level head and exercise self-restraint. Seek your strength from the Almighty.

Never mind the haters & their negativity. Focus on doing good & spreading positivity. Haters are insecure & feel insignificant. When they see others improving their life, it’s a direct reflection of what they should be doing but are not. Don’t hate them back. Pray for them.

Your tongue can be your greatest asset or biggest liability. The choice is yours. It has only 8 muscles but it can make or break you, creating problems with your words. Constantly ask the Almighty to help you control it & guide its usage. Make it work for you not against you!

Don’t be ashamed of the scars you get in life. They are proof of your inner strength. It shows you've lived your life fully; how you picked yourself up when you fell, how you refused to give up, handled defeat & storms. How you rose above it all. That's what matters in the end!

When your heart is heavy & burdened & your mind sees no way out, that’s when you need to trust the Almighty & depend on Him even more. Don’t entertain negative thoughts from Satan. Rise above it. It won’t be easy but you must do it. Bear utmost patience & He will find a way out!

It’s easy to focus on the negatives in your life and start complaining about what’s not good enough or what’s lacking. Don’t do it. Because it will steal your peace and you’ll never be satisfied with what you have, always wanting more. Don’t let your hearts be troubled.

Walking around with a heart that’s hardened is one of the worst calamities that can befall anyone. Don’t allow it to reach that stage. Constantly remember the Almighty. Should you feel yourself getting distant from Him, quickly rectify the situation by getting back on track.

What’s past is done and gone forever. You can’t go back in time to undo anything. Accept what happened and seek forgiveness from the Almighty. The only thing to do is to go forward, learn from past mistakes and with hindsight, forgive yourself for not knowing better then.

Almighty. Keep our hearts connected to You at all times. When we’re tempted to sin, let us remember that You’re watching & that the Angels are recording what we do. Give us the strength to exercise self-restraint. Make it difficult for us to commit acts that incur Your Wrath!

Learn to restrain your anger because if you let it get out of hand, the consequences will be dire. Cursing, swearing, spewing hate & hurting someone are possible outcomes. Anger can lead to many evils. So exercise self-control & you won’t have to live with regret.

Don’t argue for the sake of arguing. Some just need to find flaws in everything or disagree just to be disagreeable. The Almighty dislikes such acts. You don’t always need to have the last say & be the smartest person in the room. Choose your battles & have a sense of proportion.

There’s wisdom in embracing your mistakes. What would we learn if we never made mistakes? Let us not be embarrassed by them & view them positively. Accept that we are not & never will be perfect! We are a never ending work in progress! If you’re not working on it, start today!

Whether you’re celebrating #Christmas or not, whether you're on holiday or not, be respectful & learn to coexist peacefully. Learn to accept difference of opinion. Imposing your opinion on others won't heal the ailing globe. Hate less & love more. Think hard about this.

The world today is such that whatever people don’t know about you, they create. They piece together what they hear from rumours, social media as well as assumptions & lies. It spreads really fast by the touch of a button. Stay away from such acts. You’ll be held accountable!

Some can’t stop living in the past. They keep replaying the same scenario over & over again, how much they suffered, how they were mistreated etc. Such things only poison your mind, make it hard for you to move on & fill you with negativity. Break free from the past! Move on!

The Almighty doesn't just tell us to do something; He guides us through it. Part of it includes getting us to be in the right place at the right time. He puts different people in our lives at different times. Nothing is a coincidence. You just have to surrender and trust Him!

Don’t let Satan fool you into thinking that you have a lot of time left in this world. You don’t. Nobody does. Focus on your life ahead and free yourself from Satan’s traps. It can be challenging but keep going. Continue to strive for His Pleasure in all that you do!

Even if all doors seem closed & you feel like you’re facing a dead end, the Almighty can & will provide alternative solutions to your problem. Understand His Plan. Keep a look out for new opportunities. Often we are so hung up on the closed doors that we fail to see what’s there!

Learn to appreciate closed doors. They’re not meant to hurt you. But they’re there to save you. It’s difficult for us to understand this at times, given our limited minds. We need to fully trust the Almighty, who is in complete control. He is flawless. He knows what He’s doing.

Arrogance at its worst would have you believe that you're always right. You strut around like you know everything. Confidence is humble, quiet & doesn't shout. You’re full of beneficial knowledge & you share it in a manner that doesn’t make the other person feel ignorant!

Nothing good comes from sowing or spewing venom on others. You might “feel” good for a while but trust me, it will cause more problems in the long run. It will come back to haunt you in ways you never imagined. The Almighty will see to it. Best to stay away from such toxic acts.

You have the choice to focus on your blessings or your problems. Whichever you choose will either bring about contentment or worry & stress in your life. The more you focus on your blessings the more the Almighty will bestow upon you. He loves a grateful heart. So choose wisely!

Worry is one of the biggest thieves around. It can steal your time, rob you of your sleep, affect your peace of mind, sap your energy and leave you completely stressed out. Turn your worry into worship. Seek the Almighty and find your much-needed strength to carry on.

Be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them. The opinions of your friends are often more important than those of others; even your family members. That’s why it’s in your interest to choose your friends wisely. They can be the reason why you succeed or fail!

Negative emotions will bring about negative consequences. Just as we learn how helpful love & compassion can be, we also understand that anger, pride, jealousy and arrogance can be detrimental. So always choose to respond positively. It will have a huge impact on your life.

Almighty. Grant peace in our hearts. There’s so much confusion around us & we lack clarity of mind. We’re worried & anxious, always thinking about our problems. Calm us down. Remove everything that’s causing grieve, sorrow & stress in our lives. Heal & guide us in our journey!

Don't be afraid of change for the better. Be afraid of staying the same! When we’re no longer able to change a situation, we’re challenged to change ourselves. It takes courage, discipline & focus. Seek your strength from the Almighty. Do it single-mindedly. You’ll get there!

You don’t have to compromise your convictions to be compassionate. By all means disagree with someone on anything and everything. But don’t hate them. Similarly, just because you love someone, you don’t have to agree with everything they believe or do. Be firm but polite always!

You don’t need people’s approval to be content in life or to do good. If they have issues with you, it’s not about you, it’s about their insecurities. You don’t need to prove anything to anyone. Let it go or you’ll end up exasperated. Your approval is from the Almighty.

The only ones who matter are truly those who cheer loudest for you when you’re down. They believe in you when others don’t. They stand by you when others have abandoned you. Such people are few and far between these days. You’re blessed if you have such a person in your life!

Family is very important. To hold it together, be easy going. Be kind and very polite. Stay away from hurtful & abusive language. Don't ever jump to negative conclusions.
Watch this : https://t.co/kPWrMrBQ7r

If there’s something we all share, it is death.  Everyone will face it. There’s no escaping. So why do we live life as if it’s forever and we take death so lightly. We forget that it can overtake us anytime, anywhere. Life is short. Remember no one is promised tomorrow.

Don’t worry about being popular and loved by the masses. If you choose to get closer to the Almighty and live a life according to His Plan, you’ll find yourself walking alone mostly. It may seem daunting and frightening at times. But don’t worry. He’s your Guide & Protector!

Unfortunately, many people today think that unwholesome talk & swear words are cool. They’re not. Obscene, foolish talk or tasteless jokes do nothing for those who listen. If at all, they might be hurtful. Keep a tight reign on your tongue & always use words that build others up!

Happiness will not come to those who are never grateful for the Almighty’s blessings; those who don’t appreciate what they already have. This world is not a place where you get exactly what you want. There are many out there who will never have what you have; so be thankful!

If you’re always unhappy & discontented with life, check yourself for these symptoms. Are you always criticising others; complaining that your life isn’t good enough; quick to condemn people or comparing yourself with your neighbours? Stop doing all that & feel the difference!

We tend to beat ourselves up over our own mistakes. But we forget that what we see as a mistake, the Almighty uses it to propel us forward to live a life of purpose. So be kind to yourself. Learn from the mistakes. They enable you to grow as a person & become a better you!

The sadness you see, the disappointment you witness, the Almighty knows it all. We all fight battles no one knows except Him. Just remember, He knows all &  can help with all. There is no pain He does not understand. There is no struggle He does not know. He is All-Knowing!

If Satan can’t trap someone into sinning, be it major or minor, he keeps them busy with trivial acts which have no benefit. Instead of using our time wisely, fulfilling our priorities towards the Almighty & reaching our goal, Satan occupies us with useless actions. Stay vigilant!

In this age of social media, may we always be protected from unintentional evil we set on ourselves. Keep thanking the Almighty for all that He has blessed us with and be careful when showing off your blessings for the world to see. Keep arrogance at bay and always stay humble!

Stop trying to seek answers for everything. Some questions don’t need answers & they’re better off that way. You just need a firm heart, full of trust that it will turn out fine. A heart full of love & peace. You’ll be amazed at how much more you get out of the unspoken at times.

Oftentimes it’s hard for people to own up to their mistakes because they do not want to be seen negatively. In reality, it takes a strong person with integrity to admit a mistake. Those who are quick to realize, admit & apologize are more likely to gain the respect of others.

Almighty. In this troubled world, grant us peace and serenity to soothe our hearts and spirits right now. When we find ourselves awake in the middle of the night, our trials and tribulations can feel overwhelming. Keep us calm and content knowing You’re always watching over us!

Beware the ‘friends’ who find joy in your misery. Unfortunately there are many such people around. Remember, wishing ill for others will never resolve your problems or make them go away. Instead, pray for ease all round and the Almighty will alleviate your suffering!

The Almighty has gifted you with unique abilities and talents. They’re special to you. Remember, He blesses us all differently. Never allow anyone to make you feel insignificant. Such people love to make another person feel as though they aren't important. Don’t stand for it!

Disappointment, pain & suffering are part of life. They’re gut-wrenching & can affect us negatively. Remember, the Almighty wants us to learn a lesson in all that happens. So we have to find the best possible way to cope with such situations. Knowing that nothing lasts, helps!

In this life, you won’t always get what you want. But remember, by being grateful for what you have, you’re inviting more goodness into your life. Think of all those people who would trade places with you at the drop of a hat! Appreciate what He has bestowed on you always.

People will disappoint you. There’ll be times when they won’t meet your expectations. This can happen quite often. Instead of feeling let down, understand the Almighty’s plan in all this. He’s showing you that you can’t depend on others. Lay your full trust and hopes in Him!

Sometimes it’s best to let things be. You don’t need the answers to everything, you don’t have to be right always, don’t expect people to understand you and don’t fight to get your points across. Just be polite but firm. Work on yourself and keep your inner peace at all times!

Whatever you do comes back to you; good or bad; sooner or later. You’re a reflection of what you put out to the world. If you often use & abuse people, life will use & abuse you. If you dedicate your life to doing good, you will be rewarded. Be positive, kind & compassionate.

The Almighty puts different people in our lives at different times. It’s not an accident. It’s not a coincident. There’s a reason behind everything. People will come and go. Don't be disappointed or disheartened. Learn and grow from every experience. Keep moving forward.

He knows your pain, struggles, fears & anxieties. He knows they’re keeping you awake at night. He knows you’re trying your best to cope. He tests those whom He loves. And that He won’t burden you more than you can bear. Keep going just a little more. Trust that His help is near!

The truth is we’re being pulled in a huge way to conform to the ways of the world. Everyday we’re being bombarded with this mesage. We need to stand strong and firm. Rise above that which is prohibited by the Almighty. Rise above the darkness! Don’t give in. The choice is yours.

You have to admit that the closest you’ve been to the Almighty was during your darkest days. When you felt you had no other option, when you were facing life trials. Get into the habit of making Him a part of your life. In good & bad times. You’ll have a different view of life!

Trusting the Almighty when things are smooth & going well is easy. But when things are bleak & uncertain, what will you do? Do you crumble & cave in? That’s one of the greatest tests. He’s watching to see how you react. Have firm faith. Have your heart in the right place!

Don’t feel like you have to be drawn into every debate, every argument about any controversial issue. There are those who love to dissect every word & take issue with the smallest things. Don’t get involved with them. Don’t pass judgment. Don’t quarrel over disputable matters!

For every pain you endure,
For every fear that grips your heart,
For every worry that keeps you awake,
For every loss that you grieve over,
For anything & everything that you can’t handle, leave it to the Lord of the Worlds. He’s the best disposer of affairs for us!

Do you think you’re perfect & superior? Do you think everyone else needs to change but not you? Do you often shift focus from fixing yourself to fixing others? Be conscious of such mind traps. It’s Satan at work. He will make you feel proud & self-reliant! Check yourself!

Almighty. Grant us Your Mercy, relieve our fears and anxieties, remove our distress and let peace reign in our hearts. Bestow upon us patience and wisdom in all our endeavours and trials of life. May You always be our guiding light and the beacon of hope in our lives. Aameen.

Choose healing over hurting. Keep trying instead of giving up. Be kind instead of being mean & harsh. Learn to forgive instead of harbouring grudges. Do this consciously & you’ll find your heart lighter & more at ease. Build one another up rather than tear one another down!

There’ll be occasions when you feel like time’s running out and you are still waiting for the Almighty to work His Plan. That’s normal. You may feel discouraged. Some may go to extremes and start to question everything. Remember, it’s darkest before dawn. Hold tight to the rope!

Take control of your life. Don’t be like the candle in the wind, always vulnerable. Don’t let your life spin out of control. If you feel like you’re heading in the wrong direction, quickly turn back. Don’t let Satan take the wheel. Seek your strength from the Almighty.

Always remember that everyone is going through something; dealing with issues the best way they can and know how. No one is perfect. This is the nature of the world we live in. So learn to accept people with their flaws, imperfections, shortcomings, faults and weaknesses.

Sometimes, we’re so immersed in our problems that we don’t realise there’s a reason why things happen the way they do. The Almighty has a plan for everything that we experience. Nothing is ever wasted. Sooner or later, we’ll see the light of day and thank Him.

We are all busy. Planning for everything without giving a thought to what will happen tomorrow. And we do it with such certainty as if tomorrow is promised to everyone. There’s no harm in planning but always remember that the Almighty can change things in the blink of an eye.

The best thing you can do for yourself is to treat people better than how they treated you. Be kind to the unkind. Be the first to forgive. Lift the person who tried to push you down. Utter good words to your haters. Smile for no apparent reason just because you are grateful!

When people try to belittle you, scoff at your ideas or criticise you, don’t despair. What they’re showing you is their story; not yours. Don't let anyone change the direction of your dreams. The Almighty has given you all it takes to live to your full potential. Don’t waste it

Don’t be afraid of failure. It shows you’re human. This life is anything but perfect. So failure teaches you there’s room to grow and become better. With every shortcoming, we can learn something. Remember, your mistakes don’t define you. The truth is they teach you!

Don’t wait to turn back to the Almighty. Do it today. It’s as good a day as any; the sooner, the better. Seek Him. Thank Him & you’re on the road to a better life. It’s a misconception to wait for things to be prefect before you pray. Things will never be perfect. Start now!

Interview with Musa
More about Mufti Menk

Be blind to what others do & focus on yourself. There’s wisdom in that. Not only will you find peace in your life, you’ll be rewarded with Paradise. The world’s such that we’re focusing so much on what others have, their life, what they do etc. Disengage & mind your own business!

Quit worrying about what’s to come. It makes no sense and adds zero value to your life. Trust the Almighty, the best of Planners to work it all out. Stay focused on your goals and do your best in everything. Take it one step at a time! You’ll find things falling into place!

If you are feeling low, despondent & unappreciated, know that it’s the work of Satan. He’s an expert at planting such thoughts in you. He wants you to go into sin for a temporary high. You should know his tricks by now. Counter such thoughts. Seek your strength from the Almighty.

Always stay on high ground. Let others say  what they want. Don’t go down to their level. Let the Almighty handle the battles. He’s the fairest of Judges. Keep doing what you do best. Keep spreading a good message. One day, it will all click. It will then make sense to others!

Becoming involved in social media drama can drain your energy. If you’re often browsing, looking at what seems to be people’s perfect lives, you may develop envy and jealousy. This may cause unhappiness, leading to lower self esteem. It will all take its toll on your health!

Real popularity comes from being comfortable with ourselves. People who are well-liked by others treat everyone with respect. They don't put other people down or speak ill of them. They're confident & sure of themselves! They don’t have to resort to unfair behaviour!

Spend time correcting your shortcomings rather than defending them. That’s the only way you can make a significant change for the better. Remember to be mature enough to admit your mistakes and other poor choices for it is a sign of strength, not a weakness!

Almighty. Grant us strength during these difficult times. It’s easy to succumb to worry, fear & despair in this chaotic world. You’re our source of hope & comfort. Give us the courage to carry on & keep our hearts firm. Let us not forget to glorify You in all situations. Aameen!

Even when you’re going through what you think is the worst period in your life, the Almighty’s watching over you. He’s waiting to see how you deal with all that comes with it. Do you bear good patience or are you complaining every step of the way? This will determine the outcome!

Some will come into your life pretending to be friends when their true intention is to control you! You decide who to allow into your life. If you grow resentful of people who take up too much of your time & energy, it's a sign you aren't setting clear boundaries. Do it now!

The truth is social media makes us impatient. We’re rushing to get what someone else has. We want to be that person we see on our timeline, to live someone else’s life. Don’t let this happen. Learn to be content with what you have. Learn to appreciate the person that you are!

Many dwell on their past to such an extent that it ruins their future. Learn from your past so you don’t commit the same mistakes. But you must not stay stuck there; move beyond all that regret & pain because to do otherwise would be to waste what He has blessed you with - life!

Stop overthinking. Stop feeding your mind negative thoughts and  self-doubt. Most of what you think will probably won’t even happen. Don’t torture yourself. Love yourself enough and be kind to yourself. At the end of the day, remember, the Almighty wants only the best for you.

Being more pious doesn’t give you the right to be harsh to those around you. If at all, you should be gentler, kinder & always willing to extend a helping hand. Be strict with yourself by all means but when it comes to others, a softer  approach will achieve much more!

Whatever it is you’re going through, remember you don’t have all the answers to your trials. The Almighty does. Your job is to bear patience and manage the situation the best way you can. Let Him handle the rest. You need to trust Him. He is your Protector and your Healer!

Simple Task

Little Hanna needs your help.

Please pray for her and like & retweet to reach as many people as possible, to find others with a similar condition or those who can help. 

May the Almighty grant her a miraculous recovery. Aameen

Your value doesn’t depend on your looks, your social status or your past. It depends on how the Almighty sees you. Those with the worst past have shown it’s possible to create the best future. So don’t label people. Give everyone a chance, give them the benefit of the doubt.

Engage in self-reflection often especially within the societies we are in today. We can become disconnected from reality due to the constant 'online' culture where we think we know so much about others, we comment, mock, judge etc. Learn to look at our own shortcomings first!

Forgiveness for one’s sins is not automatic. it is something that must be sought for, with sincerity & true devotion. Becoming indifferent to one’s sins is fatally dangerous. Not only will it accumulate, hearts will harden in the process & you’re making a mockery of repentance.

Success isn't defined by achievements or how many material possessions one has, but rather how we use what the Almighty has bestowed on us to live a life of purpose, serving others & spreading goodness. Whatever you do, keep it low key & humble. Success isn’t loud & boisterous.

Always lift the people around you and help them thrive. Empower them. Look for the good in others & let it shine. There’s too much negativity around. People are always looking for ways to bring others down & tear them up. Don’t. It will come back to you some way, some day!

There’s no need to hide if you’ve made a mistake. Be mature enough to tell the truth. Don't put the blame on anyone or anything else. Assume responsibility. Take ownership of the mistake, admit to it, apologize for it, fix it and not repeat it. That’s the only way to grow!

The sad reality is people can attack you physically, verbally or any other way for no apparent reason. Perhaps they don’t like the way you look, how you dress, the company you keep, etc but senseless acts are on the rise. Such is the way of the world today. Stay woke.

We all know how precious time is yet we choose to engage in unproductive activities. Gossiping, backbiting, futile conversations, things which don’t concern us & the list goes on. Stop allocating time to such useless activities. See how much more time you’ll have each day.

Almighty. Give us the strength to respond with goodness when we’re not being treated the way we should be. Help us to be guided by what You’ve taught us & not by our emotions when dealing with difficult people. May we always be steered to make the right choice in such situations!

Trust the Almighty to give you the best outcome to your problem. Our limited wisdom doesn’t allow us to see certain things. But He can see the future & beyond. So when things don’t turn out the way you expect, trust Him to have always considered your best interest. That’s faith!

When you’re able to accept everything that happens to you as part of the Almighty’s plan, you’re on the road to something greater. You feel a sense of ease. Remember, one day, all the pieces of the puzzle will fit and you’ll be so pleased that you were patient right till the end!

Don’t worry about those who talk bad about you behind your back. The Almighty is All-Knowing and All-Seeing. He heard them. He will protect you and grant you blessings. You can’t stop people from talking but you can control how you respond to them. Stay above the fray.

When you’re doing well & making good progress, others will try to plant seeds of doubt & negativity all round. Bear patience. Don’t worry. The Almighty’s in full control. No one can touch you when He’s with you. Keep your focus on the task ahead. Don’t be distracted.

Always be kind. Motivate, empower, encourage and spread goodness. Do your best always. If your actions are not reciprocated, that’s okay. Keep going. It will all bear  fruit one day. And if you find yourself not able to do any of that, the least you can do is to not hurt others!

If you’ve left the Almighty out of your equation for some time because of your repeated sins, it’s time to seek Him out again today. Don’t waste any more time. Get back on track. He’s waiting to forgive you. He will heal you & make you whole again. Just one sincere repentance!

Don’t be complacent about the good deeds you do. There’s no such thing as auto-acceptance from the Almighty. In this age of social media where everything is up for the world to see, it gets even more difficult. Are you doing it for Him or for the likes and accolades from people?

Some love to gossip because they say the truth has become very boring. It doesn't sell, earn likes or followers. They'd rather harm others by spreading juicy false tales than speak the boring, unwanted, unpopular truth. Be wary of such people. More importantly, don't become one!

Do you want a good day? Well, start with the Almighty and end with the Almighty. Everything in between gets that much easier. Remember to do your best always, purify your intentions and whenever you find something is too much to handle, hand it over to the Lord of the Worlds.

Don’t dwell on how privileged you are & how good your life is. It’s how you end the journey that matters. Strive to live a life that endears you to your Creator. Everything else is secondary. Keep asking for a good end. Remember nothing is guaranteed in life, not even tomorrow!

As humans, we will get frustrated from time to time. When that happens, when our emotions begin to drive us, take a step back from the situation & let the Almighty take over. Pray that He grants us wisdom each time. Don’t feel like you have to do it alone. He’s only a call away!

Don’t underestimate the power of prayer. Don’t ask the Almighty for help only as the last resort. He fully expects us to make an effort to solve our problems but He doesn’t want us to do it alone. He’s always there for us but waits for us to reach out. Call out to Him!

Don’t ever believe that you’re the only one facing problem after problem. It’s all a matter of perception & perspective. Other people have been there before or have had it worse. There’s light at the end of the tunnel. The path is there. Trust the Almighty in your journey!

Do your best always but don’t expect perfect results. Remember, you’re human. You’re a work in progress. Take ownership of your mistakes. Learn from them. Forgive others when they make mistakes too. You’ll be a much happier person with a very different outlook towards life.

Don't rejoice over the misfortune of others. Remember, the Almighty is the fairest of judges. Let Him repay or punish others for whatever they’ve done. He’s All-Seeing, All-Knowing. We shouldn't find joy in anybody’s sorrow. Surely we wouldn’t like it if we were in their shoes!
What is more important to you?

Are you feeling anxious? Wondering what’s ahead? Your mind’s racing & your heart’s beating so fast. You keep asking where all this will lead to? One moment you’re panicking, the next, you’re calm. The Almighty wants you to trust that no matter what's ahead, He is always with you.

It’s natural to feel broken if you’ve been treated badly or been the subject of rumours etc. But remember, some things are not within your control. Turn every anxiety, fear & concern into a supplication. Look at it as another reason to submit to the Almighty. Let Him take over!

Gossip is wrong, no matter how you look at it. Spreading malicious rumors will not only hurt the person concerned but it can actually backfire on the person who originated the inconsiderate falsehood. No one ever benefits from mean and hurtful discussions about other people.

Almighty. Grant us strength and endurance to go through the tough tests right now. Many are wandering hopelessly. We know giving up is not an option. Keep us steadfast and firm in faith. No matter what's happening, fill our hearts with hope always. We know You have our backs!
BBC Sport - Sonny Bill Williams: 'I chased girls, drank alcohol and it only gave me emptiness' @SonnyBWilliams https://t.co/AHVLi1kyiY

Some get threatened when other people shine their light on the rest of world. They think that if you shine bright, it somehow gives them less opportunity to find their own success. Remember, the Almighty has given us all a chance to be successful. There is room for ALL of us.

Stop oversharing. Stop telling everything about your life to others. Our constant need for approval from virtual strangers is somewhat problematic. If we refrain from sharing a situation, it doesn't become any less valid or exciting. Rather, it becomes more personal & valuable!

No matter what others say about you, keep going. Just close your eyes and remind yourself that the Almighty is watching. Your efforts, your patience etc, He’s aware of everything. Look past the struggles, look past the pain. It’s not easy but it will all be worth it in the end.

In this age of social media, it’s easy to fret if your efforts don’t receive recognition or publicity. But realise that the Almighty’s protecting your sincerity & your work from corruption. Rremember, He loves deeds that are small & consistent.  So don’t  shortchange yourself.

When the Almighty wills something, nothing can stop it from happening. We should submit to Him & not question it. So, don’t get disheartened if you’re not married or with children yet. You may not be where you want to be; but you’re exactly where He wants you to be.

Your value as a person does not come from the material things in life. You always have something of value to offer the world & you don’t need anyone else’s validation to know this. So don’t compare yourself to your friends. Be happy for them whatever their situation may be!

Don’t expect perfection in this life. The mess ups, the delays, the heartbreaks, the things you don’t understand, they’re all part of the Almighty’s Plan for you. He’s worked out every detail in each chapter of your life. Your job is to bear good patience as you go through it!

Realize that you cannot control other people. You can’t force them to do what they don’t want to do. The only person you can control is you.  So don’t let their behaviour & what they do upset you. Your worrying, obsessing, venting etc, has zero impact on them. It only hurts you.

Never let anybody steal your happiness. Never let anyone keep you from seeing & sharing goodness with those around you. Never let someone’s hurtful words or actions wound you so deeply that you feel crippled & unable to forgive them. Let it go.Keep your focus. Rise above it all!

What they did to you wasn’t about you. Understand that & stop thinking that you did them wrong. It was about unresolved issues within themselves. It’s really not about you at all. It is about THEM & what’s inside them coming out & projecting onto you. So don’t take it personally!

Quit relying on people. They’ll only let you down. Today, they’re your friend, tomorrow, they could be your enemy. Now, they approve of you, the next minute they don’t! It’s all about their whims and fancies. Rely on the Almighty. He’s all you need!

Regrets, mistakes, failures are all part of life. Do yourself a favour and don’t dwell on them. Learn the lessons they’re meant to teach you and move on. Life’s too short to be crying over what didn’t work out. The Almighty’s giving you another opportunity. Don’t waste it!

Difficulty is somewhat like darkness. When you can’t understand what’s going on, you’re lost, in pain & you feel the whole world closing in on you. That’s the time when you have to lay complete trust in the Almighty. Have faith in Him. Bear good patience & He will rescue you!

Disagree by all means but don’t become rude & vulgar. Sadly, we only want to hear from those who are like-minded . We detest opinions & views that differ from ours. We’re highly intolerant. If you want to grow as a person, start listening to others. Appreciate their viewpoint!

In life, you often have to make a choice that’s not easy. Always seek your strength & guidance from the Almighty. Don’t wallow in self-pity. Don’t stand in the midst of fear without trusting Him.  Remember, He knows best. It’ll make it easier to move on, knowing He has your back!

You may think they’re taking your words lightly because they’re always smiling. Be careful what you say because such people are close to the Almighty; they cry & pour their heart out at night to the Lord of the Worlds. They carry a sense of tranquility & softness in their hearts!

Almighty. Heal our broken hearts that have been wounded by others. Guide us in the journey towards healing & recovery. Grant us patience & wisdom; encourage us to take the correct steps to find peace in our distress. Only You Have the power to change despair into hope! Aameen!

It’s rather sad if you feel unappreciated for what you’ve done. But the truth is, purify your intent and do things solely for the Almighty. That way, no matter how others respond to the good work you’ve done, your heart is still attached to the only One who matters. He sees you!

Often in life we get upset with what happens, especially when things don’t go according to our plan. We forget who is in control. The Lord of the Worlds has the best plans for us always, yet we often doubt, get upset and start questioning Him! Remember, He is the Best Planner.

If you’re often disappointed by others, you have to learn to manage your expectations. Why do we expect so much from others while expecting so little of ourselves. Have confidence in yourself and your abilities. The Almighty has blessed you with a lot. Use the blessings wisely.

Everything that happens in your life happens for a reason. It’s part of your story.  It was written for you. What’s this life but a series of tests. Take it as a lesson & move on. Sometimes you'll be knocked down but you must quickly get up. Brace yourself for the journey ahead.

Stamp out that ego and pride. Don’t allow them to get in the way of your personal growth & development. Oftentimes, we blame others for everything & keep defending ourselves even when we’re wrong. Quit this habit. Take ownership of your mistakes. It shows strength of character.

You’re no stranger to pain. It’ll change you. But how it affects you is up to you. Some get really upset, bitter with life. Some take it in their stride; try their best to cope. Some smile & breeze through it! Let your pain have a good purpose. Let it make you better & stronger!

With humans, you seldom get second chances. Once you’ve messed up, you’re labelled a failure. With the Almighty, it’s completely different. You’ll be given a second, third, fourth chance etc. He’ll always throw you a lifeline. Call on Him & He will lift you out of your misery.

Give your kindness away without expecting anything back. Kindness is contagious. The person you’re being kind to benefits through your help & you'll feel good for having helped someone. The world is made better through your kindness. Trust me when I say we need this badly today!

The Almighty will test you again & again. So when you are afflicted with a trial, instead of placing your hopes in other humans who are equally weak, place your trust in the Almighty. Place your utmost trust in Him and watch how He will help you through unimaginable sources.

We’re all sinners. We all make mistakes. We falter. We trip. We fall. We repent & seek forgiveness from our Merciful Lord. We don’t see ourselves as a failure. We learn from our mistakes. We refuse to entertain what Satan plants in our heads. We get up & keep pressing forward.

We hate delays. We want things to happen when we want them. But the truth is, behind every delay, there's some goodness. Don't regard every delay as negative. Remember, the Almighty knows what we don’t. There’s always some hidden good why certain things happen the way they do.

For serious self-diagnosis to happen, we need honesty, faith & hope. Don’t make excuses for our shortcoming, admit our flaws & pray that the Almighty sees us through it. We have to accept that we are human & we falter; yet we can improve ourselves with help from the Almighty!

Whatever you undertake in life, be it in business, marriage, etc don’t expect a perfect fit. If you do, you’re in for a huge disappointment. Learn to adapt to given situations. Construct a positive environment for yourself & above all seek your strength from the Almighty.

When dealing with negative people, protect yourself from becoming angry or frustrated. It’s not worth the heartache. Don’t retaliate; try to hold your tongue. Responding angrily feeds their negativity. Hold your tongue.

When the whole world’s in deep slumber,
When you wake for the sole purpose of worshipping Him,
When you’re alone with Him, crying out, seeking His help & forgiveness in the depths of the night
When you feel His Might over all else,
That’s a cure for your distressed heart!

Whatever’s happening in your life, keep going. You didn’t come this far to just quit & give it all up. Remember, the Almighty loves you & will keep redirecting you to what has been planned for you. Even when you can’t see what’s ahead, take that leap of faith! Trust Him always!

Be prepared to be tested with fear, failure, loss, health, wealth. You can bear it with good patience or get upset & miserable. What should keep you going is the thought that nothing lasts. The Almighty has a beautiful Paradise waiting for you. Don’t forsake that!

Almighty. Grant us renewed strength for we can’t carry on alone. Our souls are tired, sapped by the worldly goings-on. Grant us the courage, wisdom and serenity of mind to accept that which cannot be changed. We know You have a plan for us and it’s a beautiful one. Aameen.

The truth is you don’t need many friends. As long as you have a few who are willing to go out of their way for you, you’re blessed. The one who will give you a lift when you’re feeling down; the one who won’t hurt you but who loves you unconditionally. Cherish such friends.

Make the Almighty your centre of focus every few minutes daily & you will surely find ease in the hours that follow. Take small breaks during the day; think of Him & thank Him. Put Him first & your life will be elevated to a different level; a whole different perspective!

When you feel hopeless,
When your world is topsy-turvy,
When you can’t see the light at the end of the tunnel,
When your world seems to be crumbling, crashing down on you;
Always remember that a sincere prayer can change your entire life.
Where there’s hope, there is life

It’s common to look at how others are doing and feel like you’re not making much progress or worse, have remained stagnant. Don’t listen to such whisperings from Satan. Whenever you think your life isn't going anywhere, just remember where you began and count your blessings!

The Almighty will create situations of hardship to see our reactions & course of action. Do we bear good patience, take it in our stride & use it to get closer to Him or do we lose the plot and start drifting away from HIm? The choice is yours. Remember, everything is temporary!

Many of us try so hard to be popular, accepted and liked by others. Often, we go out of our way to be the person others want us to be. We forget that’s not the goal; simply because you’ll never be able to please everyone. You’ll end up frustrated and miserable. Be yourself!

You are who you are when no one is looking. That’s the real you. The “you” that the Almighty knows, which others may not. Remember, it’s easy to be nice & feel good when things are smooth & ideal. The real “you” shows up when things  are crumbling & nothing is going you way!

When you pray, pray wholeheartedly. Give it your all; as if it’s your last one. The Almighty knows and He is watching you. He knows how many distractions are vying for your attention & pulling you away from prayer. So ignore Satan and stand before your Lord with great humility.

We are all struggling one way or another. We feel stuck, often at our wits’ end; overwhelmed & can’t seem to find a way out. Seek your strength from the Almighty through patience & prayer. Keep asking. He never tires of hearing your supplication as long as you don’t give up!

Most of the things you worry about in life are insignificant. Most of them you can’t  control anyway. It’s the Almighty’s way of showing you who is in charge. So focus on being the best version of yourself. Be a shining example for others to follow and hand over the rest to Him.

Quit overthinking & being anxious always. Trust the Almighty to be your Guide. There’s nothing like finding peace & rest from all your troubles in Him. Your problems may still be present, but when you learn to trust Him, peace will reign in your heart. Seek comfort in Him alone.

Don’t give up on others because the Almighty never gives up on us. You can’t control people, making them do what’s right. You can only show the way. Guidance comes from the Almighty. So don’t be frustrated. Do your best and let Him take care of the rest. He guides whom He wills.

Always choose love, kindness and forgiveness. Always choose to walk the high ground. Never mind what others say, never mind what rumours they choose to spread about you; never lose your cool and composure. Never tire of doing good. The Almighty loves  such consistent acts.

People are quick to criticize. Always thank your critics. Even if he is harsh & rude, thank him. He might have been having a bad day, or maybe he’s just a negative person in general. Take criticism positively. It’s a good thing for you anyway; a means of keeping yourself humble.

Almighty. We seek Your  forgiveness, especially on this blessed day as we are sinners & have committed many sins. Only You can forgive all of them. May we always turn to You for strength to forgive others as well.  Shower us with Your Mercy which we so desperately need. Aameen.

It’s not always what you say that matters. Knowing what not to say is equally important. Don’t feel like you have to respond to everyone & take part in every discussion & argument thrown your way.  Often, the best response in many situations is simply to remain silent. Peace!

It’s natural to feel sad. It’s part of being human. No matter how bad the situation, even if the suffering feels endless, there’s light at the end of the tunnel. The Almighty has promised us. He won’t burden us beyond our capacity. He will give us the strength that we need!

Don't become obsessed with social media. When the number of likes & followers is your main focus, when your values & morals are compromised or when you barely spend time with family or your Maker, then it's time to change. Slow down & ponder! The successful prioritise correctly!

Many chase money, wealth, status, etc in life. But never have they found true contentment & peace of mind from any of that, because the hearts are attached to the wrong thing. If you want a heart that’s content, develop a relationship with your Maker. Your soul will be at ease.

Don’t hate or begrudge someone who ignores you. If it makes them happy, so be it. Don’t let the behaviour of someone else affect you. You can’t change people. But you can go where you are appreciated. Remember, life has a way of dishing out to others what they dish out to you!

Your trials are meant to draw you closer to the Almighty; for you to acknowledge His Might & Prowess. Only He can grant you relief. If they take you away from Him, you’ve failed the test. It’s important to understand His Plan so you don’t lose out on what’s in store for you!

People are prone to conflicts. Some will find any excuse to get into arguments with those whose views differ from theirs. They will even take you to task. Don’t get into such battles. Keeping the peace is more important so long as your belief is not compromised.

The hardest part of life’s journey is going through the unfamiliar or unknown because we don't know what to expect. But when you walk in firm faith, you no longer worry about what will happen down the road. Your heart trusts the Almighty. You know He has it all figured out!

Don’t let other people bring out the worst in you. You’re bound to meet them. These individuals may provoke you to say things you regret or pressure you to do things you wouldn't normally do. Stay true to your values and refuse to let others have a negative influence over you!

Don’t despair when you see others receive blessing after blessing & have their prayers answered. Understand that the Almighty has a plan. He will respond when He feels the time is appropriate; when He feels that you’re ready to receive what you’ve been asking for! Patience!

Social media makes you focus on what others have. You yearn for their lifestyle, their five-star holidays, palatial homes and perfect  families. You are immersed in something that’s not yours. Start focusing on what you have. Be grateful. You have a lot to be thankful for. A lot!

You’re my Creator, Provider, Cherisher, Bestower, Sustainer & Curer.
You’re my source of strength & wisdom. You’re my Eternal Refuge.
You’re my Guide & Protector.
You’re my go-to in good & bad times.
You’re the Lord of the Worlds.
You’re the One.
The Almighty.

Never lose hope in His Mercy. To do so is an insult to the Almighty. It’s also a grave sin. Lay your trust in Him firmly & always do your best in all that you undertake. Everything will work out in the end. It may not be how you planned it, but it’s certainly part of His Plan!

Feeling stuck in life? Do you keep going round in circles? Then you have to stop doing what you’re doing & take stock of your life. Reevaluate your priorities & shift your mindset. Only then can you get out of the repetitive rut you’re in. Seek your strength from the Almighty

Live your life one day at a time. Do your best & be the best version of yourself, improving with each passing day. Don’t worry about tomorrow; let the Almighty take care of that. Remember, your journey is yours alone. Don’t be distracted. Pray for His guidance in all that you do!

Sometimes, when you get too comfortable & things are too smooth, the Almighty will shake you out of your comfort zone. Don’t be alarmed. Read His signs. If you have a good attitude & bear patience, He will grant you something that’s greater than you imagined.

Whatever pain you’re experiencing today will hold you in good stead tomorrow. The more you suffer today, the stronger you become. This life’s not a rosy bed. Tomorrow's success is based on today's discomfort. Patience, a strong willpower & the right attitude will see you through.

It’s natural to feel tired and discouraged when life deals you a blow. We are generally weak and crumble with the slightest hardship. Always remember that you’re not alone. The Almighty will give you strength and power to overcome your difficulties. Trust Him completely.

Don’t be insensitive towards the feelings of others. Learn to be empathetic & feel for them. Put yourself in their shoes. Try at least. Sometimes it’s not what you do or say that is inconsiderate, it is the lack of it that hurts. Reach out to people. Listen more. Don’t judge.

Almighty. Protect us from those who are trying to harm us & have bad intentions towards us. Keep our hearts from fear & fill it with love & goodness. You are indeed our refuge & strength! Surround us with those who will empower us. May You always be our Guide & watch over us!

It takes more than willpower to stop worrying. You know that because you’ve tried it. Yet you can’t seem to stop worrying. People who don’t know the Almighty & how He works tend to worry more. Hand over what you can’t control to Him & let Him take over. Lighten your load.

It’s a fact that your strength will offend some people. These are the ones who want to control & manipulate you & keep you bound! Don’t worry about them. They have no power over you! Only the Almighty does! Trust Him to take care of those who really need help. Remain steadfast!

Social media can ruin your marriage. Put together your smart gadgets & social media & you have a volatile combination that can dominate your marriage & control your life. Communication with your spouse should take priority. Don’t let anyone else, let alone your gadgets intervene!

Choose peace over conflict. It’s a better way to go. Choose silence or choose to walk away from those who are always looking for a battle about someone or something. You can’t win even when it’s not about you. So don’t bother getting drawn into situations  that will drain you!

There are so many dissatisfied people around us. Those who are always quick to complain. They speak like the whole world owes them a living. Nothing good comes out of their mouths. They can ruin your day & sap your energy. Try your best not to engage them. Pray for such people.

Getting close to the Almighty is not something that will happen overnight. It’s hard work. Set daily goals. Push yourself but be realistic. Pray. Do all that He’s  prescribed for you. Do your best. He knows you’re trying. But you have to make an effort. Keep going!

There’s no reason to fear anyone other than the Almighty. Our sustenance is not determined by anyone but Him. When we understand this, it should lead to peace & tranquility in our hearts. If we put our trust in Him alone, we know that everything is according to His Decree!

Our wisdom is limited. We can’t see beyond a certain point & certainly not what lies ahead. Even when you don't understand all the details of the plan, the Almighty, with His Divine Wisdom, knows everything, right to the last detail. So why don’t we trust Him with our affairs?

Stop trying to please people. The truth is, you’ll never be good enough. Even at your best, they’ll find something to pick on. That’s the nature of Man. So stop sacrificing your happiness for people who don’t care much about you. Keep your heart attached to your Creator. Content!

As you climb the ladder of life, make sure it’s on solid ground. This represents your faith integrity and truth. Others will be jealous. Don’t worry about them. The only ones you should be looking at are the ones who are going in the same direction. Lift them up as well!

If you want ease in your life, don’t make things difficult for others. Treat people the way you want to be treated. What you consider small gestures of kindness can go a long way to ease tensions & spread goodness. Always have the best manners; a trait of the people of Paradise!

If you want change, do it soonest possible. If you want to repent, do it now. Don’t wait. We often tell ourselves, there’s time to do it tomorrow. Don’t let Satan trick you. Tomorrow is not promised to anyone. Waiting is not an option so let us not delude ourselves any longer!

No matter how complicated life gets, stay in your own lane. Don’t get involved in other people’s lives or their drama. They will try to get you on board & make you take sides. Don’t. Let’s face it, life’s complicated enough. Focus and mind your own business. It’s less stressful!

It’s alright to disagree with someone. You don’t have to engage in an argument or get nasty about it. Politely decline to waste time arguing. You’re entitled to your opinion, just like the other person. Remember, the wise would always hold their tongue and keep the peace.

Quit worrying about the problematic people in your life. The troublesome ones, the petty ones who are trying to hold you back & create unease. Let the Almighty take care of them. He knows how to move the wrong people out of your life and bring the right people in. Trust Him!

Discipline your mind to focus on what truly matters. Let’s face it; there’s so much clutter in our minds because we all suffer from information overload. Focus on the issues and people who matter. Let go of things which are of no consequence. You’ll enrich your life that way!

Almighty. Give us a steadfast faith & complete trust in You in this uncertain world; knowing that You’ll protect us, come what may. Guard us from temptation & those who’d try to make us compromise our convictions. Let us not attach our hearts to this temporary world. Aameen.

If there are people in your life who treat you poorly and try to make you feel like you are less than enough, or that you need to prove your worth in some way, keep your distance from them. Spend time instead with people who lift you up. Keep your heart attached  to your Maker.

Pray for those who hide their sufferings from the rest of the world. They always have a smile for you & you end up thinking they’re completely fine. These are the ones who spend their nights crying out to their Lord, begging for His Mercy and relief from their trials. Respect!

Whatever others may have done to you, don’t let their actions  turn you cold on the inside. More importantly, don’t let it make you unkind. Seek comfort and solace in the Almighty.  Cry your heart out, be sad but get up again. Learn from the experience but don’t become bitter!

Beware the one who dilutes his faith just to appease the masses. You may think you’re getting away with it but remember, the Almighty is All-Knowing. There’s no such thing as going with the flow in matters of faith. Make the Almighty your priority. You will be truly prosperous!

There’s good in every hardship. Recognise the signs. The days you were broke because you lost your job, the days you grieved because you lost a loved one, the days you wanted to give it all up was the time you found something priceless. You found your strength in the Almighty!

If you’re feeling stuck and down in the dumps often, ask yourself, are you focusing on disappointments? Becaus if you are, you won’t be able to move forward. You’ll feel a heavy load on your back. Let go of whatever it is that’s holding you back. Forgive and move on.

Giving is good. It gives you a sense of purpose. But there are those who will squeeze every drop of goodness from you. That’s where you need to draw the line. Selfless giving can become overwhelming. It’s good to give more than you receive but keep your own interests in sight!

We had no say when we came into this world & we have no say when we’ll leave this earth. Yet, we behave as if we know it all. We trudge the earth arrogantly without sparing a thought for others! Humble yourself. If you don’t, the Almighty will surely send some lessons your way!

There are people who enjoy putting others down. It’s a cruel way of making someone else seem less important than you. Avoid reacting immediately & don’t retaliate. Deal with it in your own time.  You could also ignore it because silence can be the best weapon at times!

Social media is making us anti-social. We’ve become so engrossed in technology & mostly our smartphones, that at times we become quite oblivious to our surroundings. If you feel you’re not being social enough, get off your devices, turn off your phone. Give it a try today!

Don’t use your children as pawns in your divorce. Many do it & the children suffer in the end. Communicate with the ex, set guidelines on child maintenance. Make sure you stop to consider how your actions are going to affect your children before you engage in them. Have a heart!

Do you trust your Creator? As in fully trust the Almighty to turn your life around? Some people always feel anxious, wondering what's ahead of them. They panic. They forget who’s in control of their lives. He wants you to keep your mind focused on Him. He will see you through it.

Don’t think that bad things happen only to you. They happen to everyone. Every single day. The difference lies in how you deal with any given situation. Your attitude counts. If you choose to see things in a positive light, then you’ll rise above it and overcome it eventually.

When people misunderstand & reject you, don’t feel miserable. It’s bound to happen sooner or later. It’s part of the Almighty’s plan to make you realize that you shouldn’t rely on His Creation but only on the One who created you. People will let you down but He will lift you!

Don’t make the mistake of telling someone too much about yourself. Over sharing is bad. It can invite negative energy  from those who don’t want good for you. They will use the information in a way that can be detrimental to you. Share selectively only with those who truly care.

The Almighty did not create us to become popular with everyone and to live up to their expectations. No! We’re here to worship our Creator and be the best we can in this short life. If you find yourself deviating from this main goal, you’ll end up miserable. Get back on track!

Stay firm & resolute. Don’t let circumstances sway your faith like a candle in the wind. Never doubt that the Almighty’s aware of everything that’s going on in your life. Don’t let others create doubts in your mind. He has brought you this far. Do you think He’ll abandon you?

Today's Friday Sermon from Harare, Zimbabwe 

https://t.co/jTnqOPmFcw

Almighty. Help us understand what is really happening in our lives. Give us the strength to surpass all the trials and problems that are coming our way. We’re doing our best. Remove every obstacle that prevents us from getting closer to You. Lead us to the path of righteousness.

You can dream all you want but if there’s no action to realise those dreams then it amounts to nothing. Be proactive. Walk the talk. That’s the only way people will respect you. Words that don’t translate into action remain mere words. This life’s too short to waste like that!

Don’t feel like you have to take part in every conversation and every argument. Often people will draw you into it, egging you to take sides. Don’t. Exercise restraint. Be smart enough to know when to speak and when to remain silent. It will save you from a whole lot of trouble.

If you are often stressed, anxious, feel like a failure or you're not doing what you think you should be doing, consider this. Start helping others. You’ll feel a sense of self-worth that you’re actually making a difference & easing someone’s load. See how your life changes!

Just because you can’t do it, doesn’t mean the Almighty can’t do it! He’s the Lord of the Worlds. If He can turn night into day & have perfect synchronisation in things around us, He can surely  change our situation in the blink of an eye. He’ll do it when He knows you’re ready!

Many people find it hard to let go of past disappointments, regrets and losses. They keep revisiting old wounds. They keep thinking of what-ifs. Honestly, what good does it do? Learn the lesson. Move on. Get your gaze up onto the horizon and embrace what the Almighty has for you!

The Almighty will get you there. Never doubt that. He will open doors you never imagined; place the right people in your path and grant you the ability to move on henceforth. You need to trust Him and do the best you can. Understand His Plan and read His signs. You’ll be okay!

We may not understand why some things happen. Embrace them anyway.  Some of the most beautiful chapters in our lives happened when we weren’t sure what was going on . Life is what we make of it. The Almighty is watching how we respond. Thank Him upon all conditions. Always.

We all have a fixed time in our lives. Why is it that some are able to achieve much more than others? That’s because so many people run out of focus, discipline & determination. They just go with the flow, talk a lot & expect things to fall into place without lifting a finger!

We live in an age of envy; social media has created a world in which everyone else seems happy but you. You’re finding it hard to come to terms with it. You can’t achieve the lifestyle you want but which you see others have. You need to get back to reality! Stop the comparison!

There’s so much negativity in the world around us that it’s so easy to feel down. Get hold of yourself. Don't let your burdens drown you. Don’t let your trials make you think there’s no way out. Remember, nothing lasts. Start focussing on your blessings, no matter how small.

Change is not easy. Change is hard work. Change requires discipline, focus, single-mindedness, commitment. But the truth is, if you are obsessed with results, you will never change. You’ll get nowhere. Focus instead on change & you’re more likely to get the results that you want.

Why is the Almighty taking so long to respond? We hear this almost daily.  We’ve wept, we’ve begged, cried our hearts out, but still He’s not answering. Why? Because He, with His Divine and Infinite Wisdom operates on His schedule.  But remember, your patience is your Paradise!

Always ask the Almighty to make you a blessing wherever you go. Let’s admit it. There are many out there who are plain downright painful to be around with. They make life difficult for others, behave in a demanding way & make it seem like the other person is the problematic one!

Be wary of toxic people. They are the ones who always blame others for everything that happens so that they don’t have to take accountability for their own behaviour. They act like the whole world owes them a living! They will sap your energy. Let the Almighty take over. Peace!

When you hold on to hate, you allow people from your past to continue to hurt you. That’s not a wise move. People from your past should stay in the past. They can’t continue to hurt you unless you hold on to the hurt. Let go and let the Almighty deal with them. Lighten your load.

Don’t engage petty, small-minded people. They tend to give others a hard time with their perceptions of life; trapped in their own little cocoons. If you do not conform to their notions of life, you’re deemed wrong! Don’t get involved with such people. Pray for them to be guided!

In today’s world, we are obsessed with figures. The number of followers, the number of likes, the number of friends & so on. Dig deeper beneath those figures & there’s an important message. Do not count the number of friends you have but the number of friends you can count on.

Friday Sermon from Harare, Zimbabwe today.
Topic: Effects of Irresponsible Speech by Mufti Menk 

https://t.co/dnuf7dcR88

Almighty. Whenever we’re stressed, anxious or afraid, help us remember to run to You and no one else. You’re the only One who can calm our fears, anxieties and turbulent hearts. We can’t handle these times alone. We need Your peace & infinite wisdom to guide us through it all.

Rather than reaching out and hitting back at the person who is irritating you, learn to exercise restraint. Remind yourself that the Almighty rewards the one who is patient and watches over all things. As long as you are pleasing Him, don’t fret. Nobody can cause you any harm.

When the Almighty exposes someone’s intention towards you, He has done it for a reason. Some will act like they care about you but behind your back, their intent is totally the opposite. They may even harbour ill thoughts towards you. But don’t worry. The truth will always out!

It’s natural to feel unsure and uncertain about what life has to offer. We’re human after all. Come to terms with it but don’t let it engulf you. Rise above it because you know that the Almighty has your back always. Take a deep breath and move forward. There’s no other way!

Never mind how they choose to treat you. You walk the higher ground.  Don’t stoop to their level. Treat people with respect and honour. Treat them with love and kindness. Why should you? For a simple reason that what you do will find its way back to you. Somehow, someday.

When you spread kindness, you’re actually giving the person strength. You’re not reminding him of his weakness. You’re empowering him to go forth and do what he has to do. You’re giving value to other people without expecting anything in return. That’s surely a good thing!

People have microscopic vision when it comes to the flaws of others. Nothing escapes their eyes. They’ll pick on the minutest blemish & find fault with it but will stay clear of their own shortcomings. Staying away from that which doesn’t concern you is a good rule to live by!

Blessed is he who keeps enduring test after test, who firmly believes & puts his trust in the Almighty. No matter what test comes his way, he will endure with good patience because he knows the Almighty is in full control. Such people will have a special place on Judgement Day.

Life isn’t easy. It hurts. It’s difficult. It’s tough to imagine the uncertainties. But you know what? The Almighty is planning so much behind the scenes. He will unfold them when the time is right. May be tomorrow, perhaps another day. Be patient. You’ll emerge stronger.

Ups and downs are part of our daily occurrence. Instead of letting it sour your day, thank the Almighty. Don’t fret. He’s using every test and every trial to refine you. And He will keep doing it till you pass the test and are ready to move on.  So take it in your stride.

Some people can’t bear to see you having a good life & being blessed. They will want to spoil things for you. Beware such people. They won’t hesitate to stab you in your back as well. Learn to be unconditionally happy for those the Almighty has blessed. Your turn will come.

@nasseralqtami اللهم اشفه يا شافي اللهم عافه
May the Almighty, the Owner of cure, cure him! Aameen

Nothing that happens in your life is by accident. The Almighty plans everything to the finest detail. There’s a reason behind every incident. Sooner or later, the reason will become apparent. Spend time understanding His Plan. You’ll feel a lot better about your life.

Often when people talk about change, they mean a physical change. Changing how you look doesn’t count if you’re still carrying on with bad habits etc. Real change comes from within. It means working on yourself from the inside starting with your heart, the root of most problems!

When someone makes a mistake & then apologizes, accept it & move on. It’s a teachable moment for us all. Be magnanimous. There’s no need to analyze it & tear the person down. It takes a lot of guts to admit you’re wrong. But with the right attitude, you can move on & grow!

If you want to criticize others, do so constructively. It’s easy to just shoot from the hip and say anything that comes to mind. By doing so, you’re dragging the person down. But it takes a mature soul to actually want to correct someone; to see him become a better person.

At times, friends & loved ones are the ones who hurt us most. Considering the nature of these relationships, some incidents can leave a deep wound, threatening to uproot friendships & harm family ties. Turn to the Almighty; only He can help you in finding forgiveness for them.

The difficult people in your life can be your greatest teacher.  Be grateful for the lesson they’re teaching you; those who push your buttons, annoy you with their antics give you the greatest chance for personal growth. Remember, you don’t grow when it’s all comfortable & good.

Almighty. Only You know the trials and tribulations we are facing in this life. Only You know our pain and understand our discomfort. Only You are there for our grief and sorrow. Only You have the power to heal us, grant hope in our hearts and make us feel whole again. Aameen.

Are you prepared to face your Maker? Are you prepared for your first night in the grave & your life in there which will be much longer than here on earth? Are you prepared to account for all your deeds? If your answer is no... Are you then prepared to start preparing for death?

When helping others, do so sincerely, from your heart, not expecting anything in return from them. Do it with utmost respect, not in a derogatory way, making them feel small or less in stature. Maintain dignity and self-respect at all times. May the Almighty accept our deeds!

Never forget that Satan is a big enemy. He loves it when we are at loggerheads with people. He loves it when there’s unrest, fighting, arguing, lots of turmoil everywhere. So protect yourself and do your best not to get drawn into such situations where there is disunity.

Suicide is NOT an option! When you’re in the depths of despair,  remember, to prolong your prayer and confide in Him. He knows what you’re going through. He will never burden you with more than you can bear. Keep your heart firmly atttached to Him. He will find a way out.
