Don't allow your circumstances to dictate your feelings. When you accept the Almighty’s Decree fully, you have the right attitude towards difficulties or bad news. You accept there’s good in everything eventually. You’re able to walk firmly & steadily. You have firm faith in Him.

Let hatred go
Let envy go 
Let grudges go
Let self-doubt go
Let low self-esteem go 
Let toxic thoughts go
Let negativity go
Let inner peace prevail
Let your heart be light.

We change many things in our lives, almost on a daily basis. In fact, change is the only constant today. From physical appearance to our jobs, things are changing. So why do we cling on to our thoughts, ideas, notions, perceptions & mindset which serve no purpose? Let them go!

Spreading rumours and gossip is incredibly dangerous. It destroys reputations, breaks down relationships and causes mayhem in someone’s life. It’s so common today because so many have lost basic decency and wouldn’t bat an eyelid mass texting such messages. Be careful!

Focus on the right things. Things that matter. Not on other people's lives, their drama, problems & behaviour. All that isn’t your business. You need to fix what needs fixing in your life. Don’t be distracted. Don’t compare your life to others. Circumstances are never the same.

Some people love to make fun of others & humiliate them in public. They lack social manners & some are plain downright rude. They are perhaps unaware that no one has the right to humiliate or hurt another. Besides, the one humiliated may be closer to the Almighty. Be mindful.

Keep reminding yourself that you can’t control people’s thoughts and actions. You don’t have to engage every critic, rebutt every point, win every argument or prove them wrong. Let them say what they will. Channel your energy towards more productive things. Don’t lose focus!

Avoid the trap of not treasuring what you truly have. Many make this mistake in life. You’ll end up losing what is really precious. Remember, some things in life can’t be fixed once they’re broken. Time doesn’t heal all wounds. You don’t want to lose what you value the most!

How you treat people & what you do for them will, in no way, guarantee any form of reciprocation on their part. Some may even take you for granted. That’s the nature of man. Don’t despair because the Almighty is aware of every single deed, no matter how small they may appear.

Life is not a sprint but a long, arduous ordeal, a marathon. If you don’t pace yourself you will burn out. So keep a steady pace and keep your focus on the road ahead. Remember, as long as you’re doing your part, the Almighty will do the rest. Don’t stress too much. Keep going.

We’ve all had things done to us by other people. For some, they want to settle the score and seek revenge; although we have been taught not to repay evil with evil. Revenge can backfire. The best way to seek justice is often to leave it to the Almighty!

If you’re going through a rough patch, a difficult time, know that you're not alone. That’s life, with all its ups and downs. Embrace it. What you’re going through is not peculiar to you. Everyone has a story to tell, a wound to heal or a scar to show. So keep your chin up!

The nicest people are empathetic. They put themselves in everyone’s shoes. They know how bad it feels  to be mocked at, ridiculed and made fun of. They understand that life has its moments. They try to help people overcome their struggles and spread kindness in their path.

The problem with some is they get so fixated with what they want that they overlook what they have. Be careful. This is how ingratitude sets in. It starts small and it grows to the point that you pursue what you want relentlessly at the expense of those around you. Be mindful!

Almighty. Thank you for always being there. Some days feel too hard. We’re hurting. Struggling. Fighting fear & worry at every turn. You’re the only One who can turn hearts around. You’re our Healer. Nothing is too difficult for you. Strengthen our conviction in You.

When one door closes, don't despair. Another ten are opened but we often refuse to see them. Perhaps the door you wanted to enter from would not have led you to the success you imagined. Trust the Almighty. He steers you towards success even when you think He has abandoned you.

At times you will feel like your faith is being tested. Your soul is tired. You start questioning things. You’re doubtful. You’re fearful. This is all part of the Almighty’s Plan. But remember, He will never burden you with more than you can bear. Trust Him with all your heart!

They say old habits die hard. Do not go back to your old ways, no matter what you’re experiencing in life. Toxic habits, negative people and negative energy always tend to make a come back when you are doing better in life. Don’t neglect your link with your Maker. Stay focused!

Positivity is contagious, so is negativity. Make sure you’re spreading what’s positive. Only then will you be able to attract something similar. It’s not a coincidence that the day will appear brighter when you’re brimming with positivity and hope! Keep it alive in your heart!

Your pain, your struggles, your  hardship will always lead to strength. Yes. Without a doubt. They aren’t random events but carefully planned by the Almighty. The Best Planner. They have a beautiful purpose. They will lift you, strengthen you and mould you. Embrace them.

When you’ve been wronged you expect an apology. At times, it doesn’t come. If a person doesn’t apologize, it’s not because they don't believe they made a mess, but perhaps because they just don't know how. That’s a fact. Try not to take it personally! Forgive them. Move on.

Always ask the Almighty to make our intentions pure, our words honest and our actions sincere. Don’t taint what the Almighty has given us with arrogance. Always humble yourself. It doesn’t matter how powerful you are, king or commoner, your grave will be similar.

Sad is he who thinks he has done many good deeds only to find out on Judgement Day that he has lost them all through backbiting, gossiping, slandering and showing up the faults of others. Stay away from these evil acts. Mind your own turf and you will reap the rewards!

Losing someone you love is one of the biggest tests in life. You’ll have to carry on without the one you thought you could never live without. Allow yourself time to grieve. The pain & heartache will serve as reminders. Submit to the Almighty’s Decree. He will grant you ease.

Contentment is the greatest remedy for stress. People under stress will pay enormous amounts of money to alleviate their pain, whether through drugs or therapy. Yet, a believer who’s content with the Almighty's Decree finds a greater relief, without spending even a cent!

No matter how tired you are, how much you’re struggling, keep moving closer towards the Almighty. Remember, our hearts and faith are constantly shifting. Don’t let Satan take control. Try your best to keep on the straight path always. It won’t be easy but it will be worth it!

Don’t waste your effort worrying about what people will think or say about you. It’s a futile exercise and it’s wrong to waste precious time like that. Instead, use that time wisely; do meaningful work, help someone. Spread goodness & kindness which can have a ripple effect!

When people show you their true colours, take heed. The trouble is we try to convince ourselves that they’re not what they've proven to be and we end up getting hurt. This is foolish. Read the signs that the Almighty sends you and be alert. It could save you from so much trouble.

Gossip is verbal poison. It aims to defame & discredit. It’s hurtful & dangerous. It’s the quickest way to destroy trust. Don’t take it lightly. You may think it’s harmless but you’re actually ruining someone’s reputation. You’ll pay a high price! The Almighty will see to it!

People who have the most time on their hands are the ones most likely to plot & plan to bring others down. They have all the time to discuss the lives of others & spread rumours. If you busy yourself with your own life & helping others, you won’t have time for anything else.

The Almighty loves those who ask Him. You’re better off complaining to Him than to humans. He will never betray you, He will never let you down, He will never look down on you. He is the only one who can answer your needs. Stop depending on humans unless you want to be let down!

Almighty. We ask You to grant us peace of mind and calm our troubled hearts. We can’t seem to find the balance we need in our lives so we stumble and worry constantly. Give us the strength and clarity of mind to walk the straight path You’ve laid out for us. Keep Satan at bay!

We all sin. We all make mistakes. We've all fallen short. The biggest mistake we could make is to lose hope & dwell on our sins. That’s exactly what Satan wants us to do. Be quick to repent & get back on track. Don’t stay down. Never lose hope in the Almighty’s Mercy. It’s a sin.

Your time with the Almighty is non-negotiable. Don’t try and cut corners with Him. He deserves your all and more as your Creator. Don’t make excuses and think you can take advantage of His ever merciful attribute. He knows what’s in your heart. He knows your intent!

Take failure in your stride. We all fail. Even champions do. Every failure is preparing you for what’s to come. Bigger. Better. Don’t be afraid to fail. You’ll learn more through failure than everything else. It will strengthen you. It will empower you. It will make you grow.

Don’t be ashamed of the scars you get in life. They are proof of your inner strength. It shows you've lived your life fully; how you picked yourself up when you fell, how you handled defeat, darkness & storms. Remember, the journey is important. But what matters is the end.

Don’t wait for the apology from the one who has wronged you. It may never come. Protect yourself and let go of the hurt. Get the closure your heart needs. Remember, every trial will change you. If you use it to get closer to the Almighty, you’ll end up a stronger, better person.

Constantly remind yourself how short and fragile this life is. Take nothing and no one for granted. Appreciate everything, do your best under any given situation. Don’t give up and keep going. Most importantly, keep peace in your soul!

They'll pick on you. They'll judge you. They'll think the worst of you. They'll hate on you. They'll spread rumour about you. They'll abuse you. They'll wish you didn't exist! Yet through all of that, the Almighty will make you rise & shine above them all. So keep smiling!

They'll pick on you. They'll judge you. They'll think the worst of you. They'll hate on you. They'll spread rumour about you. They'll abuse you. They'll wish you didn't exist! Yet through all of that, the Almighty will make you to rise & shine above them all. So keep smiling!

There are many who are sad and disillusioned because they fail to appreciate what the Almighty has bestowed on them. They scoff at His Blessings because they are too busy admiring the fake life portrayed by some on social media. Show gratitude before it’s taken away from you!

Life will never be easy. The Almighty has promised that He will test us. Again & again. So pray for strength & resilience to withstand what lies ahead. Pray that He grants us patience, wisdom & understanding to go through whatever challenges & tribulations that come our way.

Talk is easy. Talk is cheap. But the real test is whether we put our words into action. Think of the consequences of what we’re saying and whether it’s beneficial. Remember that our words have power and what we say can affect people around us. So choose your words wisely!

Humbling yourself is not easy, especially when everything around you tells you to make it about “me, me, me!” Stepping away from your pride, however, is a necessary step to living a life that’s meaningful. Help others, listen more. Make it about the other person for a change!

Wasting time is worse than wasting money. Some will have more money than others. But we all have twenty four hours in a day. It’s not possible to buy more time! Remember, money can be earned. It comes back to you. But a wasted minute is gone forever! So use your time wisely!

Pain and fear. We’ve all experienced them without exception. How we approach it will determine how we live our lives. Do you allow it to paralyze you such that moving forward becomes a chore? Don’t let your pain and fear define you. Use them to spur you to greater heights.
Are Mufti Menk's tweets too long?

It's always easy to make things more problematic and negative than they really are. The next time you catch yourself making a mountain out of a molehill, ask yourself how much of it will matter in five years. Or, even next month. Change your mindset so you don’t overthink!

Pay attention to what you’re focusing on most of the time. Listen to what you’re saying. How much time do you devote to petty, mindless & negative things? There’s only so much you can take on in a day. Be selective. Focus on the positives, on things that matter in the long run.

Maturity is when you stop complaining, making excuses & blaming others for what’s going on in your life. It’s easy to look for scapegoats. But a mature person realizes that whatever happens is a result of choices made. For change to occur, you need to make new choices!

When you don’t understand the Almighty’s Plan, you’re more likely to lose hope & feel despondent. You think you’re doing everything wrong & you’re unsure about what lies ahead. But don’t give up. Keep asking Him. He’s All-Knowing. He will steer you in the right direction.

If you feel stifled because you have the wrong people in your life right now, don’t despair. The Almighty is All-Knowing . He will move them out of your life and allow the right ones to cross your path. He will guide you to it. It’s a matter of time. You have to trust Him!

This life is a maze. At times, you may feel confronted with so many options. You have to figure out your route. What works for you may not work for someone else.  Chart your own path. Whichever way you go, keep moving, even if you seem stuck. There’s always a way out. Trust Him!

Don’t be a prisoner of your past. That part of your life’s over. The mistakes you made, the bad decisions, the unwise choices; they’re all part of life. Don’t dwell on it. They don’t define your future. Your future is a clean slate. Start writing on it! Be sure to write well.

Time is precious. But equally precious is who you spend it with. If you’re with the wrong company, wasting time without any regard for the minutes ticking by, you’ll regret it one day. Always be conscious of time & how you use it because once it’s gone, it’s gone forever.

Almighty. Help us think of death often. Remind us constantly that our lives can end in a heartbeat. Young or old, when it’s time to go, we go. Help us think of the day when we’ll be meeting You. Let us be prepared & not waste time in this temporary world.

Today we face trials from every direction. It’s easy to feel sad & hopeless. But if your heart has sound trust in the Almighty, you won't despair; & if you're sad, be comforted knowing that nothing lasts. Be patient. Ask Him to lighten your load. Trust Him. He knows what's best!

The Almighty knows your soul is tired. He knows you find it hard to accept what’s going on. He knows you’ve been asking Him & praying hard. He knows you’re confused & in need of comfort. But He also knows what’s best for you. He will always steer you in that direction. Trust Him.

No matter what situation you find yourself in, do not allow people's words, opinions and judgment to affect how you view yourself. By allowing it, you’re practically giving them full control over you. That is an unwise move. Learn to guard your own responses and actions!

We are no strangers to storms in our lives. Some big, some small. But no matter what happens, if you’re connected to the Almighty, He will prove to be the only anchor you need during any storm. Make Him the centre of focus. Rest assured you will be in His care always.

There’ll be good days and bad days. Sad days and happy days. There are some days where you’ll feel like you can achieve so much while other days make you feel completely useless. But there is never a day where you doubt that the Almighty wants only good for us! Trust Him!

The Almighty rewards His servants in a manner similar to the deeds that they perform. If you’re helping someone, He will help you in return. He promises to be our Helper if we help one another. Who could be a better helper than The Lord of the Worlds? He’s all we need in the end!

Almighty. Grant victory to the oppressed wherever they are. Those who have been driven out of their homes or wronged in any way. Grant ease to those who are struggling. Strengthen the weak & downtrodden. You know best who they are & where they are! Every one of them. Aameen.

Take ownership of your life. Be accountable for everything that happens. Everything. Not just the good things. Remember, when things are going well, it’s easy. It’s all good and smooth sailing. The real test is when you’re facing trials. How you respond then, shows the real you!

Those who are jealous of you will always tell you don’t bother doing certain things because you aren’t good enough. Ignore them. The Almighty has fully equipped you and empowered you to overcome whatever needs to be done. Don’t let such comments set you back. Keep moving forward.

Don’t be frustrated by people’s criticisms and comments. If they’re constructive, you can learn from them. Otherwise, treat them as just noise. Don’t let it affect you and the good work that you do. Remember, your job is to please the Almighty. Don’t give others any attention!

If your life is not heading in the direction that you want, it’s time to change your outlook towards things. Perspective is important. Instead of looking at everyone else as the problem, look inside yourself. Identify your shortcomings and start working on them constructively.

Many people love to complain. Nothing is good enough for them. They’re never short of topics or issues to nitpick. There’s always something wrong or not good enough. They often have a poor mindset & are filled with negativity. Don’t allow them to distract you from your focus.

Don’t be consumed by materialism. The trouble is you’ll never have enough. As a result, you can be easily controlled by those who are wealthy and have a lot to offer. Stop comparing yourself with others. Learn to be content and remember, material things will NOT make you happy.

Remember there’s no problem that cannot be solved or resolved. Life throws us curveballs on occasions and more often than not, what we worry about is not even important in the long term. Always seek guidance and strength from the One who has the answer to all our problems!

Don’t curse a bad experience or tragedy that happened in your life. Remember, everything is designed by the Almighty so you can learn life lessons and move forward readily. The best thing you can do is to embrace it and put it to good use. He only wants the best for you!

Remember, those who are hurting are at times the ones who hurt others as a result of their own pain. They struggle to cope with their hurt & end up inflicting their anger or resentment towards others. So don’t retaliate. Stay calm & help them if you can or stay away from them.

You’re disappointed not because of other people’s behavior but because of your own expectations. It’s a fact that people will let you down. Again & again. They’ll show you their true colours eventually. Learn to expect only from the One who made you. The Almighty always delivers!

Almighty. Help us to let go of the harmful things we don’t understand, people who take advantage of us & disappoint us & those with evil intent towards us. Help us to unload the weary weight off our shoulders & embrace the good You have put in our path. Aameen.

Everything that’s going on in your life is exactly as the Almighty had planned it. Your job is to trust the journey. You may not understand it. But let no one talk you out of it or discourage you. You don’t need a cheering squad to achieve your goals. Seek your strength from Him.

With the Almighty, the impossible is possible. So keep supplicating because He will make sure that when the doors open, you’re certainly prepared to go through it. He knows when you’re ready; He will give it at the precise time. So don’t fret. Just keep asking!

When you’re being tested, it’s important to keep your focus in the right direction. If you let Satan mess with your mind, you’re going to lose the plot and end up miserable. Remember, where you choose to focus is where your life will head. Keep the Almighty in sight always!

When you live with an attitude of gratitude, you’re protecting yourself from evil and all forms of negativity. You don’t feel discouraged because you have a grateful heart. Keep nurturing that feeling. Seek the Almighty always & you’ll overcome the hardships in your life!

Don’t let this world make you bitter, hard & cold-hearted. No matter how bad things are, don’t let whatever happens to you make you unkind & unfeeling. It’s not okay to hurt or be mean to others. No matter how they treat you, choose to be the better person. Rise above it all!

We need to stop blaming others for the things that happen in our lives. Learn to take ownership of our problem, assess our strength & weakness. Don’t focus solely on the wrongs as it can become demoralizing. But we need to recognize our faults. Correct them & get back on track.

No matter what others say about you, no matter how hard they try to twist the truth, take heart knowing that the Almighty knows what’s in your heart. He knows your intent. He knows what the outcome will be. So don’t fret. Let people have their say. In the end, only He matters!

It’s in the nature of man to let others down. Don’t be upset when someone disappoints you, fails you & shows you who they truly are. It’s to be expected. It happens to the best of us. It’s not within your control. Take it in your stride; move on, knowing you’ve done your best.

Tomorrow is perhaps the most overrated word. Everyone wants to do something tomorrow; start praying tomorrow; change for the better tomorrow; get that piece of work done tomorrow. But you know what? Most of the time, it doesn’t happen! What if tomorrow never comes? Do it today!

Every pain has a purpose. Every fall has a reason. Else the Almighty wouldn’t have allowed it to happen. Remember, life is a process. Each part of it is necessary to reach your next milestone. Short cuts won’t work. So embrace whatever He has planned and you’ll rise again!

At some stage, you will feel  drained and overwhelmed by what’s going on around you. It can consume you and affect you negatively if you don’t do anything about it. Turn to the Almighty for strength and the will to carry on. Keep asking Him and He will see you through.

It’s easy to judge others. It only takes seconds to form your opinion. But it takes a lifetime to understand them and build them up. It’s easy to put people down when you’ve not walked in their shoes. Be kind. Be just. Be compassionate. Always empathise.

Don't be afraid of doing something because you're scared of what people are going to say about you. People will judge you no matter what. That’s just the way life is. Keep doing your thing and ignore the voices of dissent. You only have to please the Almighty and no one else.

When you ask the Almighty for something, never ever think for a moment that He cannot give it to you. Have firm faith in Him that He will do what’s best. He can turn your most hopeless, impossible situations to reality. All you need is a sincere call and utmost patience!

We have become experts in diagnosing other people’s problems. We know everything about everyone, mainly because of social media. But we tend to pay little or no attention to ourselves. If we’d only focus on improving ourselves a bit more, the world would be a much better place!

Some think money is everything. It’s not. Your connection with the One who made you is more important than all the wealth in the world. Your wealth, status & power should never make you feel arrogant. Remember, like a bolt from the blue, the Almighty can reclaim everything!

Don’t dislike people just because you’ve heard something bad about them. Always give them the benefit of the doubt. Would you like others to do that to you? Surely you don’t want to be condemned by those you’ve not even met? Be fair. The Almighty loves those who are fair-minded

Don’t waste the good that you do. Ensure that they are solely for the sake of the Almighty. Because if you do them with ulterior motives, they’re wasted; they won’t last; the reward is only gained in this world & does not extend to the next life. So keep purifying your intent!

If I don't respond to a crisis the way YOU want me to respond, it doesn't mean I'm not concerned. Perhaps I've responded in another more effective way. Learn to appreciate the diversity in our approach to issues. We do care & we are concerned. May peace & sanity prevail! Aameen

Blessed is he who's not attached to the worldly life, doesn't care much about people praising him & never worries about the criticisms of others. He takes everything in his stride & succumbs fully to the Decree of the Almighty. His heart’s content because he knows nothing lasts.

When you feel like you can't keep going, turn your heart to the One who knows about very aspect of your life. Tell Him you can’t carry on. But He can. Only He can turn things around for you. Ask Him to replace what's lost, mend what's broken and make you feel whole again!

Almighty. On this blessed day, keep us safe from hypocrites & those who have bad intention towards us. Surround us with good people; those who spread positivity & constantly remind us of You. Guide us in all that we do; all the way to our ultimate destination, Paradise! Aameen.

Parenting is not an easy task. But no matter what obstacles you face, keep going. Keep leading by example. Keep being a role model for your children. The good we teach our children stays with them & will become a part of their daily lives. So plant good seeds in their hearts!

Don't say you’re giving up because you’re tired of waiting. How could you? Have you forgotten the Almighty’s promise? He won’t burden you with that which you have no ability to bear. Trust Him. He’s in full control & watching over you. Keep going; your breakthrough is in sight.

Prayer
Almighty. I ask you to strengthen me so I can face whatever challenges You put in my path & not be overwhelmed by them. I know You see my tears and hear my prayers. I also know that You’re testing me. Grant me the ability to endure & face this with utmost patience. Aameen.

We’re only human & we tend to feel down or upset at times. But don’t allow such feelings to interfere with how you communicate with others. It’s easy to lash out & vent your anger but learn to control yourself. It’s one of the hardest things to do. But the rewards are great!

Understand that disappointment is not a bad thing. When something we dislike happens, we think it’s a mistake. We get upset. We forget that the Almighty is in control. He sees things we don’t. The bigger picture will emerge soon and we will thank Him for His Infinite Wisdom!

When you have attained that special connection with the Almighty, nothing can disturb your peace. You fully submit to His Decree. He will hide your faults like clothing hides the blemishes on your skin. He will beautify you and only show your good side and endear you to others!

The problem with most is they engage in prayer only because they want the Almighty to do something for them. That’s wrong! Prayer is about connecting and communicating with Him. Once you’ve achieved this, His help and blessings will follow undoubtedly.  So establish that link!

Some people find it so hard to apologize when they’ve done wrong. It’s to do with their pride. You can never get them to say  sorry, no matter how obvious their mistake is. Beware such pride; for even the size of a mustard seed will not let you smell Paradise.
#EidMubarak from rural #Zimbabwe https://t.co/nd2f5YRM3t

Wishing you a Blessed Eid-ul Adha. Eid of the Sacrifice of Prophet Abraham pbuh. Spare a thought for the less fortunate as you celebrate with loved ones.!
#EidMubarak #BarkaDaSallah #SelamatHariRayaHaji

Be careful not to provoke people beyond their limits; like the one who doesn’t retaliate when you wrong him. Instead, he raises his hands to the heavens & seeks help from the Almighty; the most powerful One. So be mindful not to hurt others. If you do, quickly seek forgiveness.

It’s easy to just look at what others have & start comparing it with everything that’s wrong in your life. Don’t! Instead, ask the Almighty for a  fresh start in any area of your life. Let go of the old & that which is bad for your inner peace. Start anew. Feel the heart lighten!

The sacrifice on #EidAlAdha is to show gratitude to the Almighty for His blessings & a means to feed the less fortunate. I wish you all a Blessed Eid-ul Adha. Eid of the Sacrifice of Prophet Abraham pbuh. #EidMubarak #barkadasallah #SelamatHariRayaKorban

Almighty. We belong to You and to You is our return. Shower Your everlasting Mercy on us always, forgive us and guide us towards that which pleases You at all times. Help us to stay clear of that which displeases You. May You accept all our prayers and grant us ease. Aameen.

The Almighty is All-Knowing. He pays attention. He’s aware who is talking about you behind your back, who is trying to bring you down. Why worry? You stand to gain a lot of good deeds on Judgement Day from those who have discredited you. Carry on doing your best in everything!

The Almighty made each & everyone of us special. Don’t apologize for who you are. Work hard to be the best version of yourself. If someone is uncomfortable with you; that’s not your concern but theirs. Don’t change just to please others. We weren't meant to be liked by everyone.
Almighty. As pilgrims gather in #Arafah on this Great Day of #Hajj, we pray that You grant them ease & accept their acts of worship. Aameen.

On this blessed day, may we have the ability to give up something for the sake of the Almighty. Do it sincerely for Him with full submission. It will strengthen our faith. May we achieve the benefits of these ten days & may He accept the sincere efforts of those on #Hajj.

Don’t waste time engaging in sin. You have the chance to start anew every day when the Almighty returns your soul to you after sleep. It’s up to you to decide today how you want to live your life; in His pleasure or displeasure. You have a duty to fulfil. Make it a good one!

Almighty. On this blessed day, forgive us & bless us with your endless Mercy. Enrich us with the goodness of these days of Hajj. Grant us our prayers & forgive our shortcomings. Pardon those who have gone before us. Teach us to always care for one another & protect us from evil.

Trust when you don’t have the answers. Trust when you can’t find the way out. Trust when you don’t know what’s happening. Trust when it defies your logic. Trust when everyone tells you it won’t work. This is what faith is all about. Trust the Almighty. Fully. Without a doubt!

What is this life but a number of days. Remember, with each passing day, a part of us passes away, as we get closer to our final destination. So do good & be the best you can be. That’s how you’ll be remembered.

You can have all the love in this world, but if your heart is devoid of the love of your Maker, you’ll be the poorest person. The truth is you’ll never be at ease. Satan will fill the void with all things fleeting & you’ll end up miserable. Turn to Him for that inner peace.

Almighty. Safeguard those who have gathered for the #Hajj in the Holy Lands. Grant them ease & accept their sacrifice in Your Name. Allow them to return to their loved ones having gained the ultimate reward. Aameen

When we judge by our own standards of appearance, we fail to acknowledge the Almighty’s focus on the state of our hearts. The trouble is today, many think physical appearance is the most important because that is what man sees! Our hearts are tainted. Don’t fall into this trap.

We all know difficult people in our lives. Those who are manipulative & toxic; who will anger & irritate us. Dealing with them can be difficult. Do your best; minimise contact. Often, they’re not people of logic but of emotion, prejudice & pride. Let the Almighty handle them.
Satan always wants to make you feel depressed and defeated. Quit feeling that way. Pick yourself up. Turn to the Almighty and walk in His Path.

Your life isn’t just about you. The Almighty created you for a purpose. Use whatever He has blessed you with to impact the world & those around you. Don’t be selfish. Help as much as you can. Spread goodness & kindness. We have a limited time on earth. Use it productively!

Humility is everything. 
No matter how successful, how good looking, how rich or how smart you are remember, nobody likes arrogance. Stay connected to people. Stay real. That’s the hallmark of true success!

When you want to give advice, do so in such a way that people would want to listen to you. Don’t be mean and hurtful. Don’t use harsh words. Don’t put people down. Be genuine and nurturing in wanting to correct them, mend their ways and help them get back on track.

There are people who won’t hesitate to provoke you, trying their best to bring out the worst in you. When they’ve achieved that, they’ll play the victim and make you feel bad. Be mindful of such people. They really need help. Try your best to remain calm. Keep your composure!

Heartaches & pain are real. Don’t take them lightly. Unfortunately most would seek other people in trying to find comfort. The truth is the only One who can heal you is the Almighty. Ask for strength, comfort, healing, & perseverance. He will show you all that & more. Trust Him

No matter how negative you may feel, always try and communicate in as positive a manner as possible. If you choose words that are negative, that’s the impression you will leave with the person on the receiving end. So don’t respond when you’re angry or when others annoy you!
1988 #muftimenk #oldpassportphoto https://t.co/p1RGv79Xt7

Your mind can be your worst enemy. Train it well. Don’t dwell on negativity. Don’t let Satan take control and corrupt it. Always ask the Almighty to help you submit to His Decree. When you’re able to achieve that, you’ll reach a state of calmness and serenity! You’re content!
Don't let your pain make you unkind. Nobody knows what the other person is going through. There is too much suffering in the world already.

Choose your friends wisely. It’s always easier to pull people down than to build them up. Make sure your circle of friends will do just that; moving you in the right direction. They should be building you up rather than tearing you down. If you have such friends, treasure them!

Keep asking the Almighty to redirect our thoughts so that we focus on those things that are good and pure, honorable and righteous, excellent and worthy of praise. Banish thoughts that cloud your judgement, cause doubt and make you think ill of others! They’re the work of Satan.

Take advantage of these blessed days. Keep asking the Almighty for anything & everything. He loves it when you ask. Ask for forgiveness for all your sins. Thank Him for all the Blessings & Bounties. Ask with humility & humbleness. Never demand. May He grant us what we ask for.

You can attain true peace when you finally realize that everything happens for a reason; by the will of the Almighty. He is the One in total control. You can bear any hardship with patience if you learn to trust Him. Don’t be sad or weakened by it. Relax, He’s got your back!

Almighty. On this blessed day, we pray for ease & comfort. The world seems to be spinning out of control. There’s chaos everywhere; even in our own lives.There are days when we feel like giving up. Yet we know that’s not an option. You’re the only One who has all the answers!

Take charge of your life. Focus on the positives & don’t dwell on the negatives. Satan will steer you towards worldly matters, cloud your mind & take you away from the Almighty. Stay firmly rooted to your faith. Stay vigilant. Embrace your own strength & know your self-worth.

If you’re feeling that life is unfair & people are treating you badly, remember, the Almighty knows the truth. Let people think what they will; you can’t control them. But the Lord of the Worlds is always in full control. Do your best & let Him fight the rest of your battles!

We’ve all had those days when we don’t want to get out of bed & face the world. That’s when you need to trust the Almighty even more. Build a strong bond with Him. An unshakeable faith that applies to all aspects of your life. It will see you through in this life & the Hereafter!

We’re careful what we put into our mouths, choosing our foods meticulously so that they keep our bodies functioning well. The same should apply to what comes out of our mouths. If we choose to spew hateful, curse & swear words, imagine how that would impact the ones affected.

Worrying about what happened yesterday won’t change anything. Learn from it. Move on. Worrying about tomorrow is also futile because we don’t know what it holds. Take it one step at a time, one day at a time. Trust His Plans & don’t let worry rob you of life’s precious moments!

Congratulations to my brother Dr Isa Ali Pantami @DrIsaPantami upon being confirmed as Minister of the Federal Republic of Nigeria. May the Almighty guide you to the best and most productive decisions always. Aameen #MaashaaAllah #Tabarakallah #Nigeria #Pantami

Jealousy is toxic to the soul. It can ruin you from the inside out. You can remove it by loving yourself & who you are. You need to accept, be grateful & be satisfied with what the Almighty has chosen for you. He has given you so much.  Don’t look at the blessings of others!

Being happy & being content are two different things. Happiness is fleeting, it comes & goes, comes mainly form the outside. Contentment comes from a deeper place. You’re at peace with what the Almighty has bestowed on you, no matter what your circumstances. You trust Him fully!

You become what you constantly think about. If you think you can’t, you probably won’t make it. If you think you’re a failure, you’ll end up not doing anything significant in life. If you think negative thoughts always, you’ll end up with negative results. Guard your thoughts!

As humans, we tend to compare. Don’t think of others who seem to  have a better life. The trouble is we see perfect images everywhere today. We wonder why we don’t have the same. Don’t fall into that trap. Thank the Almighty for all that you’ve been blessed with.

Your time is the most valuable gift you can give to your family.  Money comes & goes but the memories will stay far beyond all that. The strong bond you develop will last a long while. Start giving the gift of time before it’s too late. Don’t put it off because life’s too short!

"Respect Life! It was given by He who gave you your own life!"

I'm truly saddened by the senseless killings across the globe almost every day. The latest being in #Nigeria where mourners were gunned down this evening. Absolutely unacceptable. Almighty! Grant us peace & sanity.

Always ask the Almighty to soften our hearts. May we have compassion for those who suffer in unimaginable ways. Learn to pray passionately for them as we do for ourselves & our loved ones. And above all, may our souls remain humble at all times!

Don’t feel that you have to tell everyone what you’ve been up to in your life. You don’t! Nobody needs to know everything. Don’t announce it on social media too because having people with eyes that constantly pry into your private life is not healthy. It attracts envy & hatred.

Why are you being tested again  & again; one hardship after another while others have it so easy? Until you’re broken, you don't truly know your inner strength. Embrace what happens & use it to build yourself all over again, but this time, stronger than ever! The Almighty knows!

Misunderstanding often leads to grudges. When we hold a grudge, we give someone power over our emotions. Without forgiveness, it’s easy to let things get out of hand. When we forgive, our doors and avenues to goodness open up. It puts our relationship with Him back on track!

Learn to quieten the negative voices in your head. If you start entertaining them, they willl get louder & demand more attention. It’s all part of Satan’s plan to get you down in the dumps. Don’t give in. Put up a barrier of positivity around you & see how your life shapes up.

Be wary of toxic people around you. Those who come in to lower your self-esteem. Those who come into your life & leave you worse off than you were before. They will hinder your growth & cause you misery. Learn to spot them. Don’t get involved with them. Say a prayer for them.

Almighty. On this blessed day, grant us peace of mind and relieve the anxiety and stress we experience in our daily lives. Give us clarity of mind to do what’s best. Guide us through this path of life which is often paved with many obstacles. Let peace reign in our hearts!

The trouble with us is we hate waiting. We want everything to happen on our terms. We think of waiting as negative; we get impatient when nothing is happening. Remember, the Almighty is watching how we behave while waiting. How we get to the destination is just as important.

Everything happens for a reason. You’ve got to believe that. You’ve got to trust the Almighty’s plan for you even if you don’t understand it. Whatever’s going on in your life, the journey continues. Nothing comes to a standstill. Have faith that it will all work out in the end!

There will always be critics. Some will be constructive while others just want to tear you down. Don’t waste your time trying to convince the wrong people; just keep running your race and do what you do best. Focus on the positives and don’t feel the need to engage them!

Don’t curse the hardship you’re facing. Every trial has a silver lining; a blessing in disguise. Learn to bear good patience. Let the situation unfold. Do your best and let the Almighty do the rest. You’ll emerge stronger and better prepared to face whatever He sends your way.

Know when to get involved and when to lay off. Some things just aren’t worth your energy. There’s too much going on around us and it’s easy to get sucked into other people’s drama. Learn to take a step back & look at things in perspective. Don’t be too quick to take the plunge.

Being betrayed is hard to live with. The sorrow of betrayal doesn't come all at once but in stages, as you begin to realise the extent. Once trust is violated, old emotions & pain are always at the back of your mind. So don’t betray trust for it’ll be hard to restore what’s lost!

Be careful what you say to others because you may not get a chance to take back your words. You may say things you don’t mean at the height of anger & live to regret it. It is so easy to get worked up on a daily basis. Don’t. It’s not worth it!

There’s a purpose for the pain you’ve endured; the tears, the lonely nights. They brought you back to the One who made you. The One who showed you the path of light & lightened the heaviness in your heart, who made you get rid of your ego & turn to Him for help. Trust Him always!

Learn to listen with your heart. Before long you’ll be able to understand the Almighty’s Plan for you. Focus on the positive, the good that’s happening, the blessings He’s bestowed on you & soon you’ll be living a life of gratitude & praise. It will change your outlook forever!

Don’t let success go to your head. Be the first to apologize for your mistakes. You’ll never learn anything or impress anyone by making excuses &  shifting the blame. Treat everyone with dignity & respect. You may be successful, but that doesn’t make you better than anyone else!

Admit your mistakes. It’s a good trait to have and it gains respect from the ones around you because it shows both humility and your willingness to learn. Remember, it’s easy to claim responsibility when things go well, but it’s hard when they don’t. Don’t look for scapegoats!

Don’t think that you can make yourself happy by bringing misery to other people. You can’t. It doesn’t work that way. The Almighty is fully aware and knows what’s going on. If you want happiness, make others happy and you’ll feel the ripple effect of that happiness as well!

Be extremely careful when making assumptions about others. When you lack complete information, you have to fill in the blanks yourself; based on what you may have heard from others. You connect the dots and as a result you’re most likely to jump to the wrong conclusion!

Don’t hate yourself for the mistakes you make in life. They are turning points. They are important lessons you need to learn. Remember, none of it is random. The Almighty designs them for a reason. They are meant to make you a better person. Correct yourself and move on!

Almighty. On this blessed day, accept the deeds that we do solely for Your Sake. We are trying our best. We’re not perfect and often we falter, we sin, we make mistakes. Forgive us. We will never lose hope in Your Mercy and will always keep our hearts attached to You! Aameen!

Believe that the Almighty will protect you at all costs. As long as you have Him in your life, you’ll achieve success. If it’s good for you, He’ll make sure that you succeed. If it’s bad for you, He will take it away from you,whether you like it or not. His job is to protect you.

Laziness & putting things off are all part of the Devil’s plan. If you keep procrastinating, before you know it, years have gone by. But what’s worse is you may not live to do it as no one is promised tomorrow. You’ll never know when all this will end. Don’t delay. Act on it now!

In this day and age, it’s becoming increasingly difficult to see what’s wrong and what’s right. The lines are getting blurred. What’s right is being made to look wrong and the reverse is true. Be mindful. Don’t fall into this trap. Hold on to what the Almighty has prescribed.

We need to realize that our  constant need to complain has a simple and fundamental reason: we lack of a sense of contentment. The truth is we are often dissatisfied & it has taken the place of contentment in our hearts. So everything that we say is a reflection of how we feel!

Some people get threatened when others shine their light on the rest of the world. They think if you shine bright, it somehow dims theirs & gives them less opportunity to find their own success. Remember, the Almighty has given us all a chance to be successful. Everyone of us.

Life is fragile. Today you’re here, tomorrow you’re gone. So don’t stress too much about your worldly affairs. Take it in your stride. You’ll be spending forever in the Hereafter. Build your resources (deeds) to secure a better life. Satan will distract you, so remain vigilant!

We are all scarred in one way or another. The scars you get in life are proof of your inner strength. It shows how you lived your life! They are there to strengthen you; to remind you that these are among the Almighty’s biggest tests & how you survived with beautiful patience!

Don’t allow family members to trample over your wife. Remember, she gave up everything to be with you. She’s not an unpaid housekeeper to be used at their whim and fancy. Be fearful of her supplication to the Almighty. He’s watching and will surely come to her rescue eventually!

Don’t worry when things don’t work out. If you’ve tried your best & it doesn’t work then let it go. Free yourself from worries & pain by relying only on the Almighty. Just be patient, your time is yet to come. The Almighty knows your struggles. He hears your prayers!

The Almighty has made us all unique, with different atttibutes and talents. But always be humble enough to know that you’re no better than the person next to you. He has a plan for each and everyone of us. Use your talent wisely. Spread goodness and kindness wherever you go!

It’s natural to be disappointed when people let you down. It’s the Almighty’s way of showing you their true colours in your hour of need; to show you who they really are. It’s a reminder to depend only on Him. If you do otherwise, be prepared for disappointment.

Don’t engage friends who speak ill of their spouses to you. No matter how close you are to them, learn to keep friendship separate from their personal life. You have to draw the line. The erring spouses could have repented & changed their ways & you’re still bad mouthing them.

First World Cup win by #SuperOver

Well done #England

#ItCameHome  looool

#CWC19Final #CricketWorldCup2019 #CWC19 #ENGvNZ

Sometimes change means starting over. Don’t be afraid to do that. At times, you need to overhaul your life to see your steps ahead. So whatever you’re experiencing, don’t be afraid to start over. This time, you’re not starting from scratch but you’re starting from experience!

Do you sometimes feel like things have become too difficult and there’s nothing good left for your future. That is what Satan wants you to believe, like there’s no way out. He wants us to believe that we’re all alone but we’re NOT! The Almighty says never lose hope in His Mercy.

Be wary of arrogance. It comes in many shades & forms. There are some who feel they’re all powerful. They attribute their achievements to their own efforts solely. They neglect the Almighty in the whole equation. It’s all about them. Darkness & disbelief will cover their hearts

This world is such that there’ll be people who love you and those who will hate you. Remember, you’re not for everyone and that’s ok. You’re not in this world to win a popularity poll. So don’t waste your time with such people. Share your journey with those who value you.

What have we become today? We hardly speak to people anymore. Even phone calls are being replaced by WhatsApp. We hide our feelings and turn them into tweets and blogposts. Our memories are merely a collection of photos on Instagram. Let us strive not to lose the human touch!

Almighty. On this blessed day, we ask You to protect our families & loved ones for we often take them for granted. Help us realise how fortunate we are to have a family unit who is a source of support, love & encouragement. It’s a blessing often overlooked. Keep them safe always.

Don't worry about the pain. It will heal. Just remember the lesson learnt. You will get over it but you won't forget. That's the beauty of time & patience. The lessons become valuable life experience which the Almighty wants us to embrace. He will try us again & again till we do!

It hurts badly now and you’re on the verge of giving up. You’re wondering if the Almighty is aware of what you’re going through. Never doubt that He’s All-Knowing, All-Seeing. Remember, you might be going through a lot of pain but it doesn’t mean the result won’t be beautiful!

Some people won’t hesitate to use you to serve their purpose. Whatever you do, don’t get involved in their drama if they try to make you take sides. There’s always two sides to a story. Be fair, stay positive & don’t pit one against the other. Let them resolve their differences!

Confide in the Almighty always. When you shed tears in front of others, you have to explain yourself. When you cry your heart out to Him, you don’t need to say a word. He knows what’s in your heart even before your lips utter them. No one can love you or understand you better!

Social media has given a voice to the voiceless. Our videos, posts & comments online are a reflection of who we are & what we stand for. Unfortunately, people with ill intent use them to spew hate & spread ignorance. Don't let their comments affect you. Such people need help!

No one can teach you better than the life lessons the Almighty sends your way. Experience is one of the best teachers. So embrace the pain, the endurance & all that comes with the lesson. You’re never too old to learn & it’s never too late. Seek His help & guidance always.

Beware the negativity that keeps popping up in your mind. At times, this is related to a setback you’ve had. You need to counter it & don’t worry what people may think. They’ll talk anyway. You can’t stop them. What you can do is to focus on the positive & goodness around you!

Taking your own life is NOT an option! When you feel like you can’t do it anymore, remember, to prolong your prayer and confide in Him. Make the Almighty your Friend; such that even if you lose the connections of this world, it doesn’t matter. Your connection with Him is intact.

No one said life was easy. The twists and turns, the roadblocks; they’re all part of the journey. When you don’t understand what’s going on in your life, just take a deep breath and say a prayer. Almighty, this is Your Plan. Your Wisdom and Guidance will see me through it.

The reason many people are on social media is because they want attention. It’s measured by the number of likes, views, retweets, comments etc. Remember, you don't have to rely on others for your confidence and self-esteem. Disengage from seeking attention. Love yourself first!

When life gets hard it’s easy to think of the worst & stop dreaming of good things because it feels like they are unachievable. You’ll get days when you want to quit. But firm faith & the belief that after hardship, there’ll be ease, should see you through your journey!

You want to move forward but you keep thinking about your sins & feel hopeless. Don’t! It’s easier said than done. It’s Satan’s handiwork, messing up your mind. You deserve His Mercy. Never lose hope. The Almighty will forgive as long as you’re turning to Him! Seek Him sincerely!

More are suffering from diseases of the heart because of social media. Jealousy, unhappiness, feelings of inadequacy take root when the difference between real or fake vanishes. Sadly, a lot of what we see is fake. Don’t fall for it. Flaws & imperfections make us human!

We shouldn’t be defined by others' viewpoint of us, but rather by our actions and our own words. The words we choose to describe people can have a huge impact on them. We never know what each one is experiencing. Let people live their own lives. Let us not judge and label.

The truth is many of us spend a lot of time inside our own mind, overthinking, worrying about what’s to come, regretting past events & generally complaining about life. These cause stress & sap your energy. Train your mind to think positive. You’ll lead a more content life!

Be the one who earns the love of the Almighty and eventually His Paradise by controlling your anger. Don’t let it control you. It’s one of the most noble acts to do. Instead of responding in rapid-fire manner, stay calm and collected, knowing that He is watching your reaction!

Almighty. On this blessed day, may You shine Your light on us during our darkest hours and relieve our fears & anxieties. Guide us in our journey to healing & recovery. Grant us patience and wisdom that we so badly need. Remind us constantly that we never have to walk alone!

On your darkest days, remind yourself how far you’ve come already. You have a lot to be thankful for and every reason to not stop but keep moving forward. Keep telling yourself you can do this because the Lord of the Worlds can make things happen anytime! Your turn will come.

I have a confession to make to my 4,48 million followers on twitter. We owe this brother a like, a retweet & a comment. He is the one who introduced me to @twitter in 2011 & told me it will grow beyond FB. He was 100% correct! @Cader_ARC Thanks for your advice! Abundant Reward! https://t.co/hcNTXFSwRm

@EY_Africa I have a confession to make to my 4,48 million followers on twitter. We owe this brother a like, a retweet & a comment. He is the one who introduced me to @twitter in 2011 & told me it will grow beyond FB. He was 100% correct! @Cader_ARC Thanks for your advice! Abundant Reward!

There’s purpose in your pain. Never doubt that. Think of all the lessons the Almighty has put forth from your pain. No matter how badly it hurts now, one day you’ll look back and realize that it changed your life for the better. So endure and you’ll emerge the better for it!

Don’t let doubt & whisperings of Satan take centrestage in your mind. Shake off whatever is trying to hold you back from all that the Almighty has decreed for you. Don’t entertain such thoughts. You’re a person of courage. Go forth & accomplish what you need to. He’s with you.

Love, trust and mutual respect are the bedrock of a solid marriage. It doesn’t come easy. It’s hard work & has to be nurtured daily. Don’t let mistrust creep into the equation. Don’t give your spouse reason to mistrust you. Once trust is broken, it will not be the same again.

Through the toughest times, ponder over & appreciate the countless favours of the Almighty upon us. We mostly don't realise the true value of things or people until we lose them. Don't be sad simply because a few things are not going your way. Focus on the positives & thank Him.

Why can’t we be happy for others when they achieve something? As in truly happy; no snide remarks or sarcastic comments. It all stems from the heart. The positive energy you exude towards others will come back to you. So the next time, you hear such news, celebrate, don’t hate!

Don’t worry about what people might say. You can’t stop them from talking, that’s the reality. What others think won’t stop the Almighty from doing what He needs to in your life. So don’t ever let the opinions of others hold you back! He has given you the capabilities. Use them!

You may have fulfilled the rights of your spouse but it doesn’t give you the green light to treat him or her badly. Be worried of the supplication of the spouse you have mistreated. The Almighty is All-Seeing. He can turn the tide against you. Be mindful of your actions!

No matter what life dishes out, stand up, dust yourself & keep going. Easier said than done? The truth is you’ve no other choice. Of course you can stay down & let it get worse. Satan will mess with your mind so much that you think you’re doomed! Never lose hope in His Mercy!

The company you keep says a lot about you. Friends have a big influence over how you feel, think & behave. Beware the ones who will mould you to become like them. Some will control you till you mimic their behaviour. If you’re weak-willed, chances are you’ll succumb & cave in!

If your intent is wrong, your deeds done for the sake of humankind will come to nought. Check your intentions often. Because you don’t want to fall into the trap; you think you’re doing a lot but when you arrive on Judgement Day, you’re a bankrupt! That would be devastating!

We live in such an impatient world. Everything has to be quick, instantaneous, fast, in a hurry, this very minute! Sadly, we also expect the same from the Almighty when we ask Him to fulfil our wishes. We forget that He has His own timing. So wait patiently! That’s the test!

Beware the uncontrolled ego; it will self-obsess you until you can’t stop thinking about yourself! You’re preoccupied with your own life & circumstances; sparing little or no thought about others.  It can be destructive & the consequences are normally dire. Drop the ego!

Keep negativity out of your life at all costs. Don’t focus on the negatives, not just today but every day because it will only eat at your soul, slowly but surely. You’ll become a thankless person, always nitpicking over tiny details. Keep reminding yourself of the blessings!

It is easy to get distracted by dissenting voices and naysayers. Even if it’s one. But don’t let it affect you. Don’t let it influence you. Think of the majority who appreciate what you do. That should keep you going. Besides, your reward is with the Almighty. Not humankind.

We live in angry times. All the sharing on social media makes it worse. Learn to control your innermost urge to retaliate. You don’t have to give as good as you got! If you don't slow down when you start to see red, you can do significant damage to your life. Keep the peace!

Almighty. On this blessed day, save us from trials and heal the wounds we have collected and kept inside for too long. Grant us success we’ve never even had the audacity to believe possible. Don’t let our achievements get to our heads. Show us a way out of our difficulties.

Learn to stay away from arguments and other people’s drama. They sap your energy and rob your peace of mind. It takes a mature person to not get into an argument. Stay in your lane and watch from the sidelines if you must but don’t get involved. Maintain your calmness.

Nothing is ever taken away except that something equal or better will come your way. So whatever you think is falling apart is actually being rearranged by the Almighty to give you what you ultimately want. Ultimately; not today, not even this week or a month but for a lifetime!

People fail often because they put their trust, hope and confidence in their own ability or in other people. They forget who their Sustainer, Provider and Nourisher is! Put your trust in the Almighty. Seek Him. Depend on Him not on His creation who will often let you down!

Not every battle is worth fighting. Learn to be more discerning. Don’t get involved in other people’s drama. Sometimes it’s better to maintain the peace than to go all out to prove who is right. People might get hurt in the process. Leave it to the Almighty, the fairest Judge.

The Almighty is the Turner of Hearts. He can change things in the blink of an eye. Don’t forget that. He can heal what has been hurting for years in a flash. He can forgive as He wills. Nothing is beyond the Lord of the Worlds. Have faith that things will work out in the end.

When you forgive others for the sake of the Almighty, the rewards that come back to you will be far greater than anything you’ve lost  due to someone having wronged you or hurt you. Remember, your success is with Him, not His creation! Don’t worry about what people think!

Don’t fret if your efforts don’t receive any recognition or publicity. Know that the Almighty is protecting your sincerity and work from corruption. Most importantly, remember, He loves those deeds that are small and consistent. They have the most benefit in the long run.

Publicizing a sin is so much more serious than the sin itself because it carries with it a level of arrogance & promotion of illicit behavior. Instead of remorse over committing the sin, we are more caught up in trying to figure out how to show off what we did to our friends!

There are some who love to create discord among people. They plant seeds of doubt in people’s minds about anyone they dislike. They go out of their way to tarnish people’s image with falsehoods. Be careful. You may think you’ll get away with it. You won’t! The Almighty knows!

Don’t be disheartened if you can’t help much with charity in terms of material stuff. You can always be the one who adds value to the lives of others. Find ways to be a source of encouragement everywhere you go. Spread goodness and kindness always. It will all come back to you.

Who lifted you when you were discouraged? Who found a way out for you when you thought it was a dead end? Who provided for you when you didn’t think you could make it through the day? Remember, the Almighty has brought you this far. He will keep you going! Trust!

When we hear bad about others, we're so quick to believe it. But when we hear good about them, we find it hard to believe. It shouldn't be so for a true believer. Don't believe the bad about others until it’s proven beyond any doubt & if it doesn't concern you, stay out of it.

Beware the hypocrite. He’s always looking for faults or advising you about your life, job, habits, etc. But he never follows his own advice. Some have an agenda & can hurt your self-confidence badly. Don’t give your time to deceitful people, pretending to be what they’re not!

In the eyes of man, a single bad deed can wipe out all the good you've done. But to the Almighty, a single good deed can wipe out all the bad you've done. He’s the Most Forgiving, Most Merciful! Focus on pleasing Him for you can never please others, no matter how hard you try!

At times when you’re facing your toughest battle, you might feel like you don’t belong anywhere. Banish that thought. It’s the work of Satan. You belong to the Almighty. He made you. He won’t abandon you. Remember His Promise. After hardship, comes ease. Be at peace.

Almighty. On this blessed day, we beg You to help everyone who’s going through hardship in life; the broken, the downtrodden, the oppressed. May You remove all harm, change their situation & guide them out of difficulty. May we all be completely dependent on You and You alone!

A good rule to live by; if you stop fueling a fire, it will burn itself out. If you stop fueling an argument with harsh words, it will stop eventually. But if you choose to engage with hurtful words it will get worse. The choice is yours. Learn to keep the peace as best you can.

What goes around comes around. Whatever you give, comes back to you. What you sow, you reap. Give kindness, compassion, joy, encouragement, motivation and it will find its way back to you somehow, someday. Do you get the drift? So why would anyone want to spread negativity?

One of the most precious gifts we have is time. If we only knew how much time we had left in this world, we wouldn’t get distracted and lose focus, wasting our energy and attention on useless, pointless, meaningless things. Wake up before it’s too late!

As much as you want to change a person, be it your loved one, a friend or anyone for that matter, you can’t. Guidance comes from the Almighty. You can advise, show them the way, speak to them repeatedly. Beyond that, keep praying for them and leave the rest to the Almighty.

When you don’t understand the Almighty’s Plan, you’re more likely to lose hope & feel despondent. You think you’re doing everything wrong & you’re unsure about what lies ahead. But don’t give up. Keep asking Him. He’s All-Knowing. He will steer you in the right direction!

If you only knew how fast people forget about those who have passed on, you won’t live to impress others. It’s one of the silliest things to do. Remember, you don’t need someone else’s validation. Live to impress the One who made you. The Almighty will never let you down!

Everything happens for a reason. The Almighty does not miscalculate anything. He knows the circumstances you’re facing. You’ll never be made to face a situation you can’t handle. So no matter what comes against you, with strong faith, it will never be too much for you to bear.

You can’t fool all the people all the time. It won’t work; the truth will eventually out. Fear the Almighty in your dealings with others & if you think you can get away with cheating & abusing people’s trust, you’re wrong. It will come back to haunt you in the least expected way

Life can be overwhelming at times. Undoubtedly, you can feel lost in the journey but the Almighty knows exactly where you are & what lies ahead in the quest to your destination. He knows how to get you to where you need to be. Trust Him & walk in faith, knowing He will guide you!

Drawing inspiration from another person is allowed. But there are dangers of looking to so-called celebrities as role models. Remember, they’re just people. It's easy to forget this when society elevates them to superhuman status. They’re not. They make mistakes like all of us!

Protect your tongue from slander. It’s one of the most hated crimes and the Almighty has promised severe punishment to the slanderer. Engaging in this sinful act will destroy your good deeds and devalue your worship and prayers. It will also exclude you from His protection.

Don’t take your sins lightly. You may think you’ve done nothing wrong but you forgot how you shouted at the housekeeper when you lost your temper;  the other person you pushed aside so you got ahead in the queue. May the Almighty help us to constantly reflect on our shortcomings.

Your faith, like most things in life will fluctuate. Don’t expect it to remain constant. There’ll be ups and downs, highs and lows, good days and bad days. Don’t let that define you. Do things sincerely for the sake of the Almighty and your faith will strengthen by His Mercy.

Almighty. On this blessed day, grant us good patience in hard times. Let us learn to be grateful by recognizing that our trials could be much worse. Let us trust Your Plan and have complete reliance on You. Help us to remain close to You during both good and bad times. Aameen.

Gossip is like something you’re craving for. You say you don’t like it, but when someone tells you a juicy piece of news, you can’t resist it. This is the work of Satan. Be wary when you develop an interest & suddenly want to know what you don’t know about someone else.

Take a long, hard look at yourself in the mirror. See if the person staring back at you is the person you want to be. Do this often as it is a good form of self-reflection. There’s always room for improvement. Focus on trying to be a better person today than you were yesterday.

For many, their darkest days are normally the ones that draw them closest to the Almighty. Their most profound experience of worship will be when they’re on the brink of giving up; when they feel there are no options. Let us change that. Make Him our priority in good & bad times!

Take time out to disconnect from your surroundings occasionally. Enjoy your own company because it’s easy to get overwhelmed by life & all that it offers. Keep your heart connected to the One who made you & you’ll achieve that inner peace & contentment that we all badly need!

When something is not right & you feel yourself drifting away from the Almighty, reflect & analyse your situation. What took you away & distracted you from Him? Remember, when you’ve had a bad harvest, you fix the environment, not the crop. Get to the source of the problem!

Are you among those who when asked for advice, you hardly ever try to understand the person’s unique situation & needs; you give advice based on your own bitterness & cynicism; you live in a constant state of dissatisfaction. If that’s you, it’s time to be more compassionate!

Some people just thrive being in the spotlight. They put on a show for everyone to see. They love being praised; it does wonders to their egos. They’ll create dramas just to be the centre of focus. Minimize your dealings with them if possible. Don’t get drawn into their circle.

People are generally stingy with compliments. Often, the recognition you hope for simply isn’t going to happen. So when people fail to acknowledge what you’ve done, don’t take it to heart. Let your reward be with the Almighty. Work for His applause rather than other people’s!

Do you have friends who are  constantly complaining about other people or judging other people. They will make no effort to hide their discontent and they’ll try to drag you into their pit of despair, except they won’t even realize that they are the source of the discontent!

We can’t control other people’s perceptions of us but what we can do is to gain control over our own thoughts. Doing so will allow us to add value to our life & build meaningful bonds with those around us. But no matter what others do, the Almighty will always be there for us!

So you’re having issues with your health, your finances, your marriage, your children and the list goes on. You’re going through heartache and disappointment; you feel overwhelmed; close to giving up! Keep asking the Almighty. Nothing is too big for the Lord of the Worlds!

Our lives can end in a heartbeat. The Almighty can take us anytime. It has nothing to do with age so don’t be deceived! Young or old, when it’s your time, you’ll go. Be prepared. Don’t be caught up in this world with never-ending desires. Because that’s what Satan does best!

You may think you’re in the worst situation ever but you forget that where you are right now is NOT your final destination. Keep going. The Almighty will bring you from trial to victory, from feeling lost to feeling on top of the world. No one can stop His Plans for you.

Are you guilty of this? Treating people badly, using them to serve your purpose only. Examine yourself constantly to make sure you’re not doing this. Because you can’t keep treating people badly, expecting the Almighty to do nothing about it. What goes around comes around!

Almighty. On this blessed day, guide us towards doing good deeds for Your sake only. Give us the strength to be steadfast, enduring the trials You send our way. Grant us a soft heart, always content with Your Decree. Grant us sincerity, happiness & success & protect us from harm.
Uganda Nambole Stadium Event is confirmed for 23rd June 2019. Gates own at 8am. Event starts at 10am. #BuildingBridges #Kampala #Uganda #muftimenk #inshaAllah

When life gets difficult and nothing seems to be going your way, you can either get bitter or accept it & do your best. Bitterness keeps you stuck in the present situation. Let it go. Choose to move forward & keep positive, knowing that the Almighty has your back. Always!

Many people make the mistake thinking that a confident person is the one who is better than everyone else. That is far from the truth. Confidence isn't strutting into a room thinking you're better than everyone else; it's walking in not having to compare yourself to anyone.

What you do away from the public eye speaks a lot about you. It shows your true character. Don’t think no one knows or sees it because the Almighty knows everything about you, both done publicly and in private. He knows what has happened, what will happen & how it will happen!

Our journey is paved with sad and happy moments. That’s how it is. No matter what the Almighty places in our path, keep putting one foot in front of the other, even when it hurts. No one knows what lies ahead but the One who made us. Trust that He only wants what’s good for us!

May the Almighty fill our hearts with compassion on this beautiful day. Spread the joy of #Eid to all around you and don’t forget to reach out to those in need. #EidMubarak to all of you. Have a beautiful time with your loved ones.

Selamat Hari Raya Aidul Fitri Malaysia! MaasyaAllah! How is my Bahasa!? 
#selamatharirayaidulfitri https://t.co/dUlYhXBxvM

Regardless of which day you’re celebrating #Eid, may the Almighty Guide and Bless you and your loved ones always. As we gather for the joyous occasion, spare a thought and pray for those facing turmoil & calamity the world over. Reach out to those in need. #EidMubarak

All the prayers you’ve been making, the dreams you’ve been wanting so badly, trust the Almighty because He has got it under control. He is going to ensure that things fall into place. He is going to make things happen that you could never have done on your own. Have firm faith!

Whatever goals you’re setting, often it’s better to keep that thought to yourself. Not everyone is a well-wisher. While you’re telling someone about your next ambitious move, they might not always want the best for you. There’s a lot of competition and jealousy out there!

Make a commitment to a fresh  start, a new beginning when #Ramadan ends. Give up at least one bad habit in this blessed month. Do it solely for the sake of the Almighty. All the good we have done should not come to an end with the end of the month. Hold on to them. Start anew!

Stop stressing yourself over how your life is going to turn out. Nobody has it all figured out. Only the One who made you knows what will happen. So live your life the best way you can and attach your heart to the One who matters most. It’s one sure way to attain contentment!

Don’t fall into the trap of Satan who makes you believe that happiness comes with getting all that your heart desires. The more you have, the happier you’ll be? That’s a lie! In fact, it’s furthest from the truth. Happiness is appreciating all that you have been blessed with.
#MoSalah can now go for another #Salah. #Taraweeh! #RamadanBanter

On Judgement Day, the Almighty will weigh your deeds & not count them. More than the numbers, He looks at how much heart you put in while doing the deed; the state of your heart at that time. Who went out of their way to do it solely for Him & who did it to show off?

Are you guilty of deriving pleasure from the misfortune of others? Something bad happens to someone else and you secretly take pleasure from it. Be careful. It shows a poisonous heart which willl get worse if you don’t check it. Empathize, be kind and show compassion instead!

Remember, your end goal is Paradise. So everything that you’ve been doing during this blessed month of Ramadan should continue when the month ends. Don’t let up. Don’t make it a short-term goal. Paradise is the ultimate destination in this lifelong journey. Strive to get there.

Almighty. On this blessed day, we ask You to guide us to the best of manners. Grant us sound faith and conviction.  Forgive all our sins; the small, the major, those done privately and openly. Grant our soul its strength and purify it for You have complete power over it! Aameen.

The trouble with us is too often we are so focused on what we hope the Almighty will do for us in the near future that we forget to see what He is doing right now. Trust Him because He’s doing a lot. He has a plan for each and everyone of us. Our job is to keep going.

Almighty. Give us the strength, to go through these most blessed nights of #Ramadan. We ask You to accept all our prayers, fasts, charity and good deeds, done solely for Your Sake. If You’re pleased with us, nothing else matters! May we end this blessed month on a high note!

The past is the past. You can't change it & whatever has happened is out of your control. Truth is, the past can hurt, but it's also what you make of it. Choose to let those memories go. Learn whatever lessons you can but don’t dwell & keep harping on them. Lighten your load!

Whatever you do, don’t quit. Quitting is not an option. It never is! You’re closer to your  goal than you think. No matter what happened in the past, what took place yesterday, today’s a brand new day. The Almighty has great plans for you. Trust Him and get back on track!

In our ever-connected world, where we’re being bombarded daily with too much information, learn to disconnect and seek inner focus. It’s especially important to control distractions when you’re plugging in with the Almighty! Fight the urge to be connected at all times! #Ramadan

What is this life but a marathon, one that’s customised for each & every person. To win this race, you mustn’t give up. You must keep going & cross the finish line. There’ll be many distractions along the way. Don’t give in to them. Keep your heart & mind focused on your goal.

How do you react to things? The ball is in your court. The choice is yours. You know you’ll be tested often so what do you do? Get angry & sink into depression or you can respond with beautiful patience; knowing the Almighty is in full control. Put your full faith in Him! Trust!
