Change isn’t easy. Even when you want it to happen. But if you’re serious about wanting to make your life better, you need to embrace change. Seek the Almighty for strength & comfort. It requires more energy than you think. Use these blessed days to make it a reality!

If you want to feel the sweetness of worship, cleanse your heart. A diseased heart won’t be at ease. Make a conscious effort to get rid of pride, hatred, envy & anything that gets in the way of being fully focused on the Almighty. It won’t happen overnight but you’ll get there.

Search your own heart. Could it be that your suspicion of the ulterior motives of others is because you’re prone to doing the same? Increase the habit of praising others & let thankfulness overflow to the Almighty when someone does something good to you. Try it. You’ll feel good!

As we enter the ten most blessed nights, include us among those who fasted this #Ramadan properly, attained the goodness of #LaylatulQadr & having made efforts to get closer to You! Guide us to make the most of the days left, raise our status & forgive all our sins. Aameen!

If you’ve managed to clean up your act so far in this blessed month, that’s really commendable. Make a commitment to never let anger, envy, hatred, malice, slander, gossip, backbiting, obscene talk, swear words and the likes from your mouth, come back into your life again!

Almighty. On this blessed day, hide our faults, forgive our sins, save us from disgrace in this world & the next. When we start losing hope or begin to doubt ourselves, remind us that Your Plans are always better than we could ever imagine! Keep our hearts firmly attached to You!

The Almighty is the Most Wise. Whatever we’re going through now, it’s crucial to remember He knows what’s best for us. Though we shy away from facing our worries & fears, it may be that we hate a thing that is good for us & desire something that can only lead to our destruction.

Don’t just focus on how you can make your life better, look for ways to make someone else’s life better too. Often, it’s hard to find someone willing to go out of their way to help those in need. When you’re able to do that, then you will achieve satisfaction & true contentment.

Don’t let people make you feel bad for not conforming to their way of life & habits. You’re answerable to the Almighty for all your actions, not to the rest of the people. You can’t live a life where your every action is dictated by people who aren’t even concerned about you!

Try and do something each day to bring a smile on your parents face. Show them the love and appreciation that they deserve for all that they’ve done for you. Don’t be among those who neglect them and see their worth only after they’ve left this world. Don’t live with the regret!

Failures, faults and frustration. We’ve all been through them. But never let them consume you. The Almighty knows what you’re going through at all times. He knows your fears. He hears your prayers even when you can’t find the right words. Hand over all these and more to Him!

As we cross the halfway mark in #Ramadan take stock of how you’re progressing. It’s never too late. The most crucial thing is to finish strong as we head towards the last ten nights. Keep going. The Almighty knows & sees all your efforts, no matter how small. He will reward you

Sometimes an evil plot against you will be the very means by which you will be granted greater growth & success, more than what the plotters ever imagined! Don't despair. Don't give up. The Almighty knows & He is with you! Pick up the pieces & press ahead with your own plans!

It’s important to keep an inner sense of calm about you. When dark stormy clouds of doubt, anger or worry start creeping in, always remind yourself that nothing lasts. Every storm shall pass. The Almighty is testing you and will continue to do so until you lay your trust in Him!

Constant positive reminders benefit us more than we can imagine. Revelation from the Almighty contains repeated reminders; though worded differently at times, they’re meant for deep reflection to bring about positive change. Don't be irritated by the repetition of good messages!

When you’re always making assumptions about others, you damage your capacity to relate to them. You’re always assuming you know how they think & feel, so you stop  listening & communicating, leading to misunderstanding. Be mindful of this. It can spiral into negative thinking!

We all go through struggles in life. Everyone of us without exception. So don’t feel depressed. Obstacles keep us on our toes. Just because time seems tough now, does not mean it will remain this way forever. Nothing lasts. Focus on the big reward the Almighty has promised!

Learn not to tell people more than they need to know. This can be difficult but be conscious of the information that you choose to divulge. People have no business to know everything about you. The less you tell, the better for you. It can save you from a whole lot of trouble.

If anyone tries to draw you into an argument, gossip, backbiting & the likes, simply excuse  yourself & say, “I am fasting”. Just as we are concerned about what goes into our mouths, what comes out of it is equally important! Be mindful. Don’t shortchange yourself. #Ramadhan

Making peace with your inner self is important. It starts from the inside first. It could mean mending broken relationships that have been bugging you, strengthening existing ones or simply making sense of your negative feelings. Let go of resentments. Don’t wait. Start now.

Almighty. On this blessed day, we ask You to forgive all our sins. You know how much we have transgressed and how many sins we have committed. Do not take us to account for our lack of attention. Do not punish us for messing up repeatedly. Please continue to be patient with us.

Don't take anything for granted. You never know when you'll have it for the last time. Life is a precious gift, cherish every moment while you can. It’s truly such a blessing to be alive & to be able to impact the lives of others. You’ll never know whose life you’re touching.

Don’t underestimate any act of kindness, no matter how small you think it is. Every act of kindness is a seed. All seeds will grow eventually and produce a harvest for you to reap the reward. Never tire of doing good and a bountiful harvest of blessings will be yours!

Don’t put off till tomorrow what you should do today. When you have the “one day” attitude, you’ll miss out on a lot of goodness in #Ramadan. You refuse to see what the Almighty is dangling in front of you right now. Don’t end up the loser by being a procrastinator!

Before speaking bad about others, ask yourself; if present, would the person spoken about dislike & become unhappy about what you’re saying? If so, then consider staying quiet. It is better to communicate directly with someone than to speak about others behind their backs!

Don’t be fooled into thinking that everyone is your friend. Just because they hang around you doesn’t mean they are your friends. People pretend well. They will laugh with you & joke around with you. At the end of the day, when push  comes to shove, they’ll be exposed. Take heed.

No matter how ashamed you are of the sins you’ve committed, turn back to the Almighty. Nothing is too small for Him. Seek forgiveness constantly. While we will continue to struggle with wrong actions, they must not be a reason for us to despair. Never lose hope in His Mercy.

We’re almost a third into the month of #Ramadan. May the Almighty accept our fast & acts of worship! How do you think you’re doing so far? Have you developed a routine, are you struggling to fit in extra prayers & time to reflect? It’s not too late!

Don’t be narrow-minded & think of doing things only for yourself. It’ll frustrate you; you’ll want something more. Learn to do things for others. Learn to help any which way you can. When you help others, it opens the door for you to be blessed! Do it without batting an eyelid.

Pray for those who've passed away & prepare for the day you & I will leave this world. Today, we've lost a legend. Ebrahim Gangat. You were loved by millions & will surely be missed. Your legacy lives on. May your shortcomings be forgiven & may you be granted Paradise. Aameen.

Keep asking the Almighty to replace our sadness with hope, anxiety with reassurance, depression with happiness, weakness with strength. May we fully rely on Him for everything. Keep our faith firm & unflinching. Mend our brokenness and keep us on the straight path always!

The paths to Paradise are many. Fasting is one of them. Don’t waste it. #Ramadan is not any ordinary month. When you fast, your hearing, sight & tongue should also fast. Don’t engage in acts that will spoil it. Don’t let the day you fast be the same as the day you don’t fast!

The scars we get in life are proof of inner strength. They show us that we’re all warriors really; even if we were gasping for air for a while. We’re no longer reaching for those who don’t bother to give us their hand. We’ve learnt that only the Almighty will helps us. Only Him.

Don’t make it your business to gossip about those who are trying hard to improve themselves. Pray for them instead. Motivate & encourage, add a good word but never put them down. Don’t be arrogant & think you’ve got it all good. No one is perfect. We are all a work in progress.

Read the signs when the Almighty’s telling you to move on. Don’t put a question mark where He has put a full stop. It’s not in our capacity to fully comprehend all that’s going on. Only He does. Our job is to trust Him. But know that He will heal the pain & mend the broken heart!

Don’t stress over things you can’t control. Hand it over to the Almighty. There’s no need to spend sleepless nights thinking about your problems. It’ll get you nowhere. He can easily take care of things if only you’d trust Him. He’s the only One who can turn your life around.

Almighty. On this blessed day, in this blessed month, make us among those who fast sincerely for Your sake. May You accept our worship and nights in prayer which we do in full submission. Keep us away from heedlessness and forgive all our sins. Aameen.
Let us work on our hearts. Recharge, rejuvenate, rekindle, renew, revitalize, revive, reactivate & get closer to the Almighty. If not now, then when? #Ramadan

Make it a habit to pray for others. Remember, the ripple effect from prayer is simply remarkable. When you pray for others, good things come to you. The Almighty is engaged in helping someone as long as he is engaged in helping someone else. So don’t be stingy. Start doing it!

Hypocrites love to gossip, they love to know what everyone else is doing; their ins and outs. They may even make up gossip if it’s not juicy enough. It can be hurtful and upsetting when you are the subject of the untruthful gossip. Confront them peacefully and pray for them!

Be careful when you blurt out harsh words in harsh tones. The hurt might pierce deeper than you could ever imagine. You probably think a simple sorry can fix it. But think again. Words can leave scars. Some scars are more permanent than others.

This #Ramadan, make a firm commitment to use words to build people up. Stop using foul language, bad speech & don’t curse & swear. Words are powerful. They leave a lasting impact. So let nothing else but good come out of your mouth. The effects will resonate far and wide.

It’s easy to get discouraged and feel let down when things are rough. Everyone has disappointments, everyone has bad days but if you’re firm in faith and trust the Almighty fully,  He will find a way out for you and you wouldn’t even remember whatever pain you had to endure.

Soften our hearts for #Ramadan. Renew our link with the Almighty & celebrate revelation of the greatest message from our Lord. For a blessed month that's bountiful with deeds, repent sincerely. Commit to change for the better & discard old habits!

A person who is content with what the Almighty provides for him will enjoy tranquility, satisfaction & peace of mind, as he does not long for what others have, or desire what he does not possess. If you’re content with what He has given you, you’ll be the richest person!

Why do we commence Ramadan a day earlier or later than others? For a simple answer, watch this video.

 https://t.co/GMoC3EPPIt
Whether your #Ramadan started today or will start tomorrow, I wish every one of you the most blessed & spiritually elevating month. May the Almighty keep us steadfast and make us better people.

It’s easy to be overwhelmed by all that’s going on & get distracted from your main goal. With #Ramadhan just days away, keep reminding yourself of what’s important. Don’t spend time on futile activities that keep you away from worshipping the Almighty. Stay focus. Be consistent!

Do you realize that death is chasing us just like we’re chasing this temporary world? Today, many souls left us & the same will happen tomorrow. The truth is we're clueless when our time will come. Let us be prepared & always be in a state of obedience to our Lord! Turn to Him!

Your real test comes when things are not going your way not just when things are smooth sailing. Do you trust the Almighty when you can’t figure out what’s going on? Do you take it in your stride & bear patience even though you don't understand His Plan?

It’s easy to be overwhelmed by all that’s going on & get distracted from your main goal. With #Ramadan just days away, keep reminding yourself of what’s important. Don’t spend time on futile activities that keep you away from worshipping the Almighty. Stay focus. Be consistent!

Satan is always working hard to pull you away from the straight path. So you must be on guard against him. Never allow yourself to be trapped by Satan and his troops. They’ll make you feel hopeless. Remain steadfast in repentance and be assured of divine mercy and forgiveness.

Almighty. On this blessed day, we ask You for contentment with whatever You have decreed for us. Let us go through it, bearing full patience, knowing You’re in control. Guide us to the best of manners, repel all that’s bad from us; forgive all our sins and purify our hearts!

Focus is crucial in our relationship with the Almighty, especially in this age of distraction. This focus is not only meant for our daily prayers, but should stretch to every aspect of our lives. Living a distracted life leads nowhere as you’ll fall prey to the tricks of Satan!

If there’s nothing more important in one’s life than prayer, why is it that we don’t place enough importance on it. Some even neglect it. How can we expect to have success in this world & the next when we turn a deaf ear to the call to success daily? Let's change our priorities

Learn to trust the Almighty without an iota of doubt. Remember, you don’t have all the answers but He does. He is Lord of the Worlds. He is the asnswer to all your woes. He is our Provider, Sustainer, Nourisher, Healer, Comforter, Protector and everything that you need!

If you’re one of those who loves to procrastinate, now’s the time to change this bad habit. Some suffer mild symptoms, delaying simple tasks; others allow it to control their lives, to the point that it disrupts their connection with the Almighty. Don’t fall prey. Act now!

Think back to the last sin you committed. The one before & the one before that & so on... How many promises did you make to repent & how many times did you fail to keep it? Turn back to the Almighty. We don’t know if there will be a next time. Tomorrow is not promised to anyone!

Smokers become very defensive when reminded that they need to quit the bad habit. There are so many reasons to do so; it’s a waste of money, secondhand smoke harms others & smoking actually kills! Take control of your life before it’s too late. Be strong & quit it once & for all!

If you think you're the only one serving the Almighty or doing good, think again. Your effort may be significant but it’s not the only method of good. Millions are doing good work. Don't belittle their efforts. Don't abuse them. Support them. The Almighty uses whoever He wishes.

Never take any good deed lightly. A good deed is never insignificant & should neither be ignored nor looked upon as trivial. We never know which deed will be the key to our Paradise. It could be that a deed we consider small and insignificant might be so pleasing to the Almighty!

What is this life? We all know that this worldly life is temporary. It’s nothing but an illusion, play & amusement. It will trick you. It will entice you. And yet we spend a disproportionate amount of time on it, forgetting to build our everlasting life in the Hereafter.

Do you sometimes feel that nobody really understands what you're going through? Well, the truth is nobody does except the Almighty. He’s always there for you, always available to listen to you, help you, heal you, sustain you, protect you, watch over you & make you whole again!

Satan will trick you into the joy of sin which lasts only momentarily. Be careful not to fall for his antics because what will happen thereafter is everlasting regret and remorse. Protect yourself and build an armour against him with the continuous remembrance of the Almighty.

The Almighty has bestowed each one of us with something special. What you do with it depends on your attitude. Will you use it to achieve your full potential or will you be distracted by what others have & keep comparing with them? Remember, it’s your journey as decreed by Him!

What are we actually chasing in this life? Looks fade, money goes; what’s left? When that happens, it’s your personal relationship with the Almighty that stays. That’s the only thing that matters really. He will guide you and provide a way out for you in every circumstance.

Ultimately, even the best of deeds may come to nothing if the hearts are sick; if the hearts are corrupt. So the heart plays a major role & deserves great attention. Seek the Almighty’s help often to rid the heart of major diseases - hatred, envy etc. Keep purifying your intent!

No matter what’s going on, always uphold good character and conduct. Let people criticise, let them pick on petty issues, let them say nasty things. Be good and kind-hearted even if they aren’t. Rise above it. What goes around comes around. Remember there’s Judgement Day!

Holding on to your faith in the midst of suffering is not for the faint-hearted. There’s purpose in the pain, everything happens for a reason. You may not realize it now, but when you look back, you’ll understand the Almighty’s Plan for you. So ride out the storm and trust Him.

Almighty. On this blessed day, we ask You to forgive our sins and continue to be patient with us. We ask You to overlook our shortcomings and accept the little that we’ve done. We are in need of Your Mercy always. Keep our hearts attached to You and those who remind us of You.

Stress can be more harmful than merely affecting your physical health. Mentally, it causes you to crumble. You lose hope, faith & trust. Inner peace can only be achieved by remembering the Almighty frequently and asking for His help & forgiveness in times of difficulties.

Learn to use other’s success as inspiration. Instead of focusing on our failure, we can see their achievement as something to motivate us. If he did it, so can we; our time will come! We can be proactive, evaluate their success & see how we can apply it to improve our own lives.

True patience is when, regardless of how harsh life gets, you remember the beautiful things the Almighty has promised you. You keep enduring no matter how horrible you feel inside. You know it won’t last. You never inflict pain on others or let it affect how you treat them.

When you hold on to hurt, resentment or a grudge, you are not going to be able to understand the Almighty’s Plan for you because your heart has hardened. Bad thoughts & negativity surround you. You become defensive & cold-hearted. You care about little else. Lighten your load!

Life’s not a sprint but a marathon. Stop being so hard on yourself & embrace your journey. It’s preparing you for the Hereafter. It won’t be paved with roses, be wary of the thorns along the way. Your plans won’t always be the way you planned it but the way the Almighty wants it!

Don’t pay heed to people who talk behind your back. You can’t stop them. What everyone else has to say, think, or feel about how you live your life does not and should not affect your happiness or state of mind. It’s really about them, not you. Realize this before it's too late.

No matter what your circumstance, remember the Almighty always has the final say. He will make good everything that wasn’t right & you’ll be amazed. So don’t let the actions of others get in your way & hinder you. Let them say what they will. He controls your destiny; not them!

Some won’t understand you. Some won’t support you. Some will leave you. Some won’t even care if you’re down in the dumps. But no matter what others put you through, your Creator will always be there for you. He knows every moment of your struggle. He will compensate you greatly

Jumping to conclusions is one of the most common forms of negative thinking. You usually jump to a negative conclusion without any justifiable facts of the situation. As a result, you become negative, depressed, anxious, sad or angry. Put a stop to it. Change your mindset!

I strongly condemn the #SriLankaAttacks. Many were killed this morning while attending church services. This is totally unacceptable. We firmly believe in peaceful coexistence. My thoughts are with the victims & their families. #PrayForPeace #PrayForSriLanka #SriLanka

Strengthen your faith daily through good deeds. Kindness with your tongue, charity with your wealth, render help where possible. Stay connected to the Almighty. We cannot expect to strengthen our ties with Him and increase our faith if we only worship Him when we feel like it!

Always remember, your value is not based on what you look like, what you do, or who you know, your status in life! Also you are not defined by your past. Use the past to learn lessons for the present and future. Your true value comes from how close you are to your Creator!

We live in an age of envy. Where envy is being taken to extremes. People are generallly dissatisfied with their lives because they can’t achieve the lifestyle they want but which they see others have. This is dangerous. Be grateful for what you have before you lose it all.

Keep praying, keep asking. The Almighty is All-Knowing. Never doubt that He’s aware of the goings-on in your life. He will grant you strength in times of need, peace in chaos, hope in helplessness and will lift you when you feel down. All you have to do is trust Him. Completely!

Don’t get complacent with life & choose to stay in your comfort zone. That’s not what the Almighty wants us to do. That’s why He tests us again & again; to stretch us, to grow, to learn new things & to rise to new levels. He’s given us the capacity to do it. He knows our limits!

Almighty. On this blessed day, we pray for our children. May You grant them a heart of faith, keep them healthy & heal all those who are ill. Bless them with good, righteous friends &  those who will remind them of You. Grant them a strong sense of right & wrong & keep them safe!

Understand the tricks of Satan. He will try his best to make the forbidden so attractive to you. He convinces you that lust is love. He makes your heart flutter by planting such thoughts in you. Be strong enough to ignore it. Work on pleasing the Almighty. He will reward you!

Don’t underestimate the endless ripple effect of any act of goodness and kindness, no matter how small it is. Sooner or later, it will make its way back to you. Remember, what goes around, comes around. Perhaps not immediately but trust the Almighty to reward you eventually!

Give people the time and space they need to to heal from their hurt. Don’t rush them. We all deal with trials and tribulations in our own unique ways. Lend an ear, lend a helping hand, make sure they know you’re there if they need you. That’s the best help you can offer!

Take a break from social media periodically. Reconnect with the real world. Plug in to real people & places around you. Find time to actually see someone in person instead of sending them a message online. Connections with family & friends are more meaningful face to face!

Don’t engage small-minded, petty people unless you’re able to help them. What you say & do will never be good enough for them. They’ll make your life difficult. Focus on controlling our own actions. We can’t allow ourselves to get sucked into their madness or we’ll end up hurt!

When your heart is at ease & you reach the level of trust in the Almighty, without any reservation, you don’t stress over life. You let Him do what He wills. If He opens a door for you, thank Him; if it doesn’t open, you still thank Him. That’s the beauty of complete trust!

Today, it's just so easy to take pictures of all the good things going on in your life, post them on social media & to a random person looking at your feed it may look like that's how your life always is. Who are we fooling? Ourselves! Be wary not to believe your online life!

Treat your spouse kindly and do not resort to abuse in any form. Lack of kindness is often the source of marital conflicts & the cause of most divorce. Anger, selfish or irresponsible behavior & criticism have a huge impact on kindness. It will threaten your marriage bit by bit!

Don’t be so hard on yourself. Address today’s problems with the capacity you’ve been given. Don’t start worrying about what’s to come tomorrow & whether you’ll be able to handle it. Leave that till tomorrow. Do your best. The Almighty won’t burden you with more than you can bear!

Social media has given haters & detractors a platform to take a swipe & abuse freely. Don't be dragged into a war of words by trying to respond to every negative comment online. You'll be playing straight into their hands. Leave it be. The Almighty knows & so do the fair-minded.

Remember, no one in your life is perfect. Stop expecting them to be perfect. There’s no such thing. Such people don’t exist. You’re setting yourself up for a huge disappointment if you expect perfection. We are all humans & we make mistakes. Accept it & you’ll be a lot happier!

Prayer is not about you getting something from the Almighty as & when you want it. It’s more than that. The act of connecting with Him, building your relationship with Him, how you ask Him - all these play a part. Keep the communication going daily, not just when in need!

The most important thing you can do when you’ve done something wrong is to have the courage to own up and admit your fault. Aplogise to the people you’ve wronged. Don’t look for excuses or scapegoats. A sincere apology shows you’re taking responsibility for your own action.

Don’t think that you’ve nothing to offer those around you, no matter how insignificant you feel it is. Always remember that you add value to the people you mix with. You’ve something to give everyone; whether it’s your time, a smile, a prayer, an encouraging word or lend a hand!

Almighty. On this blessed day, protect us from the greed of our own soul. You know the struggle against worldly pleasures, hypocrisy & insincerity, hatred & envy, arrogance & pride etc. Help us to purify our hearts against such evil traits which Satan has beautified!

Beautiful patience is a gift. Not everyone has it. It’s the ability to accept what happens at the first  sign of a calamity and the ability to hold on to that patience till the trial is over. No complaining, no whinging, just a calm accepting heart from the start till the end!

We all have our scars. We all have broken pieces. But the beauty in all that is they come together to create the real you! The you who survived the pain & hardship, the you who emerged stronger, kinder and more compassionate! The you who’s ready for whatever life dishes out!

Hiding behind anonymity to attack others on social media is a cheap act of cowardice. Respectful people use their real identity to address matters of importance in a dignified manner. Anonymous insults hold no value. They’re worthless. Ignore them.

Sins are almost always associated with an accompanying sense of guilt. While we can always turn a blind eye to those guilty feelings, we know that such guilt will slowly chip away at our happiness. Repentance will remove that guilt and fill our hearts with calmness & tranquility!
The turnout at today's #BuildingBridges event in #Zamboanga, #Philippines was amazing. May the Almighty bless you all. Aameen #muftimenk #lovepreacher https://t.co/GxeEuwQ1Cn

The Almighty’s Plan for us doesn’t have to be a mystery. If we trust Him, do what He asks, His Plan will unfold in our lives like a brightly lit path. If you are trying to follow His Guidance, but you find yourself confronted with obstacles and hardship, don’t despair. He knows!

Make a commitment that you’ll  henceforth spend a lot of time working on your shortcomings & your link with the Almighty, leaving no time to judge & criticize others. You’ll channel your energy towards becoming a better version of yourself & strive towards positivity & goodness!

Do you have true friends? Those who will tell you the truth, no matter how it hurts. Those who are happy for your success. Those who are by your side, comforting you when times are bad. And those who will remind you of the Almighty at all times, drawing you closer to Him!

In this age of social media, it’s almost second nature for some to do good deeds and then show off to the world what they’ve done. Don’t! Try to keep some deeds secret; only between you and the Almighty. No matter how small it is, to Him it could weigh heavily on your scales!

We’re bombarded with the temptation to be popular daily. The pressure to do what others are doing. Don’t fall into this trap. Even if “everyone is doing it,” wrong is never right. Evil, wrongdoings & darkness will never be the truth, even if popular. Let your faith stand firm!

If you feel like you’re always giving & never on the receiving end, be grateful. It’s like that with some people who won’t hesitate to take & take; but will think many times over before giving. Remember, at the end of the day, your reward’s with the Almighty. Nothing escapes Him!

We have to accept that regardless of what we want in this world and regardless of whether or not we get it, we’re still going to want more and so much more. That’s just the nature of Man. Learn to focus more on what’s to come, the Hereafter. You’ll be the happiest person!

Shift your focus from what’s bad to what’s good; from pain to  passion; from resentment & holding grudges to forgiveness, gratitude & appreciation. Stay positive & hopeful, knowing that the Almighty wants only good for us. Keep spreading goodness & it will come back to you!

The Almighty can heal every heart and the hurt inside, mend everything that’s broken, guide every decision and lead us to the path of righteousness. It’s not difficult for Him. He’s the Lord of the Worlds. You have to do your part and He will do the rest. Leave it to Him!

When your heart is in the right place, you’ll be sensitive to being unduly praised. You feel uncomfortable. Although people who praise you may be well-meaning, such praise only reminds you of your limitations and weakness. May the Almighty keep us humble at all times!

Almighty. On this blessed day, give us the strength & courage to stay firm & hold on to our faith & belief. Don’t make us among those who lose ourselves in a crowd just because we want to fit in. Help us to worry less about what people think of us. Only You matter in the end!

Don’t dwell on the past or worry about the future. Live in the present moment and appreciate everything that the Almighty has bestowed on you. Learn to see the blessing that unfolds each time as you go about your daily life. There are many if we only bother to look. Be grateful!

People with large egos can be difficult to deal with. Signs of a big ego include over confidence, blindness to personal flaws, focus on self over others & difficulty seeing other points of view. Be wary of such people. They may not take kindly to advice. Pray for them instead!

There’s no doubt that life can be incredibly hard at times. The sick, terminally ill, sadness, oppression, adversity. The list goes on. But the one thing we have is our ability to help someone in their time of need. Let them know that someone cares. What a difference it makes!

Your real test comes when you do the right thing even when it is difficult to do so; you’re able to keep a good attitude even though people are not treating you right and when you can go the extra mile while nobody is watching. That is true character! Respect!

We pray long & hard to the Almighty for things or people we want in our lives. At times He doesn't give it to us. Not because we don't deserve it. Because it doesn't deserve us! If we knew the future & what it holds we would never be dissatisfied with the Almighty’s Decree.

You’ll be in trouble when you take your eyes off your own path & look over at someone else's. You’ll get sucked into comparing your life with others & lose all sense of gratitude of the many blessings the Almighty has bestowed on you. Quick advice: don’t linger on social media!

One of the biggest challenges we face today is that of pride & arrogance. When we help someone, we feel good. But be wary of waiting for others to lavish praise on you. Don’t become big-headed. By all means get a pat on your back but the ultimate goal is to please the Almighty!

Social media has many benefits but the quality of our life has become largely dependent on what we post online and how it compares to everyone else in our feed. Don’t let your value be attached to your online presence. It’s unhealthy. Appreciate life. Stop the comparison!

Some people especially love it when they hear something that makes someone look bad. They seem to thrive on it & can’t wait to spread it. Even though the temptation to gossip is powerful, you will always win when you choose NOT to engage in it. Make that commitment today.

Occupy yourself with improving your own character & conduct. Focus on your own faults rather than pointing fingers at others, which is what most of us are in the habit of doing. Aim to be a better version of yourself today than you were yesterday. The Almighty will help you!

Don’t believe anyone who says that he has it all together; there’s no such thing. Every single one of us is fighting an unseen battle that is often hidden by a brave exterior. That's why it is so important to be compassionate. Always try & put yourself in someone else’s shoes!

When you give others a sincere compliment, words of encouragement or just a warm smile, you’re making their world a little better. You’re making them feel appreciated & valuable. You’ll feel more fulfilled because you have done something to make someone else’s life better.

We all worry. It’s human nature to do so. But it won’t change anything. The next time you’re tempted to worry, turn it around. Hand it over to the Almighty. Close your eyes and feel that sense of relief when you say, “ I may not understand what’s happening but I trust You!”

Don’t think that the Almighty is unaware of every hurt and every unfair situation you’ve been through. He’s All-Knowing, All-Seeing. He will liberate you from all that has happened. Don’t keep it bottled up inside. Let it go and let Him take over. He is the best of Planners!

Cleanse your heart. Let go of grudges. What’s the point of holding them? Forgive and move on. When you forgive, the Almighty will increase your honour. Remember, nothing escapes Him. So break free from the clutches of grudges. You’ll feel the burden on your shoulders lighten!

Almighty. On this blessed day, make us among those who when we know the truth, we’ll follow it & when we see falsehood, we’ll avoid it. Grant us the ability to see right from wrong. We ask You to have Mercy on us, make things easy & help us to do the things that will please You!

Don’t feed your fear. Feed your faith! When you feed your fear, you’re going the way Satan has mapped out for you; focusing on  fearful thoughts which keep you from moving forward. Instead, learn to trust the Almighty and His Plans. Get close to Him & feel the peace.

One of the best remedies for tough times is to be patient. The trouble with most of us is we start complaining. We talk about our difficulties to anyone and everyone. Spend time instead remembering the Almighty. Get close to Him. He’s the Owner of all solutions to your problems!

Start running your own race. Stop comparing yourself to others. If the Almighty wants you to have what others have, He will give it to you, if not now then at some stage later on. Be happy with His Decree. Show gratitude. If you’re grateful, He will surely grant you more.

A strong faith can keep us focused on the fact that the Almighty alone controls all destinies & has power over all things. Remembering that fact when we’re being tested can help us overcome the pain and provide us with the hope & energy to keep moving forward & not give up!

Betrayal hurts badly. It shatters the trust you had in others and leaves you feeling like you’ve done it all wrong. When a person close to you violates your trust, it calls everything into question and provides no easy answers. Put your trust in the Almighty to heal you.

I'm deeply saddened by news of the deplorable #MaliMassacre where more than 130 villagers were brutally killed. We need to do more to spread peaceful coexistence on this earth which belongs to all of us. We must stand up & say NO to violence, terror & all killing. #ChildrenOfAdam

Learn to listen. People just want to be heard. To feel that their voice matters. Give them a listening ear. Show them that in the chaos of this world, someone is concerned & can empathize with them, free from judgment. Be that person for someone. Show your ability to care!

Hiding pain under a smile is not easy. It can be one of the hardest things to do. You do it when you care about others more than you do for yourself. But remember, a smile can hide so much; anxiety, fear, pain, sadness, tears. But they reflect one main thing. Inner strength!

Even when it seems like everything is going wrong, something is still going right. When we lose one thing, we gain another. There’s a blessing in all things, good and bad. The Almighty wants us to learn specific lessons before we can move on to the next level of spirituality!

Social media is making us forget how to interact with people in real-life. For some, posting what they want others to see helps them feel better about themselves, making them feel they’re connected to others. But technology isn’t life. Spend more time with people! Not devices!

A humble heart has no room for ego, pride or arrogance because it recognizes that all we have and all we are comes from the Almighty. We are nothing without Him. So learn to tread the earth humbly focusing on the Almighty & helping others rather than concentrating on yourself!

Don’t look down on those who are trying to get close to the Almighty, no matter how small their effort may seem to you. Not everyone is on the same spiritual level. Don’t use yourself as the yardstick. Everyone is worthy of help. Only the Almighty knows what’s in our hearts.

Never feel unloved & abandoned by your Maker. These are thoughts from Satan. The Almighty says don't despair. He tests you to reward you! So when things fall apart, it doesn't mean you're doomed. The Almighty's in full control. It may seem hopeless but He'll make it even better.

If you don’t want to be disappointed, keep this in mind. Don’t expect much from people. Be prepared to have the most unexpected people let you down. Don’t get too attached to this life. Nothing lasts. Keep your faith in the Almighty. He’s the only One who has your back always!

Don't allow the negativity of the world to depress you. Don't let your burdens drown you. Don’t think that your sins are the size of mountains & there’s no hope! Just turn to the Almighty with sincere repentance. He loves those who repent. Peace will prevail in your heart!

Whenever we feel afraid or hopeless or we may not understand His Plan, just remember that His Plan is definitely better than all of ours! Pray that the Almighty grants us sincerity, humility, patience, gratitude and forgiveness. May we never ever lose hope in His Mercy!

Don't allow the negativity of the world to depress you. Don't let your burdens drown you. Don’t think that your sins are the size of mountains & there’s no hope! Just turn to the Almighty with sincere repentance. He loves those who repent. Peace will prevail in your heart!

Almighty. On this blessed day, we ask You to grant peace to those who’ve lost loved ones. Surround them with those who’ll offer words of comfort. Remove the heaviness from their hearts. Help those who are feeling resentment, bitterness, or anger, not to look back but to press on!

Devastation caused by #CycloneIdai. #Mozambique #Zimbabwe #Malawi require urgent aid on a very large scale. Thousands are missing or have died. Villages, towns & cities have been affected in the worst cyclone to hit this area in recent history. Please help via any legit charity.

Big changes can be made in small steps. If you want the change to last, then you need more than a "just do it" mentality. It needs to be slowly cultivated till it becomes part of you. Then pray hard & ask the Almighty to guide you. If anyone can help, it's the One who made you!

We often hear people say the grass is greener on the other side. That’s not true. Stop comparing your lawn with someone else’s. The truth is it’s greener where you water it! It’s greener where you nurture it. Focus on the major things in life and you’ll see how it will thrive!

We live in uncertain times. The world is becoming a more dangerous place; nothing can be taken for granted. Much of the world seems to be in a state of bewildering confusion. Don’t neglect the link with our Maker. That’s the only way to keep our sanity during these times!

You will learn more from the bad days than the good days because they’re designed to toughen you, provided you learn the life lessons attached to them. Some don’t & they get stuck at a certain level because they refuse to or cannot see the whole picture yet! Pray for guidance!

Everyone’s in search of contentment. It’s not easy to keep the peace in your heart. But you must find a way to do it. Plug in with the Almighty. Let Him take over when things are not within your control. You’ll see every sunrise holds more promise; every sunset holds more peace.

When you encounter hate in any form, in speech or action, you must immediately denounce it, report it & stop it. It’s your duty. It should not be tolerated whether in our everday lives, on main stream or social media. Say no to hate. Say no to violence! End the vicious cycle!

Some people just cannot communicate in a straightforward manner. They will use sarcasm as a defence mechanism, send mixed signals or act like nothing is wrong. If you cannot help such people, stay away from them. Life’s complicated enough without  having to second-guess others!

You’re allowed to disagree with others, state your opinion respectfully but NEVER get physical or violent. This quality makes us distinct from animals! So be civilised, listen to what others are saying but avoid knee-jerk reactions. It would save you from a whole lot of regret!

Thinking of death will help you prepare for that meeting with your Creator. It will help you reflect on how you will appear before Him. Full of regret and shame or with a deep sense of happiness for having been dutiful. The choice is yours. Don't let this world trick you.

Arrogance is being full of yourself, you're always right. You strut around like you know everything. Confidence is humble, quiet & doesn't shout. You’re full of useful knowledge & you share it in a manner that doesn’t make the other person feel ignorant! Know the difference!

In a world that’s trying to make you hate, judge & not care about others, learn to be considerate & compassionate. Be the bigger person. Be tolerant. Be the one who will go out of your way to help someone. Be the one showing kindness not just in bad times but all the time!

Being quiet and gentle doesn’t mean you’re weak. Such people show deep, inner strength that’s under control. It’s knowing when to speak and when to listen; when to take action and when to wait. Don’t underestimate such people. They walk the earth with the greatest strength!

When you want to give advice, do so in such a way that people will want to listen to you. Don’t be mean and hurtful. Don’t use harsh words and turn them off. Be genuine in wanting to correct their ways and help them get back on track. Your sincerity will long be remembered.

Almighty, we pray for those grieving. Those who are broken; with broken hearts & broken lives. Comfort them. Bless them with healing. Change their circumstances. Help them make sense of all the chaos going on around them. Make them feel whole again. #NewZealand #HelloBrother

A very sad day! The #ChristChurchMosqueAttack has shocked us all. Such barbaric acts of terror are strongly condemned no matter who the victims or perpetrators are. We ALL need love, kindness & respect. Let's pray for the victims, their loved ones, the nation & humanity at large.

The closer you get to the Almighty, the more you will find that He is even closer to you. Your trials & difficulties become easier to handle. You gravitate towards Him at all times. You understand His Plan. He will touch the inner depths of your heart with a profound peace.

Why do we often feel like we can speak with authority on someone’s life? How can we when we’ve not experienced what the other person has; we’ve not walked in their shoes. We have the tendency to stereotype people and think like we know it all. The truth is we don’t!

Challenges are a part of life; death of a loved one, a sudden illness, losing one’s job etc. If you want to make the most of your life, you need to learn how to push past whatever barriers are placed in your way. Keep going. Bear patience. Seek your strength from the Almighty.

Why are you so worried over what people think about you? At the end of the day, it really doesn’t matter. Let them think what they will. You can’t control them. What others think about you will never change how the Almighty sees you. He made each one of us special!

When you speak about negative traits in others and spread untruths and vicious rumors about them, you’re sinning. Be wary. What they are and who they are - that’s none of your business anyway. Just stay away from this bad habit and you’re working your way towards Paradise!

Stop labelling people. We are conditioned to judge people based on their appearance, behavior, job etc. It happens subconsciously, we don’t even realize it. Labels limit others & limit interaction. Even labels with good intentions, can create resentment & the desire for revenge.

People will behave unjustly towards you at some stage in your life. Don’t fret & get all upset. The truth will always out eventually. That should give you much comfort. Know that the Almighty is your best witness in all things. Keep your heart at peace no matter what’s going on.

A heart does not turn cold unless it has been treated badly for a long while. Yet, some will still endure & not show it. So cherish all those with good hearts in your life. Don’t take them for granted. Be compassionate. Learn to show them the gratitude they deserve!

Don’t curse the crisis you’re facing. Every hardship has a silver lining; a blessing in disguise. Be patient with yourself and let the situation unfold. Do your best and let the Almighty do the rest. You’ll emerge stronger and better able to face whatever He sends your way.

When should you stop praying for what you want? Never. For as long as you want it but remember, the same Almighty that opens doors; closes doors. You asked but you didn’t get it & you get discouraged. But the Almighty knows what lies ahead. Trust Him!

My heart goes out to all who lost  their lives in the #EthiopianAirlineCrash shortly after take-off from #AddisAbaba.  It’s indeed a sad day as I was on board another #EthiopianAirlines flight on my way home to Zimbabwe. May the Almighty comfort the families & grant ease. Aameen.

Couples need to work together to keep outside forces that may try to break them or their family. At times, this could be in the form of in-laws or the extended family. Hold your ground firmly & respectfully. You’ll end up with longer lasting and happier married lives together!

Even the nicest people have their limits! Don’t push them too far; don’t try to reach those limits. Once the boundary is crossed, they’ll never be the same person you used to know and you’ll only have yourself to blame! If you can’t be kind, remain quiet. Don’t hurt people!

Sometimes people can be difficult to deal with; refusing to apologise for their mistake, always insisting they’re right. Don’t get upset. Having the right perspective can help lighten your load. If it won’t matter in the long run, let it go & give it to the Almighty to sort out.

Worry & worship don’t go together. When you trust the Almighty, there’s no worry. Worry is a powerful tool used by Satan to deny us of what our Lord has planned for us. He will plant all sorts of ideas in our head. Don’t let Satan get the upper hand. Be on guard!

Detach yourself from that which is temporary. Do your best in everything but remember that the goal should always be to please the Almighty. Seek His help to purify your intent. As long as the link with Him is good, any hurdle along the way will become that much easier to handle.

It's not your job to change someone. You can lead by example and show them the best behaviour, what’s expected of them, good character and conduct etc but remember at the end of the day, guidance comes from the Almighty. Your job is to spread love and goodness. Pray for them!

Almighty. On this blessed day, make us steadfast in our prayers & acts of worship done solely for You. Grant us humility & a soft heart, never showing off or feeling that we’re more pious than the person next to us! Protect us from being arrogant & may we never judge others!

There are people who will never admit that they’re wrong. They will twist their words to suit the occasion; contradict themselves and make you look like the one who is wrong. Be wary of such people. Try not to argue with them. It’s worthless. Let the Almighty deal with them.
#WorldBookDay I've just launched Motivational Moments 2 in Dubai. #WorldBookDay2019 https://t.co/XMkZ0Nhxfg

Why do you feel the need to answer to your critics? You don’t have to. You don’t have to try and prove to people who you are. Your journey is yours alone. Remain steadfast. Honour Him. He will work things out for you in the end. Just remain calm and bear patience.

Good or bad, everything in this life is a test. The Almighty tests us to see if we’re grateful. He tests us to see our reaction when His favours are withdrawn. When things go wrong, bear patience, trust Him. Don't give up hope. He will open doors and create opportunities!

Be in the company of mature people. Those who admit they're wrong. Those who don't point fingers and blame others for their mistakes. Those who take responsibility for their actions. Those who don’t hesitate to apologise. These are people who will help you grow in life!

Don’t focus on the disappointments of your past. Learn from them and move on. We all make mistakes. Don’t beat yourself up so hard that you keep revisiting what’s done. The Almighty has forgiven you. Lift your spirits and look ahead  to the new things that He has in store!

Feel the mountain of worries crumble & your heart at ease when you supplicate to the Almighty. Such is the power of prayer. It’s the most powerful tool you have. Don’t waste it. If your beliefs & confidence are strong enough, the impossible may become reality. Trust Him.

Live life one day at a time. The problem with us is we tend to plan ahead so much as if we’re in full control of everything. Don’t miss the beauty of today wondering what tomorrow holds. Worry won’t add anything to your life, Be grateful the Almighty has given you another day!

For many of us, saying "no" is hard! We want others to like us, accept us; we want to meet their expectations & please them. Learn to say "no" when you really mean "no" because it’s good for your well-being. We need time out; time for ourselves. Don’t feel guilty!

Remember you’re not a burden. You’re not worthless. The Almighty made you and you’ve every right to be here. Don’t ever feel that the world would be better off without you. Everyone struggles. Everyone falls apart at some stage. ⁠ ⁠Do your best and leave the rest to Him.
#NewProfilePic https://t.co/hK70RTQBqP

There are people out there who do very little and don’t bat an eyelid about taking credit for things they haven’t done. They’re happy to bask in the glory, like they deserve all the admiration. Remember, the Almighty is All-Seeeing. Rest easy knowing that your reward is with Him.

Don't let the trials & pain that you’re experiencing make you unkind. Everyone has struggles. Nobody knows what the other person is going through. There's too much suffering in the world already. Bear patience. It may be bitter now but the end result will be sweeter!

The all new Motivational Moments 2 is now available in both the hard back and ebook versions. A compilation of the best of my tweets and quotes. Please visit https://t.co/wrJIM2rpOT https://t.co/2AlymZvL4r

Stop constantly looking for a way to satisfy all your critics. Stop blaming yourself for all the wrong things. Stop telling yourself that you owe everything to everyone. Stop convincing yourself that you’re not good enough. As long as you’ve done your best, the Almighty knows!

Only the Almighty knows why you're in the state you are for so long.  But don’t fret because perhaps the delay in answering your prayer is better for you than you getting what you want, when you want it. Trust Him to get you out of the situation when the time is right.

There’ll be good days and bad days. Sad things will happen in your life. Try not to be upset, learn to accept things & take it in your stride. It’s all part of the Almighty’s Plan. So accept His Decree & face everything with full confidence, knowing that He’s watching over you!

Almighty. On this blessed day, we thank You for giving us the strength when we felt like giving up. We’ve learnt not to panic  because we know You’re with us. Keep our hearts firm in faith, come what may. We fully trust everything that You have planned for us. Aameen.

Many people are so busy spreading slander they hear about others that they do not even stop to consider whether it is true or false. Remember, if you hear something false about someone, defend him, speak up for him. The Almighty will defend you in this world and the next.

Don’t get upset and envious when the Almighty does something for others. What He has done for others, He can do for you. You need to understand His Plan. Celebrate the victory of others, be happy for them and He will grant you even more  just because you were patient!

Respect other people’s time. We often have a very selfish attitude towards time; we expect everyone to adjust their schedules around us but we won’t let anyone mess our day. Stop being self-centered and inflexible. Remember, what goes around, comes around Eventually!

Congratulations @MBuhari upon your reelection! May the Almighty protect you, continue to bless you & guide you to the best decisions. May peace & prosperity prevail. Aameen #Nigeria #Alhamdulillah https://t.co/b5MlZ33zky

Remember, nothing lasts. Next year, you’re unlikely to be in the same place that you are now. Things happen, people change. That’s life. New happenings await you. New blessings. New trials. New opportunities. So always be aware & keep your focus. Change is the only constant.

Remember there’s no problem that cannot be solved or resolved. Life throws us curveballs on occasions and more often than not, what we worry about is not even important in the long term. Always seek guidance and strength from the One who has the answer to all our problems!

We often take for granted the people closest to us, especially our parents. May the Almighty always guide us to be respectful and kind to them, no matter what status, position and power we have achieved in life. Remember, how they brought us up when we were young.

Thank the Almighty upon all conditions. It’s not just to do with wealth & good things. Thank Him for guiding you & keeping you steadfast. Thank Him for the increase in knowledge, for the lessons you’ve learnt from hardship. Do this each & every day and He will grant you more!

When you stain your tongue with slander, backbiting and gossip, your spirituality goes down significantly. You may think you’re harming the other person but in actual fact, you’re harming yourself. So learn to hold your tongue because it has the power to make you or break you!

Be the bigger person. Let arguments go; not bigger in the sense of pride or knowledge, but to back down, be humble & apologize if needed. Ask yourself before arguing: Who are you trying to prove yourself to? The Almighty knows what’s in your heart; so who else matters? Nobody!

The Almighty is the Most Wise. Whatever we face, it’s crucial that we always remember that He knows what’s best for us. Though we shy away from facing our worries & fears, it may be that we hate a thing that’s good for us & desire something that can only lead to our destruction.

As humans, we become emotional at times regarding matters that are close to our hearts. Seek comfort through patience and prayer. The Almighty will strengthen us, protect us and grant us true inner peace.

When those we trusted let us down, the sadness is even more and can be very painful. Learn not to expect too much from anyone. Trust the Almighty and depend on Him always. Those closest to us can hurt us the most. Don't drop your guard. The Almighty Alone will heal us.

Know that you’ll never fully understand everything that’s going on in your life. Why things happen the way they do. If you try to figure it all out, you’ll end up getting frustrated. Leave it to the All-Knowing Almighty. That’s His job. Your job is to trust Him. Without a doubt!

Almighty. On this blessed day, help us to often think of the day we’ll be returning to You. Take us when You are totally pleased with us. Help us understand that any delay would give us a chance to further prepare ourselves for the long-awaited meeting with You. Grant us ease!

The Almighty will test your character. He is going to see if your faith is real, if you’re patient enough! The test will show if you can handle the blessings, the influence, the success & failure, the good & bad. He’ll determine if you’re unwavering in faith. He’s the best Judge!

Just because you want peace around you doesn’t mean agreeing with everyone all the time. You have to stand your ground and believe what you believe. But don’t shove your thoughts and beliefs down someone’s throat. Sometimes you have to agree to disagree. Be respectful.

Be mindful of the company you keep. They could be the cause of your unhappiness or even downfall. If they’re overly focused on appearance, trappings of this word & social media, you could slowly be drawing yourself away from what should be your focus in life, the Almighty.

When you find the need to lie about others, know that it is a definite sign of their success & your failure. You have a diseased heart if you run others down like that. Sooner or later, it will all come back to you. Don’t rob others of what is theirs. The Almighty’s All-Seeing.

Gossip is like something you’re craving for. You say you don’t like it, but when someone tells you a juicy piece of news, you can’t resist it. It’s the work of Satan. Be wary of this pitfall; when you develop an interest & suddenly want to know what you don’t know about others!

Being successful & having everything doesn’t define your self-worth. Being positive is one of the main things you need for survival. The ability to see the glass half full rather than half empty is the key to being happy & appreciating where you are in life. Thank Him always!

Do you feel like you’re running around doing too much for this world, leaving little time for your Hereafter? You’re not alone. It’s easy to get sucked into one thing after another; there seems to be no end. Learn to pause & take stock of your life before it's too late.

Just because you took longer than others doesn’t mean you’ve failed. Don’t compare your journey to those around you. You’ll end up disappointed & disillusioned. Tread your path the best way you can. Focus on the route ahead. Don’t be distracted!

You may not be where you want to be in life but thank the Almighty that you’re not where you used to be. His Plan is always the best. Don’t doubt that. Don’t let others humiliate you with things from your past. Repent sincerely and move on. Know that He has forgiven you.

Don’t worry when things don’t work out. If you’ve tried your best & it doesn’t work then let it go. Free yourself from worries & pain by relying only on the Almighty. Just be patient, your time is yet to come. The Almighty knows your struggles. He hears your prayers!

In this make believe world of social media, people will only show you what they want you to see. Remember, everyone has a chapter in their lives where they don’t read out loud. So don’t be fooled by the “perfect front” that you often see. You’d be foolish to believe all that.

We all have problems that we believe will never be solved because it has been been too long. We feel bogged down by our own shortcomings. We begin to accept that this is how it's always going to be. But know that the Almighty doesn’t give up on you just because you’ve given up!

Almighty. On this blessed day, we pray that you have Mercy on us & grant us ease. May You comfort all those who are suffering and bring on their recovery. We know there is no cure but Your cure. Heal our heart & purify our soul so we can feel a strong attachment to You. Aameen.

If you are often stressed, anxious, feel like a failure or you're not doing what you think you should be doing in life, consider this. Start serving others. You’ll feel a sense of self worth that you’re actually helping someone & making a difference. See how your life changes!

Think positive thoughts as far as possible. Don’t think of who offended you, who betrayed you, who took you for granted & what didn’t work out. Such things are bound to happen in life. Instead, think of the goodness the Almighty has bestowed on you and how fortunate you are!

Sometimes what is not said is the more powerful message. But we’re too busy speaking our minds that we miss the clues. The one who says she’s fine but has eyes full of tears. The one who smiles because she’s too sad to cry. Even the strongest have their breaking points. Be kind

No one likes pain. In fact, most try to avoid it at all costs. But remember that pain is part of life. In fact, pain can strengthen your spiritual journey. It can bring you closer to the Almighty. Pain can also bring focus and reveal your true self and your purpose in life!

The trouble with us is the minute we encounter a problem, we have to tell others about it.  Make it a habit to confide in the Almighty first before sharing it with anyone else. Remember, He knows everything there is to know about you and He already has a solution for you!

No one knows what the future  holds but what we do know is the Almighty has a plan for each one of us. So no matter how bad the past has been, how many times we fell and picked ourselves up, all that matters is we’re trying to get close to Him. None of this will ever be wasted!

We're all scarred in one way or another. The scars you get in life are proof of your inner strength. It shows how you lived your life! They are there to strengthen you; to remind you that these are among the Almighty’s biggest tests & how you survived with beautiful patience!

The more we try to get close to the Almighty, the harder Satan will work to push us away. He will create confusion & fear; anxiety, panic or worry over something we can't control or even distinguish. It’s all part of his plan and you need to be aware. Seek strength from Him!

In life, we want the best of everything. We want success, to be loved, popular, rich, healthy, intelligent etc. We don’t want to be sad, sick, poor, in pain, hurt etc. But remember, every step of the way, the Almighty is in control! He knows you better than you know yourself!

Learn to be strong; unwavering in faith. You have to face whatever the Almighty has decreed head on. Seek His help & protection always. Don’t worry about what others say. At the end of your life, you’re not going to answer to people. It’ll just be between you & the Almighty!

In a world where there’s so much fake, find it in your heart to be yourself. Be you. Don’t be a hypocrite. No apologies. Say no when you don’t want something. Don’t be forced into saying yes. Be honest. Be authentic. Don’t be part of anything fake. Your heart will be at peace!

Perhaps you’re not where you think you should be, given your age, because the Almighty is teaching you that you can’t keep living your life according to what society dictates. Let go of expectations. Understand His Plan. Things will happen when He decides they will happen!

When you share your success or something good especially on social media, be prepared for haters to come out in full force. They might ridicule you, spread rumours about you or even spew harsh words. Don’t worry. Focus on what’s right & keep going. The Almighty’s on your side.

Almighty. On this blessed day, protect us from being leaking buckets; those who follow up their good deeds with bad ones. May we not be among those who pray, fast & give charity but curse, swear, gossip & backbite without batting an eyelid. Keep us mindful of such behaviour.

Just because someone isn’t doing things the way you would be doing them, doesn’t necessarily mean they're wrong. Understand that we are made to think differently. Accommodate someone else’s perspective. Let us learn to appreciate people for who the Almighty has made them to be.
You guessed it... https://t.co/bmewJKo31I

The Almighty is making you wait perhaps because the more you wait, the more you’ll appreciate what you’re going to get. Maybe He just doesn’t want you to be ungrateful. He wants you to value the gifts He’s going to send you & He’ll do that only when He knows you’re ready!

Choose your battles wisely. Not all are worth fighting. Walk away from those who disrespect you by lying. The best response to such people is no response at all. There’s no need for any confrontation because it would usually lead to more lies. Leave it be. The Almighty knows!

Don’t fret over missed opportunities & closed doors. Instead, pause & think. It’s the Almighty’s way of protecting us from the pain & anguish not meant for us. Had He allowed it, we would have been left broken & in total despair! Trust the judgment of the Best Planner always!

As humans, even the strongest among us gets tired at times. But that’s where patience, prayer & positivity play a big role. Without any of that, you’d probably have called it quits. Keep your strength & hope in the Almighty. He will reward those with beautiful patience!

We keep asking the Almighty to change our situation. But have we thought real hard about this? He puts us in that particular situation to change us. The way we behave, the way we view things, our perspectives, our mindset. The trials are meant to strengthen us not weaken us!

One of the hardest things must be when everyone out there’s getting what you want & you’re waiting for your turn. It’s a test of your patience. Your time will come. If it’s good for you, you’ll get it eventually. If not, the Almighty will give you what’s even better! Trust Him!

When you regret the sins you’ve committed, feel sad for having committed them and feel pain when you remember them, then these are signs of sincere repentance. However, after repenting, Satan will cause you to doubt the Almighty’s Mercy. Don’t despair. Don’t fall for it!

Learn to let go of the past. Release what doesn’t make sense. Don’t keep them in your heart and burden yourself. Don’t let it cloud your judgement, replaying the scenes many times over. Choose to forgive. Trust the Almighty. He will heal you & make you whole again.

You want to change things? Shift your mindset. Most things will never change until your mind does! Embrace positivity. Don’t let Satan or anyone mess with your mind. Keep your focus on your goal & work at it. The Almighty never said it’d be easy but promised it’d be worth it!

If you want change, do something about it. Change requires action. Mere talk will get you nowhere. People will have lofty ideals about what they want to change, yet do nothing to achieve it. If you’re sincere about change, seek the Almighty’s help. He will pave the way for you.

Remember, Satan always has a plot but the Almighty has a Plan. Incline your heart towards His Plan & you’ll be assured of success. It may not happen today or tomorrow because life is a journey that must be traveled no matter what happens along the way. Seek His help & trust Him

Man is selfish by nature. So don’t fret if the good you do is not reciprocated or acknowledged. Don’t feel disheartened although it’s natural to feel that way. Remember, the Angels are recording every single deed, no matter how small! And your reward is with the Almighty!

Those who are against you love to cause confusion. No matter how you clarify things, they won’t be satisfied. The truth will offend them. So be it. Don’t look for the approval of others. Only the Almighty’s approval matters.  What’s for you will be yours. No one can stop it!

Don’t attach your heart to those who lead a sinful life for you might one day find yourself in deep regret. It’s so important to choose your friends wisely because knowingly or unknowingly they can make a huge difference to your life. Take heed!

There’s no room for arrogance in your heart. Don’t ever feel the need to look down on someone, not for anything that the Almighty has bestowed on you; wealth, status, power, children, good looks etc. Remember the Lord of the Worlds can change your fortune in the blink of an eye

Don’t put your life on hold while waiting for something from the Almighty. You can’t afford to waste time. Your worship never stops. Keep going. Keep knocking on His door. When He thinks it’s time, everything will fall into place & you’ll be overwhelmed. You have to trust Him!

Never doubt what the Almighty can do. The Lord of the Worlds can work miracles and make the impossible possible! He can suddenly change things and move people out of your life. He can suddenly open doors you never dreamed would open. All you have to do is to trust Him!

Today, we can’t seem to have a decent debate without getting angry. We’re so caught up with putting our points across & we forget to listen to the other side. Always be fair, remain calm, respectful & committed to let the other party have their say. It’s good ethics!

When you want to correct others, you have to do it gently without being distasteful. Sometimes when you give advice, people become more aggressive & even worse off than they were before you gave them advice because of the way you did it. Choose the kindest words and be sincere!

Learn to restrain your anger because if you don’t, you’ll end up insulting, cursing, swearing &  hitting someone. Anger leads to other evil. So keep your tongue busy with the remembrance of the Almighty. This brings peace to the heart. Don’t use your tongue to hurt other people.

We all encounter storms in life. It happens for a reason. To test you, teach you, bring you closer to the Almighty, strengthen you, show who’s in charge of your life, remind you that everyone will be tested to varying degrees. You’re not the only one experiencing it. Be patient

If you find yourself being tested again and again even though you’re doing all that the Almighty has asked of you, know that your trials are a blessing not a punishment. He loves you and sends the toughest tests to his best soldiers. Endure with beautiful patience.

Learn to celebrate other people's success even before you begin to experience yours. Be happy for them. Don’t begrudge them. You can ask the Almighty to bless you with the same. But never be mean and wish ill upon them. A genuine heart is a great blessing. Not many have it!

Stop judging and questioning someone's intention. So much goodwill is lost when we do that. Instead, be honest and try to empathise with people. Always think good thoughts and follow through with good actions. It makes for a much more pleasant life all round!

Why are you feeling hopeless and on the brink of giving up? The Almighty gives hope for every disappointment, courage for every fear and strength for every weakness! That should give you so much to live for; to carry on and persevere knowing that He’s watching over you always!

Whatever you do, don’t fall into this trap. Don’t try to paint an awful picture of someone else in order to paint a perfect picture of yourself. It will come back to haunt you and it won’t be a beautiful sight. Remember, what goes around comes around. Take heed!

Almighty. On this blessed day, remove our attachment to worldly things. Instead, make our hearts attached to You & make us love You more. Keep our hearts pure & always obedient in Your Path, no matter what’s going on in our lives. It’s the only way to have peace in our hearts.

One of the biggest flaws in humans is pretending to be blind to their own shortcomings but they’re the first to jump down someone's throat when others make a mistake. Learn to be more self-critical instead of pointing fingers. Leave the judging to the fairest Judge of all!

Don’t give up when you encounter the slightest problem. True determination is not for the faint-hearted. It is an invisible strength of endurance that allows you stay in an uncomfortable place. Work hard at whatever you want to achieve. Above all, seek the Almighty’s help!

Some love being controversial & argumentative just to get recognition in life. They love making headlines & being in the limelight. Be careful. Think of the consequences when you’re alone in your grave or worse having to defend yourself before your Creator on Judgement Day!

It is human nature to always want the best ‘view’ when we’re in a beautiful place. That’s what we’ll have in Paradise. Sadly, many of us have become distracted &. absorbed by this temporary world & forgotten our purpose & goals for our Hereafter. Strive to get back on track!

The trouble with this life is we have so many conveniences at our fingertips. It’s a life of instant gratification. Always remember that with the Almighty, things work according to His time. So be patient and persevere just because it’s taking a lot longer than you expected.

Embrace the pain in your life. It’s a necessary part of your growth. It strengthens you. It deepens your faith. It brings you closer to the Almighty. It builds character. It teaches you to worship instead of worry. It’s never easy but the rewards are great. Bear patience!

They say old habits die hard. Do not go back to your old ways, no matter what you’re experiencing in life. Toxic habits, negative people & negative energy always tend to come back when you are doing better in life. Satan will see to that. Don’t fall into the trap. Stay focused!

Be wary of those who lie to make themselves feel good. They have an ego problem. They discredit others out of jealousy, always wanting to be one up & to show the world that they’re the good ones. It won’t last. The truth will out. It will lead to their own downfall eventually!

Life is full of trickery & distractions. It will tempt us in more ways than one. It’s inevitable. Because we live in a world that’s filled to the brim with temptations & addictions that are intended to lead us far away from the Almighty. Be disciplined enough to resist it!

It’s a common misconception among many who think they need to turn their lives around before they can start praying and getting closer to the Almighty. Know that this is a trick of Satan. Don’t fall for it. No matter what’s going on in your life, pray! He’s waiting for you.

When you stop worrying about who likes you and who doesn't, that's the start of something good. You want to be respected for who you are. Don't worry about what others think. Don’t worry about impressing people. Live to please the Almighty. Your reward is with Him!
"You're judged by how you treat others. So work on it." #muftimenk #motivationalmoments #muslimcentral #respectall #BuildingBridges #lovepreacher https://t.co/DvHA6cHp53

Pray for those you love. Pray for those who hate you. Pray for those who try to harm you. Why? Because prayer is the most precious gift you can give someone and a good prayer may soften their heart and lead them to be guided. Imagine the rewards that await you! Keep praying!

Almighty. On this blessed day, help us become better people today than we were yesterday. Help us win the fight between desire & discipline so we may get closer to You. Help us let go of negative people so we may grow into positive, grateful people with good character & conduct

Stay away from those who constantly ask and gossip about others as well as those who love to discuss people's flaws. These are traits disliked greatly by the Almighty. Try advising such people privately and show them more meaningful activities. Remember, choose friends wisely!

Be kind to people. Never think you're better than others. The trouble with those who appear pious is that they think they’re on a higher level & scoff at everyone else who may seem less pious! It’s a terrible trait to have. Don’t be hard on others. Piety comes with gentleness.

It’s easy to wallow in self pity and look at everything that’s wrong in your life. Try this instead. Pray to the Almighty for a fresh start in any area of your life. Let go of that which is bad for your heart. Start anew. Receive the blessings!

Your journey will often be distracted by people’s opinions. Don’t let it consume you. Be honest with yourself. Purify your intention. It makes it easier for you to handle what others think. Besides, it’s not your reputation the Almighty is after. He looks at your heart!

Remember that sinning is a choice. You have been given the faculty to tell right from wrong. So use that choice for your own good.  Each time you’re tempted to do wrong but choose to do the right thing, you grow. That’s how you develop a closer link with the Almighty.

Well done young Zayd Menk for making it to the Great Big Story! Absolutely awesome! Proud of you! 

https://t.co/PjuS3D1yhC

#9000thTweet #zaydmenk #menk #greatbigstory #Alhamdulillah

In our bid to solve problems, we sometimes create even bigger problems. Repairing a burst pipe requires glue. Using a drill will destroy whatever remains of the pipe. Be wary. In a fit of rage, we may cause greater loss to ourselves instead of resolving the issue we’re facing.
