Each day that you spend with negative thoughts, crying over what others may have done to you, feeling hopeless and that life is meaningless, is a day wasted. Pick yourself up. Learn to energise yourself. Be positive. Be strong. Be hopeful. Don’t give up on life!

You may wake today thinking it’s going to be the most difficult day to get through. But the Almighty knows you’ll get by just fine. The pain will ease and the hurt will pass. It’s because nothing lasts in this world. He has promised better days ahead.

Your heart is the most important organ in your body. Guard it with your life. Don’t give it to just anyone. Protect it from hatred, jealousy etc. Nurture it. Imbibe it with what’s good. Your heart will get what it prays for. Don’t think the Almighty is not aware of your heart!

It's wrong to think that your life means nothing. The Almighty has created you for a reason and instead of thinking bad and low about yourself, you must strive towards finding your purpose and why He has created you. Be confident but don’t let it turn into arrogance and pride!

If you’re tempted to share something on social media, investigate before you do. Anything you post comes from you, which means you’re responsible for it’s accuracy, even if you got it from somewhere else. Things can come back to haunt you in the most unimaginable way. Be wary.

You've got to be patient in this journey called LIFE. It will make you, it will break you. You’ll meet people along the way who will render help & those who will leave you by the wayside. But if you keep asking the One who made you, He will never disappoint. So never stop asking!

Whatever you do, always have the right intention. Do it solely for the sake of the Almighty and watch how He opens doors you could never have imagined before. Remember, He can make the impossible, possible. Miracles do happen. Trust Him!

Beware the toxic "friends" who will never compliment you. They'll never have a good word or congratulate you on your achievements. In fact, they're much more likely to kick you when you're down. It’s always about them. They’ll drain you of all your energy! Keep your distance!

We often hear people cursing their fate, wondering why it’s always them who have to suffer. Why is the Almighty always testing me? Why is He rewarding those who sin with more wealth? The truth is each one of us is tested differently. He knows what He’s doing. Press on!

All the wealth you painstakingly amass will remain here. You won’t be able to take one single thing with you. Always remember this. What are you gaining really, and at what price? Are you sacrificing your Hereafter for some glitz & glamour of this world that many call luxury?

"Make a sentence with sugar in it!"

loooooooool

#reallyfunny #eastlondonmosque #thebestofpeople #respectall #BuildingBridges #muftimenk #motivationalmoments #alisharah https://t.co/uhuqws8U8a

Money is important, for sure. But you don’t have to go crazy over it. The Almighty has written it down for you, there is no need for you to lie, cheat, deceive, resort to fraud practices, abuse the rights of others just to make some extra bucks. Greed doesn’t pay!

Don't be frustrated. Be patient instead; with the Almighty and with yourself. Don’t be in such a rush. We often expect His schedule to be the same as ours! It rarely works that way. We’re in a hurry. He’s not. Remember, He’s always on time. Not a moment earlier or later!

Almighty. On this blessed day, we pray that You keep us on the straight path.  Protect us from being misled from all the lies and trickery of this world. Show us the truth as truth and allow us to follow it; and show us the wrong as wrong and allow us to avoid it! Aameen

If you want something, you can’t just sit back & do nothing; you have got to work for it. When you have put in effort, exhausted your brains on how to tackle a certain problem, then rely on the Almighty for the results. If it’s meant for you, it’ll be yours!

People ask why do bad things happen to good people while all that’s good goes to the bad ones? If you dig deeper, you’ll realize that whatever happens in your life is according to the Almighty’s plan. It’ll always work out for you, be it in this world or the next! Be patient!

There will be temptations in life. But keep your heart firm on what is favoured by the Almighty. Keep yourself away from His displeasure.  He is the Provider. If you remain firm in faith, following His way, He will provide for you from sources you wouldn’t even imagine existed!

Those you do good to will not only forget what you’ve done but many of them will go out of their way to harm you at some stage. It's the Almighty’s way of testing whether you were kind to them for His Pleasure or for your benefit.

Many people crop, tweak, add filters & manipulate their images to present an impression of how they want to be perceived. Separating reality from the online image can be tough. Often, young people end up looking harshly at themselves as a result. They think they’re failures!
Why do we lie? Is it because we’re afraid of displeasing people? Or do we lie in order to appear to be better than we really are? Examine the heart. Whatever the reason, work on it!
The Almighty will give you what you need to get through every difficulty. You just have to lay your trust in Him. Pray for the best solution and the Best Planner will show you the way out!

There is a huge pull on you to conform to the ways of the world. You’ve got to stand strong and firm. Rise above that which is prohibited by the Almighty. Rise above the darkness! Don’t give in. The choice is yours.

The trouble with most people is that they call on the Almighty only after they’ve called everybody else; this is the wrong order. He’s your Creator. He knows you better than anyone else. He knows about your problem before anyone did. So let’s change the order & seek Him first.

The better you are, the more successful you become, the bigger you get, the more you’ll be criticized or just have nasty things said about you or even to you; anonymously online. It usually stems from jealousy. Don’t waste time responding!

Train yourself to remain polite even in the most difficult situation. Stand your ground firmly but politely. Let them curse & swear. Choose to rise above cheap, verbal abuse which is widespread today. Sooner or later they’ll realize their mistake & how offensive they were!

Everyone wants to succeed in life but only a few will be truly happy for your success. The truth is, people will generally only support your goals and dreams until you make it & end up doing more than them. Sadly, they want to see you do good, but never better than them!

Don't be fooled and let the world tell you that when you win, you show immense strength. No. Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. The more you’ve gone through hardship and trials, the stronger you become!

When you’re set on revenge and want to pay someone back, bear in mind that your actions will hurt you, not them. Learn to rise above it all. Revenge may give you a temporary high but it’s not worth it in the long term because you’re made for bigger and better things!

When you go through a difficult situation, be it the inevitable death of a loved one, the loss of a job or a mild health problem, take a deep breath and remember, nothing lasts. The Almighty won’t burden you beyond your capabilities. He’s the Only Source of Strength. Trust Him!

Almighty. On this blessed day, purify our hearts so that we don’t end up being people pleasers. Help us to realise that our original intent of doing things is to please You; not the rest of the people. Keep us focused so we don’t end up neglecting our duties towards You!

Hiding pain under a smile is not easy. It can be one of the hardest things to do. You do it when you care about others more than you do for yourself. But remember, a smile can hide so much.. fear, pain, sadness, tears. But they reflect one main thing. Strength!

Don't live in regret. The past is over. Today is a new day; you are not the same person you were before. Believe that today will be better than yesterday. It’s about looking up with hope and looking forward. Look for new opportunities that the Almighty  has planned for you.

Remind yourself that the Almighty doesn't just tell you to do something; He guides you through it. Part of it includes getting you to be in the right place at the right time. He puts different people in your life at different times. You just have to surrender and trust Him.

Be careful when choosing the kind of people you want to surround yourself with. The ones you trust the most may actually be trying to bring you down. Remember,  the saddest thing about being betrayed is that it doesn’t usually come from your enemy!

Don't let people manipulate your mind, feelings and emotions or control how you think about yourself. No one should be allowed to do that. Your thoughts are your own. It’s the most powerful thing  you have. Never give that power to someone else!

Instead of crying over missed opportunities, closed doors and detours, pause and think. It’s the Almighty’s way of protecting us from the pain and anguish not meant for us. Had He allowed it, we would have been left broken and in total despair!

It is no secret that even the strongest person gets tired at times. But that’s where patience, prayer & positivity play a big role. Without any of that, you’d probably have called it quits. Keep your strength & hope in the Almighty. He will reward those with beautiful patience!

We are an impatient lot. We stress ourselves out wondering when and how our goals will come together. The truth is, it’s of no use because only the Almighty knows when it’s the right time for everything to fall into place. So quit worrying and simply trust Him!

Everything in the heavens and on the earth belongs to the Almighty. So why do we feel a sense of superiority? May He remove arrogance from our hearts and teach us to be humble, always remembering Him in all that we do!

We all make mistakes. Don’t give up just because you made a mistake. The Almighty knew the mistake way before it ever happened. Instead of feeling miserable and depressed, pray. Ask Him to ease your affairs. Stop focusing on the past and keep moving forward.

Train yourself not to stress over negative comments made about you on social media. In fact, don't respond. People hide behind their screens to release their frustrations. Their mean words & baseless allegations say more about them than anyone else. Don't lose sleep over them.

The real test of sincerity is to see whether a person will help you even if he knows he will get nothing in return from you. The truth is anyone can help when there’s something to gain in return; but to help when there’s nothing to be gained shows true love & a beautiful heart!

We’ve all felt like a failure at times. But don’t drown in that feeling. Remember, the battles you’ve won, the setbacks you’ve overcome, the trials you’ve gone through. The Almighty promised that nothing would last. Keep hope alive & carry on. He’s always watching over you!

Each time we're hurt, we tend to blame others. It's always someone else's fault. Don’t fall into that trap. Learn to be accountable. Take charge of your life and your own shortcomings. The Almighty knows the truth. Don't play the blame game.

Pray for those who are struggling with difficulties that no one knows about. They hide it from the world, always smiling and people think they're actually happy. Only their faith in the Almighty keeps them going. May the Almighty grant them a way out!

I would like to congratulate His Excellency @edmnangagwa on his recent victory. We pray for harmony, stability and peace which will bring about the recovery and growth that we so desperately need in this wonderful country. All the best Cde President!

Almighty. On this blessed day, make us steadfast in our prayers & acts of worship done solely for You. Grant us humility & submission always, never showing off or feeling that we’re more pious than the person next to us! Protect us from being arrogant & never to judge others!

Be careful how you react to those who’ve wronged you. Two wrongs do not make a right. You can’t be mean, angry or bitter & expect good in return. Don’t wrong others the way they’ve wronged you. Be the better, kinder person always. Your reward is with the Almighty!

Some people will go out of their way to lie like it’s the only truth. They mislead the unsuspecting without batting an eyelid. Be careful of fake news, false information & lies disguised as the truth. Always verify important information. Don’t believe everything you hear or read!

Learn to walk away from people and situations that threaten your peace of mind, self-respect, values, morals or self worth. Don’t argue with them. Don’t get into a debate with them. It’s not worth your effort. It’s also a sign of maturity.

Beware the one who doesn’t retaliate when you wrong him. Instead, he raises his hands to the heavens and seeks help from the Lord of the Worlds; the most powerful! Be careful not to hurt others. If you do, quickly seek forgiveness.

Wishing you a Blessed Eid-ul Adha. Eid of the Sacrifice of Prophet Abraham pbuh. Spare a thought for the less fortunate as you celebrate with family and loved ones! 
#EidMubarak #SelamatHariRayaKorban

We don't need to celebrate #Eid on the same day to show unity. Unity is achieved by respecting the differences we have & celebrating them. Don’t fling insults & verbal abuse at those you disagree with. Show restraint & tolerance. That will bring about true unity. #LoveYouAll

This life is short. 
Make it a point to touch lives and hearts whenever you get the opportunity. Give, forgive and  apologise. If you find difficulty doing it, make a commitment and start on this day of Eid. Channel your energy to things that matter. #EidAlAdha

No matter what difficulties you’re facing, know that the Almighty has your back. He’s there even when things seem hopeless. He’s there even when the circumstances are darker than you ever imagined. He's there when everyone has given up on you. Place your trust in Him.
Almighty. As the pilgrims gather in #Arafah on this Great Day of #Hajj, we pray that You grant them ease & accept their acts of worship. May it be a day of total forgiveness for all. Aameen.

What do we lack in life? We have practically all the basic necessities and more. Sadly, most of us tend to look at the few things we don't have & become depressed & despondent. Be careful because the Almighty doesn’t like ingratitude. He can take away anything, anytime...

Some people firmly believe that we must not show kindness towards those of other faiths. This is a serious misconception. Treat all humans fairly. It is our duty to do so. May our actions always be in line with whatever pleases the Almighty!

Everything is the way it is for a reason. You’ve got to believe it. You’ve got to trust the Almighty’s plan for you. Whatever’s going on in your life, the journey continues. Nothing comes to a standstill. Have faith that it will all work out in the end!

The truth is we’re becoming dissatisfied with what we have, what we see and do because, as soon as we go online, we see someone who has achieved, seen or done something better. Or at least, that’s how they’ve made it look. Don’t let social media ruin your life!

Don't bother with negative comments, insults & harsh words others throw at you. Nobody knows you better than the Almighty. It’s your Creator you should be trying to please. Let Him be the judge. It doesn’t matter if you’re not everyone’s cup of tea. Some prefer other beverages.

At some stage, the Almighty closes doors because it’s time to move on. The trouble is we may not see this. He knows what He’s doing. He also knows that you won’t move unlesss He creates some discomfort for you! Change is never easy! Trust Him.

Don't waste time engaging in sin. You have the chance to start anew every day when the Almighty returns your soul to you after sleep. It’s up to you to decide today how you want to live your life; in His pleasure or displeasure. You have a duty to fulfil. Make it a good one!

On this blessed day, may the Almighty grant ease to the people of #Kerala who are experiencing massive flooding, apparently the worst in living memory. May He protect their lives and keep their homes safe from further damage. Aameen

Look back on your life & think; did the Almighty not bring you through some tough times? Those difficult days you never thought you would emerge from and see the light? Not only did He get you through them, He also taught you how to do better the next time; so stop worrying!

The trouble with us today is we love to pick on people, jump on their failures & criticize their faults. We do it with such passion like it’s a natural pastime. Bear in mind that it could all come back to us at any time. What goes around, comes around.

Whenever you start thinking you’re such a big deal, you’ve arrived in life, you’re more superior than the next person, think of this... you’re truly nothing but a share of this earth! Humble yourself always!

Thank the Almighty for all the times He allowed you to learn things the hard way, only to remind you that He will always be the answer you need. There’s no reason to complain, whinge or whine to others about what you’re going through. Confide in Him!

Before you start commenting on whatever someone may be going through, have the sense to put yourself in that person’s shoes. Empathy is key. Be aware, be sensitive to others’ feelings, needs and concerns. Remember, life is not always about me, myself and I.

Much of our frustration, anxiety, worry & depression comes from the fact that we try to control things we simply cannot control. Have faith that it will work out, yes, but don’t force it to happen the way you see it happening. It will happen when the Almighty says it’ll happen.

We are all broken in some ways. Bring your wounded heart to the Almighty. He will restore you. There are many people who are suffering from things they can't tell anybody, but you can cry out to Him, and talk to Him about everything. He knows you, and He cares about you.

Being kind to family members is a good thing. But at the same time, we need to take care of ourselves so that we can have a healthy mindset in the long run. If your mental health is suffering from the effects of toxic family members, you should protect yourself from harm.

Sometimes, we don’t realize that we’re praying for a situation that is far worse for us than what we are in at the moment. So the Almighty, through His Mercy, keeps it away from us & we keep thinking our prayers are not answered! Remember, His favours are countless!

Never tire of doing good. People will take you for granted after a while. They’ll forget to thank you and acknowledge you. It will hurt but remember that at the end of the day, your reward is with the Almighty and no one else. That thought alone should keep going!

We all make mistakes. Everyone of us. No exception. The Almighty has planned it in great detail. Sometimes it takes a very big mistake we make in life to transform us into the best of people. So learn to take mistakes in your stride because it’s not the end of the world.

Do you have such friends; honest, sincere people who don't pretend to be perfect. They’re not harsh or judgemental. They will stand up for you behind your back and won’t backstab. They're not so common but they exist. You’re blessed if you have them in your life!

You don’t meet people by accident. The Almighty puts different people at different times in our lives for a reason. Sooner or later you’ll find out why they were a part of your life. Some will stay, some won’t. Some will strengthen you, others will test you. That’s His Plan!

It's easy to wallow in self pity and look at everything that’s wrong in your life. Try this instead. Pray to the Almighty for a  fresh start in any area of your life. Let go of the old and that which is bad for your heart. Start anew. Receive the blessings He has prepared!

Remember if you don’t nurture your faith, it will slowly weaken and leave you grappling with doubt. Satan will jump in at the slightest opportunity & create havoc in your minds, leaving you heedless. So protect yourselves before your hearts harden.

Your journey will often be distracted by people’s opinions. Don’t let it consume you. Be honest with yourself. Purify your intention. It makes it easier for you to handle what others think. Besides, it’s not your reputation the Almighty is after. He looks at your integrity.

Learn to distinguish truth from tale. It’s a must to verify important news and information thoroughly because people lie to get ahead in life. They don't care if you suffer as a result of their mind games. Don’t fall into their trap & end up regretting it. Be alert!

Never forget that the Almighty is more merciful to you than you are to yourself. Stop beating yourself up over past mistakes which you can’t change. Instead, focus on your future because no matter how badly you’ve messed up, it’s your end that matters!

On this blessed day, may you get what you have been praying for. May all your supplications be answered. May every tear that has fallen down your cheek because of worldly disappointments be equivalent to the best rewards in Paradise. Aameen.

When we don’t fully understand the attributes of the Almighty, that’s when we start feeling hopeless. Never forget He’s the Most Merciful, Most Forgiving. No sin is too great for Him. So never feel you’re not deserving of His Mercy. And don’t make others feel hopeless too!

Some people refuse to accept the fact that you’ve changed. They keep harping on the “old” you. They refuse to see you in a new light. They can’t stop talking about your past mistakes and wrongs. Ignore such people. Time to let them go!

Remember, people will only drive you crazy if you allow them to. So don't let your anger spin out of control. If someone is irritating you, recognise those feelings and then let them go without saying much or getting into conflict. You don’t need to respond to everything.

Delays, disappointment and detours are all part of the Almighty’s Plan. You have to understand that. Valuable lessons will be taught along the way. You should try to learn as many of them. Not only will you emerge stronger, you’ll also be grateful for all He’s put you through!

Life is such that you’ll keep facing trials and storms. Obstacles and hardship. There’s no running away from them. But don’t let all that affect your inner peace. Accept the Almighty’s Decree. Understand His Plan. He will keep you rooted and peace will prevail in your heart!

The Almighty knows the best solutions to our problems. We just need to pray more & seek His assistance and Him alone, not anyone else. Complaining to others & stressing over our problems will not solve it. Keep asking Him. He will respond!
#Earthquake in #Lombok #Indonesia. We feel your pain. We share your grief. We stand by you. May the Almighty protect you and grant you ease. Aameen

Unless you’re really close to someone, you can’t use their outward appearance to judge the reality of their life. People carefully select what they want to show you. Don’t be fooled because you don’t actually know what goes on behind closed doors in the lives of others!

Stop doubting how far you’ve come, regretting your choices & putting yourself down. Satan will make you think otherwise. His job is to make you miserable and depressed. Don’t cave in. Stand firm. Always encourage, support and believe in yourself. That’s the way forward!

Tell yourself often that things will work out in the end, no matter what’s happening now.  Always bear patience, trust that the Almighty knows what’s going on. Don’t let worry, fear and anxiety get the better of you. Ease will come, sooner rather than later!

The truth is nobody will truly understand what you’re going through except the Almighty. He’s the only One who knows your true circumstances and is always available when you need Him. He will heal you  and make you whole again!

Learn to rejoice and celebrate the victories of others. It will open doors of goodness in your own life in return. Be gracious enough to accord even your enemy their due place. Such positive actions will lift you up even during your worst days!

I would like to extend my congratulations to our President @edmnangagwa on his victory in the Zimbabwe Presidential Elections. May the Almighty guide you to do what’s best for the people. I wish you every  success in performing the important & responsible duties of this position.

Whenever a door closes in your life, the Almighty is trying to tell you to move on. Move forward. Don’t look back. He’s guiding your steps. You’ve got to trust Him. Change is never easy. The unknown can be unsettling. But He’s the Owner  of your sustenance; so why worry?

Almighty. On this blessed day, may we never forget that You’re the Turner of Hearts. You can heal us in a moment. You can forgive in an instant. You can make the impossible a reality! May we always be ever grateful for everything! Aameen.

Don't let people from your past carry on hurting you today. Let go of any grudges you hold against them in your heart. The past is the past. That part of your life is over. The best thing to do is pray, move on and leave the rest to the Almighty.

Many people have a habit of accusing others blindly. A blame without proof remains a mere blame. When there’s no concrete evidence, nothing carries weight. It remains a mere accusation. It doesn’t become fact! Don't be fooled.
Don’t draw your own conclusions when you’ve only heard half the story. Listen to the entire story in order to make an informed decision and fair judgement. Above all, be fair!

Violence is not the solution nor is it the way forward. Keep a level head when confronted with events that provoke you. Never retaliate because the result can be damaging, causing much regret. Above all, be mature over how you react to things. Let common sense rule.
Don't let your dislike for someone lead you to be unfair, unjust, vulgar and rude. Perhaps, the Almighty sees them as being better than you!
What we say about others says more about us, who we are and what we stand for. Be careful how you comment. Don’t be rude. Be civil. Be courteous. Be polite.

Never underestimate what the tongue can do. You may think it’s just a muscular organ in the mouth but life and death are in the power of the tongue. Words can be medicine or poison. They can heal or kill. Don’t misuse your tongue.

The truth is we’re always too busy speaking our mind that we forget to listen to what’s being said. One of the most sincere forms of respect is actually listening to someone else’s viewpoint. Try to be a good listener. Unlike your mouth, your ears will not get you in trouble.

Peaceful day in Zimbabwe. We continue to pray for goodness. Aameen #CastedMyVote #respectall #ZimbabweElections #ZimDecides2018 #ElectionsZW #ZimbabweDecides #ZimbabweDecides2018 #Zimbabwe #BuildingBridges #muftimenk https://t.co/YqktEBepET

The time will come when you look back in wonder at how everything has changed. Everything in place just the way you had imagined. Remember the Almighty’s promise? After hardship, there’ll be ease. Don’t forget to thank the Most Merciful.

No matter who emerges the winner in this election, we must all respect the outcome. We must do our best to uphold the values of peace & harmony, love & kindness. This is the only way forward and to ensure continued positive growth. #ZimbabweElections #ZimDecides2018 #ElectionsZW

This world is a taker. It will take as much as you can give. It will never tire of taking. The more you give, the more it wants. You’ll be left weary & depleted. That’s the nature of this world and what it stands for. Remember, givers must have boundaries because takers do not!

Almighty, as we go to the polls, guide us to make the wisest decisions. Grant us peace, stability, prosperity, goodness, love, kindness and respect. Bless us with whatever You know is best for us. Aameen #PrayForZimbabwe #ZimbabweElections

The bottom line is you really can’t count on people to motivate you and build you up in life. The truth is everyone is so caught up in  their own lives that they have little or no time for others. Learn to encourage yourself but don’t leave the Almighty out of the equation.

Keep going. No matter what you do, no matter how many times you mess up, no matter who says you can’t do it and there’s no point in carrying on, just carry on. Keep at it. Don’t quit. Remember, a month from now you’ll be that much closer to your goal!

How you live will determine how you respond to difficulties. When your heart is attached to this world, it will look for worldly means to relieve it from its problems. But when your heart is attached to the One who made it, you’ll turn to the Almighty in the first instance!

Almighty, we are attacked moment by moment with images on television, the internet, books and newspapers that leave us vulnerable to sin of every kind. Protect us from all things evil. Cleanse our hearts, & strengthen us so we’re able to face the Devil even better than before.

Almighty. Give us strength to overcome the difficulties that we’re facing now. Protect us against problems we may encounter in future. Bring us together as we’re meant to be. May the love that binds us grow stronger as we fulfil what You’ve laid out for us. Above all, forgive us!

Don't think your value is related to how much you have amassed. Never judge your self-worth by your net worth. You came into this world with nothing & you’re not taking anything material out of it. Life’s not about the wealth you’ve acquired. It’s about the bonds you’ve forged!

Stop thinking you’re a failure just because things are not going your way. Instead of worrying, pray. Turn to the Almighty & pour your heart out. Let Him know your concerns. Let Him give you a sense of purpose. He will steer your heart in the right direction. Trust Him.

Be patient with yourself. We've all been hurt & learnt painful lessons. But each time, we pick ourselves up & move on with quiet confidence. This is what beautiful patience is about. It doesn’t complain, knowing the Almighty’s in full control of everything. Relief will come soon!

Don't let your biggest enemy lie to you. Satan will trick you into believing that things aren’t going to change & that you’re doomed for life! That’s what He will keep replaying in your mind. Remember, no matter what you’re facing, in an instant, the Almighty can turn it around.

We hear this being said often enough. Life is not always fair. But bear in mind that the Almighty is always fair! He knows what He’s doing. All the pain, disappointments, tears, they won’t go to waste. He’s All Seeing. He will take everything into account and reward you.

Make someone happy today. Do a good deed. Be kind, even to a stranger. Spread goodness. Smile. Do whatever it takes. Just do it. Happiness never decreases by being shared. Let us spread it far and wide!

When you want something badly, confide in the Almighty. There’s no need to tell others about your plans. One of the best ways to do it is to talk to Him when the world sleeps; in the depths of the night, away from distractions of the waking hours. Ask from your heart. Sincerely.

I often wonder how people have the time to look for mistakes in others while overlooking their own flaws. They’re not bothered with correcting themselves. They engage in dissecting the faults of others to the smallest detail and feel quite content telling it freely to others!

When you do things purely for the Almighty, you’re driven by your heart. You don’t worry what others have to say.  It’s the complete opposite for the hypocrite who is driven to please others and what they’ll say. Keep your intentions pure and do things for the right reason.

A definite recipe for unhappiness is to listen to what others have to say about you. In fact, you can't be at peace till you learn to ignore the gossip and the unkind words hurled at you. If they have an agenda, nothing can stop them. The Almighty is on your side. Turn to Him.

It takes a mature person with a special heart to actually say that no matter how much someone hurts me, I'll still pray for him. It’s not easy. Most of us will actually do the reverse and start cursing & swearing the person when this happens. But such people do exist. Blessed!

Life is such that there’ll always be people who will misunderstand you and people who won’t like you. Don’t fret. Youre not in a popularity contest. Each time you’re criticised or put down, you can deal with it firmly but politely or leave it to the Almighty to defend you.

We do this without even thinking....we keep planning  and moving on in life, often never stopping to reflect on what we’re blessed with and how far we’ve come. We rush through life as if tomorrow is guaranteed. Learn to embrace life’s moments and thank the Almighty. Do it now!

The trouble with many is to turn to others at the first signs when things go wrong instead of confiding in the Almighty. We have to learn to trust Him. Trust when we’re in messy places, when we’re sure we’ve made mistakes. No one is going to lift you out of your woes but Him!

Problems come and go. Don’t let your problems take over your whole thought process. You have to consciously manage your thoughts and remind yourself that the Almighty is in control. He can change whatever He wills, whenever He wills. Put your trust in Him.

In a world that’s obsessed with physical beauty, always ask the Almighty to beautify and uplift our soul through consistent acts of worship and prayer. Remember, time will rob you of your outer beauty, no matter how hard you try to preserve it but a beautiful soul remains!

In the last seven months, our country #Zimbabwe, has seen positive change & growth. While we thank the Almighty for this, we must acknowledge the people He chose to deliver it to us. Thank you @edmnangagwa for your sincerity, honesty & integrity. You're an inspiration! #ED

Almighty. On this blessed day, protect us from sins of our own tongues. Make us stay away from gossip & uttering words that tarnish someone’s honour dignity & reputation. Distance us from those who love to indulge in such acts. Help us speak only good words or remain silent.

If you want something, knock on the Almighty’s door. If you want something badly, keep knocking, harder each time. Don’t let up. You’re not asking just anyone but the Lord of the Worlds. The Master of Miracles. He already knows what you want. He wants to see how sincere you are!

We live in such an impatient society. Everything has to be quick, instantaneous, fast, in a hurry. Sadly we also expect the same from the Almighty when we pray,  asking Him to fulfil our wishes. We forget that He has His own timing. So wait patiently!

Don't let this world blind you with selfish dreams and delusions in your heart. Know that none of that will last. It will only bring you darkness and pain in the end. Turn towards the Almighty and let Him guide you and light your way!

Remember everyone has untold stories of pain and struggle. There’s no exception. That’s what makes our lives different from one another. That’s why we need to be more understanding and compassionate towards others. Stop judging!

There's nothing perfect about this life. The mess you make, the delays, the things you don’t understand, they’re all part of the Almighty’s Plan for you. He’s worked out every bit of the puzzle. Your job is to bear good patience as you go through it. You’ll see the full picture!

Always be mindful. Although judgment is a natural instinct, check yourself before you speak, or send that nasty email and do any potential harm. You can’t undo what you’ve done. Pause. Try to see things from the other person’s point of view. Put yourself in their shoes!

Once you’ve built a good relationship with the Almighty, you’ll always be filled with hope and confidence. You’ll  always have good thoughts about Him. You’ll begin to realize that He is greater than any situation you will ever encounter.

When you feel stuck in any situation, be careful who you listen to in the midst of what you’re going through. There will be negative voices. The ones who will hurt you and would rather see you stay down. Remember, the Almighty won’t forsake you. No matter what others say.

When life gives you something that disturbs your peace and comfort, don’t be sad. Sometimes, curveballs are actually a blessing in disguise, even if it's hard for you to see that during times of uncertainty and change. Trust the Almighty. He’s working on something better!

Sometimes it’s necessary to distance yourself from certain distractions in your life to concentrate your time, energy and effort into things that matter the most. Don’t be afraid to do that. Your true friends will allow you that space and respect you. Go for it!

The truth is social media makes us impatient. It rushes us to want what someone else has, to be the person you see on your timeline, to live someone else’s life. Don’t let this happen. Learn to be content with what you have. Learn to appreciate the person that you are.

Senseless killings and acts of violence in #Pakistan #Palestine #Syria #Yemen #Iraq #Afghanistan #Kashmir & the likes must stop. Nothing can justify these horrific, inhuman acts. May the Almighty guide us all to peace, justice & respectful coexistence.

You're stronger than you think. You have cried, prayed, sacrificed, been through the storm and rain and had to endure so much to get to where you are! The Almighty knows how much you can handle. With each passing experience, you’ve moved one notch up! You’re blessed!

Don't try to figure it all out. You won’t be able to. You’ll end up confused and disappointed. Don’t overanalyze. You won’t be able to see the full puzzle. Do what you know the Almighty wants of you. The full puzzle will unravel sooner or later. Trust!

Don't just pray because you want the Almighty to give what you’ve asked for. Pray because you want to strengthen your relationship with Him. Pray so that when life gets hard, you’re more prepared to respond well because of your link with your Creator.

The amount of suffering going on around us has reached unprecedented levels.  It’s a fact that we are better off than so many people in the world. Yet we complain. Our struggles are small compared to others. Count our blessings before the Almighty takes everything away!

Many times you may feel that in your life, there is a lot of waiting. You wait for things to happen. In the process, you can either grow frustrated or you can grow in patience and strength. May the Almighty grant us the ability to wait patiently for what He has in store for us!

Has it occurred to you that each time you pray, it could be your last? So take your time and develop a no rush policy when praying to your Creator. May the Almighty be pleased with us and have Mercy on us all, the day He decides to take us.

What the Almighty has given, no one can take away. What He has denied, no one can give. You have to understand His Plan. You have to stop worrying unnecessarily about such things because it’s not within your control. So call out to Him and Him Alone!

Learn not to be affected by what others have to say about you. People will talk. You can’t control them. Take control of yourself instead. There’s only one version of you so be the best you can. The Almighty knows what lies in your heart. That's all that really matters.
Unfortunately #ItsNotComingHome...

When there’s no pain, there’s no gain. The truth is behind every successful person, there’s a painful story of grit, determination & the will to succeed. The painful story has a beautiful, successful end. Remember, the pain is part of the process. Embrace it. Success will follow!

Learn to look past the behavior of toxic and irritating people. The truth is they are hurting; that’s why they choose to hurt others. They are full of fear and insecurity. Ignore the hate that they spew. Respond with patience and love. Say a prayer for them.

We all cry. Yes, we do. Not just children, adults too. If we don’t do it openly, we cry deeply in our hearts. It provides a huge sense of relief. Often we try to be strong for those around us. But sometimes it gets overwhelming. So cry your heart out. You’re not alone!

Don't ever think that you’re stuck in any circumstance. Nothing is too difficult for the Almighty. Hold on fast to your faith. It’s a matter of time before you see the light at the end of the tunnel! The breakthrough will come!

It's a dangerous practice to overlook your small sins. You may think they’re small but to the Almighty, they’re massive. Like pebbles, sins do add up and soon turn into mountains. Imagine finding out on Judgement Day that you have several of these mountains. Be mindful!

Foolish is the one who chases fame. It's greed for attention. It won’t last. If addicted to it, you feel you’re always on display, you have to act differently to different people and can't be 'real'. You crave publicity and want your experiences to be  recognized by all.

It's never easy to hide pain under a smile. The truth is, it's very difficult. Only selfless people can do it. The ones who care about others more than they do themselves. So be kind to all around you, no one knows what inner turmoil each one is going through.

Remember that your character  should always be stronger than what you’re experiencing in life. We can’t always control what happens to us, but we can always control how we react and respond to it. Instead of complaining, choose to give thanks for all the good in your life!
Looks like #ItsComingHome ...

We've all had those days when nothing makes sense. That’s when you need to trust the Almighty even more. Build a strong foundation of trust and apply in all aspects of your life. It is a quality that will remain sufficient for you in matters of this life and the Hereafter.

Take the spite out of your heart. Purify it. Your heart is a small organ. When you fill it with hatred for someone, you’re preventing it from being filled with the love of the Almighty. Always ask Him to protect us from hearts that are consumed with hatred, envy and the like.

Just because someone smiles always doesn’t mean his life is perfect. It’s a sign of faith, hope and strength. It’s a sign that yes, nothing lasts and things will get better. The Almighty is with us every step of the way. Satan will make you doubt that. Don’t!

Just because you think you’re pious doesn’t give you the right to fall into the trap of being a harsh, judgemental and unforgiving person. Check yourself for these traits. While you ignore these sins which you’re committing, who knows if they’re working on those sins of theirs?

Almighty. On this blessed day, may we not see illness as a cause of despair. Help us to use the opportunity to turn to You for Mercy and Healing. We beseech You to remove the illness, cure the disease. You are the one who cures. There is no cure except Your cure.

We all struggle. Some of us more than others. There’s nothing wrong in admitting that we do. It makes us human. Life is not a walk in the park. Life is hard. It is also beautiful. You’ll feel happy and sad. Hurt and joy. Whatever you do, be real and keep friends who are real too!

The truth is people will scar you. Yes. Even loved ones. And when that happens, the wounds are among the deepest. Instead of hanging on to negative thoughts, think of the good they’ve done to you. It’s not easy. It needs a conscious effort. Ask the Almighty to help you let go!

When you can remain calm no matter what test the Almighty puts in your path, it shows that your  faith in Him is unshakeable. The peace you display shows that you acknowledge the fact that He is bigger than all your problems put together. You know He won’t let you down!

Do not borrow money or get a loan just so you can purchase luxuries to impress others. This is bad practice.  We should all live within our means. Always seek refuge from the Almighty from debt and related activities!

Always live in hope. Always believe that what lies ahead  of you is so much greater than what you’ve left behind. Think good of the Almighty and you’ll see positive things unravel before your eyes. He will show you things you’ve never imagined possible! He can and He will!

It's sad that many forget to count their blessings when we have such a Merciful Lord. He loves us unconditionally and is always waiting for those who’ve wronged themselves to turn back to Him. So no matter how far you think you’ve deviated from His Path, call out to Him.

Remember, you’re not adding any value today by worrying about tomorrow! Take it one step at a time, one day at a time. No one knows what tomorrow holds. Trust His Plans and don’t let worry rob you of the precious moments which will pass and never return!

When the Almighty takes something away from you, it’s because He has big plans for you. For some, giving them more blessings will distance them from Him. For others, hardships can distance them from Him. He knows best how you’ll react to every situation. So trust Him always!

Life is too short to waste in the company of those who can’t wait to put you down. Let them say what they want. Their opinions aren’t your problem. Keep doing good as you’ve always done. No matter what they do or say, don’t doubt your self worth!

Never be content with how pious you think you are compared to others. Never judge your journey too soon. The Controller of Hearts will test your faith again and again; whether your words match your action. Always ask the Almighty to keep your heart firm in faith.

Stop replaying the same old problems over and over again in your mind. The past is over. Nothing lasts. It’s time to stop beating yourself and move on. Repent, turn to the Almighty. He has forgiven you. You can’t change the past but you can pray for a better future!

The Sultan of Sokoto, His Eminence Al Haji Muhammad Sa'ad Abubakr III has hosted a special interactive session on Islam, Peaceful Coexistence and National Development in Sokoto, Nigeria. https://t.co/ojd6bM0gQ7

Satan will always fill your mind with doubts and negative thoughts. He will try to disqualify you and tell you that you’re not up to the mark. But the truth is the Almighty is always on your side, guiding & steering you. Remember you have what it takes. He is sufficient for you!

Don't let your dislike or hatred of someone lead you to be unfair, unkind or unjust towards him. Be careful what you say about those you dislike. Display the best character to save yourself from the consequences. Remember, what goes around comes around.

@RehamKhan1 I only noticed this "medical" humour because it was MY photo that the sister superimposed herself on to. I had no clue who she was until a few hours ago. So I responded with similar humour... lol
@RehamKhan1 I've never visited Pakistan and I don't follow it's politics but one thing I know is ilea laser clinic in Rondebosch CapeTown can sort out your issue...

Don't belittle the efforts of anyone who’s trying to get close to the Almighty. Just because someone is not on the same level of god consciousness by your standard, doesn’t mean that he’s bad or not worthy of help. Only the Almighty knows what’s in the heart of each one of us!

Don't get frustrated if your journey back to the Almighty is a long one. Be true to yourself. It takes a lot of effort. Guidance is not a 100 metre race. It’s a marathon filled with ups and downs. Some days are better than others. But persevere & seek His help! You’ll get there.

We are busy planning our future so far ahead that we often forget it has already been planned for us by the Almighty. So do your best no matter what situation you're in. But don't be dissatisfied with what's going on because the Almighty is indeed the Best of Planners!

Almighty. On this blessed day, make us among those who, when we know the truth, we’ll follow it, and when we see falsehood, we’ll avoid it. We ask You to have Mercy on us, make things easy for us and help us to do the things that please You!

Abuse is totally unacceptable Abuse should never be allowed under any circumstance. It can never be justified. We must always stand up for what’s right. We must always defend and protect the victims at all cost. Remember, the Almighty is always with the righteous!

A good rule to live by - slow down when you’re angry. Slow down when you’re hurt. These are times when you’re most likely to say mean and hurtful things if you let your emotions get the better of you. So save yourself a lot of pain and heartache with this simple rule.

The Almighty’s timing is always perfect! You want to rush things to suit your timing but things may fall apart because you don’t know what He knows. Remember, His timing may differ from yours. It may not make sense but when you look back, you’ll see how He planned it so well!

Society teaches our women how their bodies have to look a certain way to become acceptable & their skin has to be a certain complexion. We forget that the Almighty has made us in the best way. All He wants is a beautiful heart! And we’re so busy beautifying everything else!

Don't sweep things under the carpet. Address problems head on. Because if we don’t, it will fester and get worse. Soon we will face an even bigger problem. We are not immune to issues facing society in general. The sooner we realise this, the faster we can work towards change!

Don't marry someone with the intention of changing them, or trying to fix their bad ways. You might just end up disappointed and messing up your marriage. Marry someone who shares your views on building a home together, based on fundamentals set out by the Almighty!

Remember, Satan always wants us to feel despair. The Almighty doesn’t. He knows we are weak. That’s why if we show Him that we’re sincere in our efforts to get close to Him, He will show us the way back and He will surely forgive us. He is the Most Merciful!

When you see a family member, a friend or someone you know make a mistake, correct him, guide him to do what’s right and pray for him. Do this in a gentle manner. Don’t mock and insult him, making it easier for Satan to mess his mind even more!

Remember, the Almighty does not expect us to have all the answers. He knows, as humans, our knowledge is limited. He expects us to have unwavering faith in Him; knowing that He is always there and that He rewards those who seek Him.

Some will continue to hate you for no apparent reason. Instead of constructive criticism, they’re out to destroy people with their comments. Show them you’re happy with who you are by doing more of what they hate. Show them that you’re not affected by their immaturity!

Stay clear of the herd mentality. Why should you do it just because everyone else is doing it? There’s no need to fit in. Let society say you’re the odd one out. Remember, at the end of the day, it’s better to walk alone than with a crowd headed in the wrong direction!

Fear, insecurity & doubt will continue to plague you as long as you listen to the whisperings of Satan & all that society tells you. That’s what this world does! Courage and confidence can only come when your heart is attached to the Almighty. He will strengthen your spirit!

Not everyone would like you to succeed. Some may throw dirt in your path. That’s to be expected.  Don’t worry. Brush it off, shake it off. Get up again. That’s the mark of a true champion. Ignore the naysayers. Keep moving forward. You’ll get there.

I strongly condemn the #assassination attempt on our President #Mnangagwa today in #Zimbabwe. This is totally unacceptable. Perpetrators should face the full wrath of the law. May the Almighty grant him & the injured a speedy recovery. My condolences to those who’ve perished.

Being at peace is everything. It’s not just a feeling. It’s a way of life. It shows in everything that you do. It shows how close you are to the One who made you. It shows you’ve surrendered to the Almighty & accept everything that He has decreed. It’s the most powerful thing!

When something doesn’t feel right, don’t do it, leave it, walk away from it. Trust your judgement, your intuition, your feeling! It’s the Almighty’s way of guiding you and steering you away from what’s not right. You don’t owe anyone any explanation. Just do it.

Friday Sermon by Mufti Menk from Gatesville, CapeTown. Masjidul Quds earlier today.
https://t.co/CuqimasOz8

We may think what we’re facing is the worst ever. Sometimes our world can feel as if it's crumbling when we stay close minded. But if we expand our thinking and remember that nobody has a  perfect life, we’ll be ok. Don’t forget there’s always something to be thankful for!

Almighty. On this blessed day, we ask for strength as we feel weak and tired from the affairs of the world. Help us to carry on in the face of adversity and whatever trials You’ll put our way. It’s not easy. Grant us patience & help us go through it with full faith & confidence.

The choice is yours.. how you react to what life throws at you. You know you’ll be tested so what do you do? Get angry, stressed out & sink into depression or you can respond with beautiful patience; knowing the Almighty will fight your battles when you put full faith in Him!

You're going through problem after problem. You keep asking the Almighty. Nothing happens. You’re facing depression, sickness, financial issues, marital problems. Why is He taking so long to respond? He’s aware! He’s setting you up for something big. You have to trust Him.

Your faith will be tested again and again. It’s easy to believe when things are going your way, when the path is rosy. But the true test comes when the Almighy puts obstacles in your way. Do you become disobedient & defiant or do you submit to Him, be patient and ride it out?

Notice that those who are doing good work usually work in silence, often ignoring the noise made by others. The drama, the haters and the negativity will always be there. Ignore all of that. Let your success speak for itself.

Don't have too many friends. Your inner circle should be people who remind you of the Almighty and who draw you closer towards Him. Remember, it’s not the number of friends but the quality of such people that matters. Be discerning in your choice of friends!

Every new day you wake up to, rid your heart of all worry, guilt and bitterness. Do this daily. You’ll find you have more energy and positivity in your life. You’ll have more time to do what you’re supposed to be doing. Keep your focus.

Change is hard. Even when you want it to happen. But if you’re  serious about wanting to make your life better, change is what you need to embrace. You’re never alone. Seek the Almighty for strength and comfort because It requires more energy than you think. Be sincere. He knows!
😍😍For those who missed the fun of #EidinthePark here is a short video that will bring a smile to your heart 😍😍 https://t.co/t1SfOnQw5G

Don't feel like you have to be strong all the time. You’re allowed to be overwhelmed, be sad, cry, fall down and get back up again. You’re human. The most important thing is not to lose your link with your Maker. He has a reason for everything. You’ll emerge much stronger!

Train yourself not to take revenge when someone does something bad to you. Whenever someone hurts you or is unjust towards you, know that the Almighty is aware of all that’s going on. Never doubt that He will mete out justice when the time is right!

It may seem hard to make that first step towards change. Your heart is heavy. You see yourself sliding deeper and deeper into sin. But once you decide to turn to the Almighty, feel the weight lighten and your heart lifted. His Mercy will radiate through every part of your soul!

Why do we often worry that someone else will get what’s meant for us? It won’t happen. The Almighty knows what He’s doing. No one can take away what’s meant for the other person. Remember, He can open doors which no man can shut!

Not everyone would like you to succeed. Some may throw dirt in your path. That’s to be expected.  Don’t worry. Brush it off, shake it off. Get up again. That’s the mark of a true champion. Ignore the naysayers. Keep moving forward. You’ll get there.

We spend half our lives trying to figure others out & almost the other half judging their behaviours as if we don’t have enough on our plates already. Remember, everyone has untold stories of pain & struggle. So stop judging and be more understanding.
Footage of the historic #Eid Prayers in #London shows the largest turnout in the city. #EidinthePark2018 #muftimenk #Subhaanallah #SimplyAmazing https://t.co/Wok5ysP4aA

You can’t be truly happy till you learn to ignore the gossip, empty chatter and unkind words hurled at you. Remember that empty vessels make loud noises. Learn to disregard the noise and attach your heart to the One who controls it. You’ll be in a happy state.

Wishing you and your loved ones a blessed and joyous #Eid.  As you celebrate with your loved ones, do remember the less fortunate across the globe; the suffering, the oppressed and needy. May the Almighty comfort them and ease their woes. https://t.co/lBp6CIJRVq

Almighty. On this blessed day, we ask You to make it easy for us to do good and help us avoid the bad in all situations. Grant us success in this life and the next. Bless us all, guide us, and unite our hearts. Make us among those who put their full trust in You for everything!

Wishing you & your loved ones a blessed and joyous #EidulFitr. As you celebrate with your loved ones, do remember the less fortunate across the globe; the suffering, the oppressed. May the Almighty comfort them and ease their woes.

I am shocked and deeply saddened by the #MalmesburyMosqueAttack in the Western Cape. It is totally unacceptable. No matter what our differences, violence is never an option. In fact, we should also refrain from verbal abuse and insults, as they too lead to violence.

Selamat Hari Raya
Ma’af Zahir Batin
Ikhlas dari Mufti Menk

The last days of #Ramadan are the most significant. Now is the time to ask Him for all your needs, anything and everything. Nothing is too big or too small for the Lord of the Worlds. The Almighty never tires!

Remember on Judgement Day, the Almighty will weigh your deeds & not count them. He’s not interested in the numbers. He looks at how much heart was in what was done. Who went out of their way to do it solely for Him and who did it to show off?

Almighty. As #Ramadan is about to end, we ask You to keep us steadfast and to carry on worshipping You with the vigour we showed in the blessed month. Choose for us what’s best. Help us succeed in this life and the hereafter. Almighty,  forgive us and grant us Paradise.

Those who succeed eventually are the ones who don’t get discouraged when things don’t work out initially.  They know the Almighty’s in control. They don’t allow a setback to bother them. They trust that it’s His way of setting them up for something bigger and better!

Don't take anything for granted because you never know when you'll have it for the last time. Life is a precious gift, cherish every moment. It’s truly such a blessing to be alive and to be able to impact so many lives. You’ll never know whose life you’re touching.

If you don’t want to be disappointed, keep this in mind. Be prepared to have the most unexpected people let you down. It’s bound to happen at some stage. Amid all this, be yourself and spread goodness as much as possible but don’t expect goodness from everyone.

It's a fact that some people just won’t like you or appreciate you. That’s okay. You don’t need people’s approval to fulfill what the Almighty has decreed for you. His approval is all you need in this life and you’ll know it in your heart because it feels right!

Always remind yourself that everything in this world is temporary. People come & go. Feelings change constantly. Places don’t last. Here today, gone tomorrow. Attach your heart to the One who gives everlasting peace! Only the Almighty is a constant in this temporary life.

Marriage is a lot about give and take and sacrifice. It will fail if you start competing with your spouse. It’s not about who’s the stronger person. It’s about who’s willing to compromise and do more to make the other happy. Remember, it’s the little things that go a long way.

Take time off your busy schedule often & reflect on your life. It’s so easy to get caught up in this worldly web that we often forget where we’re headed. Learn to see the wisdom behind every pain & struggle life has thrown at you. There’s no need to be bitter and revengeful.

How can we possibly give up hope in the Almighty’s Mercy? In fact, to give up hope is an insult to Him of the highest magnitude. He has more Mercy than all of the creation combined and it will not diminish His Mercy if He shows it to the entire creation.

Nobody said this life would be easy. There are many pitfalls along the way. But no matter how many times you fall and what you go through, you can count on the Almighty to get you back up, if you only turn to Him. He’s only a call away; waiting to hear from you!

Almighty. On this blessed day, accept the deeds that we do solely for Your Sake. We are trying our best. We’re not perfect and often we falter and make mistakes. Forgive us. We will never lose hope in Your Mercy and will always keep our hearts attached to Your words!

Those whose hearts are attached to the Almighty don’t waste time looking at what everybody else is doing, what others have & what’s going on in their lives. Such people mind their own business. They’re too busy focusing on what He has put in their lives to bother with others.

Make a commitment to start a new beginning when #Ramadan ends. Give up at least one bad habit in this blessed month. Do it solely for the Almighty. All the good we have done should not come to an end with the end of the month. Hold on to them and start anew!

You see a huge obstacle in front of you but you forget that the greater the trial, the bigger the reward. Don’t be discouraged by what you see. The Almighty won’t test you beyond your capabilities. Stay firm. Out of your struggles, your faith will emerge stronger than before!

Remain polite at all times. Even if you disagree with someone, there are ways to do it respectfully. There’s no need to resort to name calling, cursing, abusive and foul language. There’s no justification to mock and insult others. Remember, leave the judging to the Almighty.

The Almighty may seem to have closed certain doors in your life but in actual fact, He’s waiting to see how persistent you are and how much you want that something. Perhaps a push in the form of a supplication might just open it! Be sincere in your intent. Try it!

In the blink of an eye, we’re already in the last ten nights of #Ramadan. Thank the Almighty for them. May He grant us choicest blessings as we humble ourselves in prayer for His sake. Remember, no one is guaranteed the end of this #Ramadan or even the next, so give it your all!

When you feel sad after you’ve sinned or done wrong, be happy because your heart is not dead. It’s a gift from the Almighty to be able to tell right from wrong. Beware the dead heart that is numb; it keeps sinning repeatedly and doesn’t feel an iota of guilt!

You have a choice. You can either stress over what you’re going through or you can do your best given the circumstances and pray for the best outcome. What’s done is done. Pray about it. You don’t know what the future holds, pray for it. Whatever your situation, pray!

Look at those who have less than you in worldly matters. Don’t look at those who have more than you. Only then will you be grateful. Remember, the more you complain about things, the harder things will be for you. Learn to look for the positive in every negative!
If you want to change, start by setting small goals from today. Change won’t happen overnight. It takes time but if you strive and show the Almighty you’re sincere, He will pave a way for you!

In this age of social media, it’s almost second nature for some to do good deeds and then show off to the world what they’ve done. Don’t! Try to keep it low key. Share it only with the Almighty. No matter how small it is, to Him it could weigh heavily on your scales!

We live in a society that is so judgemental. People will form their own conclusions of you based on a tweet or a status. They judge you on your appearance or even your accent. Just because you’re different from them, they look down on you. Stand your ground firmly but politely.

Don't run after those who’ve left you. Don’t be distracted by their departure. They’re gone for a reason. They have served their purpose. It’s part of the Almighty’s plans to bring new people into your life. He’s worked it all out so just go with the flow.

Remember, you don’t need people’s approval to be happy. If they have issues with you, it’s not about you, it’s about their insecurities. You don’t have to prove anything to anyone. Let it go or you’ll end up frustrated. Get your approval from the Almighty.

As we enter the halfway mark in #Ramadan, take stock of how you’re progressing. It’s never too late. The most crucial thing is to finish strong as we enter the last ten nights. Keep going. The Almighty knows and sees all your efforts, no matter how small. He will reward you.

There are some people who, no matter how good you are to them, it won’t make them good to you. That’s just the way they are.  Don’t stress over such people. They exist. Spread your goodness no matter what the circumstances. Nothing good is ever wasted. The Almighty’s All Knowing.

There are some who criticize others all the time. They’ve nothing good to say and just keep mentioning the faults of others. They’re like houseflies, which love trash and dirty places. They have a lot  of hatred and evil within themselves. They need help!

Don't put off till tomorrow what you should do today. When you have the “one day” attitude, you’ll miss out on what the Almighty has planned for you today. You refuse to see what He’s dangling in front of you, right here, right now. Don’t end up the loser!

Many chase their desires at the expense of obeying the Almighty. How can you forget that all that you’re chasing comes from Him? How can you disobey Him so blatantly and expect all your prayers to be answered? Don’t take things for granted. Show gratitude. He will give you more!

Let us be honest. This world is full of distractions; too many things vying for our attention. Discipline yourself to focus on what matters. Let go of those things which don’t. Have an “Almighty-first” mentality. Don’t just fit Him in. He’s right at the TOP.

Don't make light of your sin, no matter how small you think it is. Instead, reflect on it. Think of The One you've disobeyed. Seek His Mercy. If you keep procrastinating, you’ll slide deeper and deeper into sin. Repent today!

We expect the Almighty to fix all the mess we make. He's the Creator of Miracles and the Best of Planners. Yet we don't correct our mistakes. We repeat them! Let this #Ramadan be our turning point where we strive to put right all aspects of our life.

There are things in life, no matter how much you hang on to them, that aren’t meant to stay. So change may not be what you want but it’s what you need. Change is difficult but deciding to make the change may be the best thing for you. Seek the Almighty’s help and guidance always.

When life gets difficult and nothing seems to go your way, you can either get bitter or accept it and do your best. Bitterness keeps you stuck in the present situation. Let it go. Choose to move forward and keep positive, knowing that the Almighty has your back. Always!

Always trust the Almighty unconditionally. Remember, He made you. He knows everything about you. Don’t try to figure out everything on your own. You won’t be able to anyway.  Pour your heart out to Him. Make Him your priority and He will keep you on track. Get Him on your side.
Part of the Du'aa or Supplication from the prayers at the Grand Rashidiyyah Masjid in Dubai last night. @iacaddubai #Subhaanallah https://t.co/b9C9i71zUu
Part of the evening prayers at the Grand Rashidiyyah Masjid in Dubai last night. @iacaddubai #Subhaanallah https://t.co/IQPDRY2kwV

We're all perfectly imperfect! Don’t expect things the way you want it or the way you think it should happen. It won’t be like that. And don’t be too hard on yourself for not being perfect. Remember, if the Almighty had wanted us to be perfect, He would have made us angels!

An important lesson to remember - people you help, won’t necessarily help you back, even when you need it most. They’re not obliged to; but we expect them to! Instead, get your inner peace & contentment from your good deeds. If any good  comes back to you, it’s a bonus!

You may be in the depths of despair at the moment but remember, storms don’t last forever. They can shake you to your core. But they will pass. The Almighty has promised us, with hardship comes ease. So the rain will stop eventually and you’ll find peace after the chaos.

It's easy to just blurt out what you feel in the heat of the moment without any regard for others. But always remember, that it takes only a few seconds of hurtful words to penetrate deep into someone’s heart and they may take years to heal, if at all!

Don't do things out of fear of what others will say. You’re not answerable to people but to the One whom made you. Fear Him. Not His creation. Do things for His sake. Attaining sincerity with the Almighty is a journey, not an overnight process. Ask Him to help purify your intent.

Almighty. There’s nothing more we want in this life than a good death. A death where You’ll be  pleased with us. Take us only when we’re  in that condition. Help us to live this life in a way that pleases You. Keep us on Your Straight Path. Aameen.

Let go of your past. Don’t let it get to you. You’ve repented and moved on. The Almighty has forgiven you. Be kind to yourself. Focus on what’s happening right now and know that He’s keeping a close look out to ensure that everything falls  into place.

Respect other people’s time. We often have a very selfish attitude towards time in that we expect everyone to adjust their schedules around us but we won’t let anyone mess our day. Stop being self-centered & inflexible. Remember, what you give out, you will get back. Eventually!

In difficult times, it’s even more important than ever that you focus on the Almighty, with firm thoughts of faith. Be in the company of good, positive people who will spur you on with hope and encourage you.  Stay away from the negative ones who will only bring you down.

It's easy to complain about others but when we do this, we’re actually telling people about our own flaws as well. Learn to keep quiet unless you’re saying something truly out of kindness. Furthermore, it’s #Ramadan; so speak good or not at all.

Why is it so hard to forgive and rid your heart of the grudge and hatred. Will any of this matter when you’re in your grave and when you’re at the mercy of the Most Merciful? Let this #Ramadan be the healing that you need from all the dieseass of the heart. Don’t wait!

This #Ramadan, make a firm commitment to use words to build people up.  Stop using foul language and bad speech. Words are powerful. They leave a lasting impact. So let nothing else but good come out of your mouth. The effects will resonate far and wide.

In your darkest moments, when you feel that life is unfair and everyone has abandoned you, you have to remind yourself that the Almighty is always there. Remember, nothing will help you to reach Paradise except going through hardships with utmost patience and His Mercy.

Every day is a new beginning. It is the Almighty’s Mercy that you’re given another day, another #Ramadan. Stay away from what might have been and move on. Don't let negative words and actions of others affect you. Decide that today is going to be a good day. Live it!

Trials are given to test our faith. But it can be difficult not to look at someone & think that they have it easier than we do. Break away from that mentality. We can let our trials break us, make us bitter, or we can let it refine us & make us stronger. The choice is yours!

In your darkest moments, when you feel that life is unfair and everyone has abandoned you, you have to remind yourself that the Almighty is always there. Remember, nothing will help you to reach Paradise except going through hardships with utmost patience and His Mercy.

Remember, the Almighty doesn't make mistakes in His Plans. Every hardship you’ve experienced has served to make you the person that you are today. There are valuable lessons in everything that happens to you. Stop asking why it happened and focus on how you should respond.

We are mostly guilty of this; just rushing through our day and saying, “What’s next?” We have a mental checklist we need to get done and we don’t have time to stop and appreciate the Almighty’s many blessings. Stop and thank Him for life and for every breath you take!

This #Ramadan let us remove what doesn’t feel right in our lives. The Almighty knows our weakness and He knows how prone we are to committing sins. Speak to Him about your troubles. If you’re sincere in seeking His help, He will show you exactly how to return to Him.

Don't get drawn into arguments, petty squabbles and quarrels in #Ramadan. These sins may take away all of the reward and you’re left with nothing but merely hunger and thirst. Remain silent and dignified. The best best way to respond is to say, “I am fasting.”

For many people, their darkest days are normally the ones that get them closest to the Almighty. Their most profound experiences of worship will be when they’re on the brink of giving up; when they feel there are no options. Let’s change that and make Him our top priority always.

Remember #Ramadan is a month where the Doors of Mercy are wide open. So don't waste the opportunity. Repent sincerely. Now's the right time. Engage in self-reflection. Ask the Almighty to give us more patience  and compassion, to reboot our faith and cleanse our soul.

Read the signs when the Almighty’s telling you to move on. Don’t put a question mark where He has put a full stop. It’s not in our capacity to fully comprehend all that’s going on. But know that He will heal the pain and mend the heart!

Don't think #Ramadhan is for perfect souls. Seek the Almighty in whatever state you’re in; those in pain, the broken-hearted, those whose spirits are crushed. If you’ve taken that first step towards Him, know that He will come to your rescue each time!

Never think that the Almighty has forgotten about you. He’s All Knowing. He has seen the tears, the heartache and pain. None of it will be wasted. He will pave a way out for you and you’ll be stronger than before. Be patient!

Be kind to the person who made you feel small and tried to belittle you. It will cost you nothing. Be known for your compassion; touch others with your exemplary character and conduct. You’ll end up the winner!

The problem with us is that we tend to focus on what we don’t have. Train our minds to look at the positives. Our health, intellect, family & loved ones, wealth & so on. Satan is a genius at making us feel ungrateful. No matter how tough our day was, don’t fall into his trap.
The crescent clearly visible in my photograph taken over the #Maldives moments ago. My beloved brothers and sisters, have a blessed month of #Ramadhan. From #MuftiMenk https://t.co/o29IwVViH4

Not only is #Ramadan a month of Mercy & Forgiveness, it’s also a month of supplication. Don’t give up calling out to the Almighty for your needs. He hears. When the time is right, He shall bestow. Pray that He keeps away what is bad for us, no matter how desperately we want it.
Whether you have sighted the moon or not, I wish you all a blessed #Ramadan, filled with goodness and positive growth. May it be a month of reflection and introspection. Aameen

Not everyday is smooth sailing. There will be bumpy rides and life can get uncomfortable.  Although you can’t see what's ahead of you, know that the Almighty is always working and preparing you for what’s to come. Trust the process!

Don't let this world dictate to you what beauty is. A beautiful figure & fair skin don’t mean anything if you have a bad heart. Beauty is not what people see when they look at you; beauty is what they discover when they find out what is inside of you.
#PrayForGaza. It is ablaze with some of the worst, unprecedented violence in recent years. Many have lost their lives. Thousands are wounded. #StopTheBrutality

I am deeply saddened by the turn of events in #Surabaya. It is totally unacceptable. Terror has no religion, race or colour. My heart goes out to the victims and all affected. May the Almighty grant ease to all Indonesians.

It's only human to feel frustrated and dejected when things aren’t going your way. You feel like you’re carrying the weight of the world on your back. Sometimes we think the Almighty is not answering our prayers, but He is answering them; just not doing it the way we want.

Hypocrites love to gossip, they love to know what everyone else is doing; their in’s and out’s. They may even make up gossip if it’s not juicy enough. It can be hurtful and upsetting when you are the subject of the untruthful gossip. Confront them peacefully and pray for them!

At times we are so afraid of disappointing the people we love, that we often forget ourselves and our needs as well. Remember, we need love, compassion, kindness and goodwill just as much as others do.

Choose your battles. If you really want to correct someone’s unacceptable behaviour, be prepared for the worst. Not everyone will accept being told they’re wrong. You may end up much more embarrassed than them. Perhaps it’s best to just pray for them.

Learn to exercise patience in everything that you undertake. Patience is your capacity to tolerate delay; basically to wait. It is trusting that the Almighty will not let you down. He knows what He’s doing; no matter how long it takes and no matter what your purpose may be.

Seek peace and avoid conflict. This is a mark of honour in a person. When you give up arguing and crossing swords with others, especially when you’re right, you’ll be singled out by the Almighty. Be prepared for the bountiful blessings that await you.

Don't fret over what’s going on. Nothing lasts. Know that the dark days will give way to days of laughter, days where you will see the sun peeking out again. And gratitude will pour from your mouth because of what the Almighty has done to pull you through it all.

Don't waste precious time on things that will not bring you closer to the Almighty. Actions that do not contain benefit for yourself or those you interact with in general, are wasted actions. Always be mindful to spend your free time wisely. You’ll never get it back!

Almighty. Make us conscious of You, be it in secret or in public. We ask You to make us speak only the truth in times of pleasure and during anger. We ask you to make us mindful of the blessings you’ve given us and may we never take them for granted.

The preparators of the gruesome attack on a Mosque in Verulam, South Africa must be brought to justice. Such barbaric attacks are unacceptable. No matter what our differences, resorting to physical harm or killing is never an option. #respectall #interfaithharmony #DurbanAttack
